loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married Ugandan 28 year-old male with one child of three years.  He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop business selling electrical appliances and also earns from motorcycle transport as his side source of income. He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale status. Joseph describes himself as hardworking and intends to use the loan to buy wires, radios, phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy wires, radios, phones to sell.

loans.name: Mukisa

texts.en: Mukisa is a Ugandan male and married with eight children, all going to school and living in Kagadi, Uganda. His passion for agriculture led him to start a produce store in his home town to earn a daily income to support his family. Being in this business for over 10 years, he has been able to buy a motorcycle to start a transport business and pay fees for his children. He dreams of buying a car to help him in the transportation of his stock to the city and building a residential house for his family. Mukisa has asked for a loan to buy maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 36-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 15 years old. She describes herself to be a person who relates well to customers. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are reliable and loyal. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her standards of living. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 120,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another branch.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou, âgée de 57 ans s’active dans le domaine du commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elle a démarré avec un capital minime qui lui a juste permis d’acheter pour revendre quelque kilo de mil. C’était pour essayer, et voyant que cela lui réussissait, elle a augmenté la quantité, car elle avait reçu une forte demande. Elle a besoin d’un appui financier et s’est rapproché de l’IMCEC pour pouvoir acheter du mil et de l’arachide, et revendre.
Fatou est mariée et mère de famille, et grâce aux recettes de l’activité, elle réussi à payer la scolarité d’une de ses filles et appui en outre son époux. Elle désire encadrer ses enfants, afin qu’ils soient dans de meilleures conditions de vie et puissent réussir dans la vie.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou, who is 57, has been active in retail for several years. She started with a very small capital, which just allowed her to purchase a few kilos of millet for resale. She thus tested this business, and seeing how well it turned out for her, she increased quantities, since she had encountered such strong demand. She needs financial help and turned to IMCEC to be able to purchase millet and ground nuts to resell.

Fatou is married and mother. Thanks to profit from her business, she has been able to pay for one of her daughters’ schooling and to help her beyond what her husband can. She wishes to support her children, so that they enjoy better living conditions and are able to succeed.

loans.use: to buy cereals (millet and ground nuts) for resale.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is 28 years old and lives with his family in Gaza.  He has sold clothes since 2012 and works hard to support his family and provide good living conditions.

Imad asks  Ryada for this youth loan to buy a display box and shelves. These items will increase the number of stock he can showcase, and increase his income.  He will be able to improve the financial conditions for his family.  

Imad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a display box and shelves for his clothing business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 39 year-old woman, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her hometown is very populous and many people come from India. Mostly, people like to chew betel leaf, so that a few years ago her husband decided to open a paan shop to offer kinds of betel leaf to the people. He offers kinds of betel leaf such as sweet paan which consist of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), various spices, and tobacco paan which consist of powdered tobacco. 
He is expert for preparing pan because he has been running this shop for many years and a lot of customers like to take betel leaf prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income. 
Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, tobacco etc., to sell.

loans.use: To buy a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut powder, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), various spices and tobacco powder for Paan shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay 3 oxen and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste Sitor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jean Baptiste, marié et père de famille est un fonctionnaire qui s’active comme tout bon sérère dans l’agriculture, spécialement dans l’élevage de caprins. Cela fait plus de 10 ans qu’il achète, élève, pour revendre des chèvres, d’ailleurs, il a un enclos derrière la maison où il les élève. Il a besoin de ce crédit pour renouveler son cheptel car il écoule rapidement ses bêtes auprès de sa clientèle. Jean Baptiste est salarié et avec les revenus de son activité, il peut gérer normalement les besoins de sa famille car en dehors de sa femme et de ses enfants, il appuie aussi ses parents qui n’ont pas de grands moyens.
Jean Baptiste a un grand projet qui consiste à élever aussi des bœufs, des moutons, et il pense pouvoir le faire avec l’appui d’une Institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mr. Jean Baptiste, who is married and a father, is a civil servant who is like most Serer people involved in farming, especially in raising goats. He has been purchasing, raising, and reselling goats for over ten years; he even has an pen behind his house to raise them. He needs this loan to renew his livestock since he sells them rapidly to his clientele. Jean Baptiste is salaried and, with the extra revenues from his business, he can normally provide for his family needs, since in addition to his wife and children he also supports his parents, who are of modest means.

Jean Baptiste has great plans to also raise cows and sheep, which he thinks can come true with the help of a financial institution like IMCEC.

loans.use: purchase goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Santos Marcos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres viven con él y los otros 2 han formado sus propios hogares.

La agricultura, es el trabajo al cual se ha dedicado desde que tenía 10  años de edad, actividad que aprendió por su padre ya que él quería que sus hijos aprendieran este oficio y se los  enseñó para  que en un futuro pudieran defenderse. 
Para llegar al lugar de trabajo, Santos debe caminar una distancia de 20 minutos a pie, él solamente se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos se involucran en el trabajo cuando regresan de estudiar. Las actividades diarias las realiza de 6:00 AM hasta LAS 12:00 del MD y cuando sus hijos le ayudan lo hace de 4:00 a 5:30 y de esta forma avanzan mucho. 

Santos necesita de este crédito,  para comprar tres sacos de abono, pues quiere aprovechar que en una agroservicio está más barato, con la ayuda del crédito Santos estaría preparándose desde antes con el abono para las milpas y espera que haya buen inverno para sacar bien la cosecha. 

Él espera que con la ayuda de Dios, pueda seguir cultivando la tierra y que no le falten los ingresos económicos para mantener el hogar, pues cada cosecha que saca es por el sudor de su frente y es así como él desea seguir ganándose la vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and didn't have the opportunity to study. He has a live-in partner who does household chores. He has five children, three of whom live with him and the other two have started their own families.

He has worked as a farmer ever since he was 10 years old. He learned this trade from his father, since he wanted his children to learn this skill, which he taught them so that they could support themselves someday.
In order to get to his work site, Santos has to walk for 20 minutes on foot. His only line of work is agriculture, and his children get to work once they're back from school. He does his daily work from 6 a.m. to noon, and when his children help him, he works from 4 to 5:30, and thus they get a lot of work done.

Santos needs this loan in order to purchase three sacks of compost, because he wishes to take advantage of the fact that it's on sale at a farm supply store. With the help of this loan, Santos would be getting a head start in terms of compost for his corn crops, and he's hoping for a good winter in order to reap a good harvest.

He hopes that with help from God, he'll be able to keep on sowing the land and he won't lack the financial resources for supporting his family. He reaps each harvest because of his own hard work and that's how he wishes to continue to earn a living.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medical supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereal.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
Keo is a resident of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 65 years old and a mother of seven children. For a living, Keo and her husband grow rice, pineapple, and sugarcane as their main source of income. She can earn additional income as a paid worker. This business generates about 31,000 KHR per day. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years. 

Keo has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for eight loan cycles and has a successful repayment record. These past loans helped her to improve her family’s living conditions. For this loan cycle, Keo has teamed up in a group of three to get a new loan. Her group's total requested amount is 4,000,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is Keo's loan portion. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for reaping on her rice farm. Keo hopes to gain a better yield so as she is able to support her family on time.

loans.use: To pay for reaping on her rice farm

loans.name: Sausten

texts.en:
Fifty-eight-year-old Sausten has continued to grow his business. He has been a mobile money transfer agent the past five years in Zambia. This is Sausten’s third loan from Kiva.

He explains that Kiva has helped him grow the business beyond his expectations. When Sausten received his first loan, he used it to increase his working capital. The result was a rise in profit, which allowed him to sponsor his daughter's wedding and make infrastructure improvements at his existing shop. The second loan allowed Sausten to open an additional outlet in his hometown. Now, he employs one person to operate this shop and assist with the business.

He enjoys the business because he has the chance to interact with different people and provide a needed community service.  

Sausten is requesting his third Kiva loan to help him boost his working capital at his two shops; this will help him serve more customers and increase his profits. He anticipates the third loan will make a postive impact and improve the quality of service that he provides to his customer base.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business with capital to service more customers in his community who need financial services.

loans.name: Ramzan Bibi

texts.en:
Ramzan Bibi is a 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.
 
Ramzan Bibi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband is a shoe-maker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience about his profession. He sews shoes made of leather and rexine through sewing machine, after that he attaches their soles through stitching by his hands. In this way he is getting income for his family. 

He has been making shoes at home, now he established a shop to continue his business on a wider level. But he does not have the amount to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.

Therefore, Ramzan Bibi has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.
Her family has to do hard work to get income for a huge family. Her husbands also participate in monthly income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una persona muy trabajadora vive en un su casa en alquiler en La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente al servicio de camarera desempeñando funciones en un hotel. El comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 15:00 en la localidad de Nor yungas de la ciudad, La Srta. Liliana necesita el credito para la adquisicion de semillas y poder tener mas produccion y asi poder maximisar su produccion con mucha calidad y asi tener mejor ingresos.

El sueño de la Srta. Liliana es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liliana is a hardworking individual. She lives in a rented house in the District of Nor Yungas (Pacallo), which is located in the city of La Paz. Liliana works primarily as a waitress at a hotel. She begins her activities at 8:00 A.M. and finishes at 3:00 P.M. in the Nor Yungas section of the city. Srta. Liliana needs a loan so that he can buy seeds, which will allow her to have goods to maximize her production to the highest degree and generate more income.

Srta. Liliana dreams of having more income since she must sacrifice for her family. She wants to retire peacefully and hopes to have a pension that will enable her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es:
Marilyn es una persona muy trabajadora vive en un su casa en alquiler en la zona de Nor Yungas (Pacallo) ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente al servicio de camarera. El comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 15:00 en la localidad de Nor yungas de la ciudad, Marilyn necesita el credito para la adquisicion de semillas y poder tener mas produccion y asi poder maximisar su produccion con mucha calidad y asi tener mejor ingresos.

El sueño de la Srta. Marilyn es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking individual. She lives in a rented house in the District of Nor Yungas (Pacallo), which is located in the city of La Paz. Liliana works primarily as a waitress at the a hotel. She begins her activities at 8:00 A.M. and finishes at 3:00 P.M. in the Nor Yungas section of the city. Sr. Ronald needs a loan so that he can acquire seeds, which will allow him to have goods to maximize his production to the highest degree and generate more income.

Srta. Marilyn dreams of having more income since she must sacrifice for her family. She wants to retire peacefully and hopes to have a pension that will enable her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald es una persona muy trabajadora vive en un su casa en alquiler en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente al servicio de garzon. El comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 15:00 en la localidad de Nor yungas de la ciudad, El Sr. Ronald necesita el credito para poder acondicionar un almacen y acondinacion de tierras para poder maximisar su produccion con mucha calidad y asi tener mejor ingresos.

El sueño de la Sr. Ronald es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ronald is a hardworking individual who lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz. His primary job is that of a waiter. He begins his activities at 8:00 A.M. and finishes at 3:00 P.M. in the Nor Yungas section of the city. Sr. Ronald needs a loan so that he can set up a store and prepare the land around it so that he can maximize his production to a high degree and generate more income.

Ronald dreams of having more income since he must sacrifice for his family. He wants to retire peacefully and hopes to have a pension that will enable him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a store and prepare the land around it.

loans.name: Fallou

texts.fr:
Fallou est un jeune chauffeur âgé de 27 ans qui s’active depuis plus de 5 ans. Il possède une moto-taxi et vu que c’est une activité qui lui réussi pas mal, il a envie de doubler la mise et d’acheter une autre moto ; c’est d’ailleurs  l’objet de ce crédit. Avec une recette journalière de 3500 à 4000F, il peut régler ses petits besoins de célibataire, et puisse qu’il vit encore chez ses parents, participer à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Fallou, rêve de détenir un parc de moto- taxi et de gérer une grande entreprise de transport.
texts.en: Fallou is a young driver, 27 years old, who has been active for over five years. He owns a moto-taxi, and given that the [transport services] he provides is fairly successful for him, he thinks he'll double down and purchase another moto, thus the purpose of this loan. With a daily receipt of 3,500 to 4,000 francs, he can pay off the few bills of his an unmarried man. Also, since he still lives with his parents, he helps in managing the family's day-to-day expenses. Fallou dreams of having a fleet of moto-taxis and managing a large transport company.

loans.use: to purchase a moto for providing transport services

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal, 34 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children, four of whom are going to school, and the remaining one is still very young. She and her spouse have been engaged in rice husbandry for almost 14 years, and earning an income of 25,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each per day. Their profits are usually spent on their food, home bills and school allowances of their children.

Sal wants to obtain a loan to improve sanitation practices for her household, but she has insufficient capital to make it possible. That’s why she is asking for a loan amounting to KHR 4,000,000 to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members and buy its necessities. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sal is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members and buy its necessities.

loans.name: Shehab

texts.en:
Shehab is 21 years old; he lives in Nablus. He sells construction supplies, and he has been involved in the retail business for many years. He still needs a lot of improvement, so he is requesting this youth loan to purchase more goods and expand his shop, so he would be able to increase his stock and meet his customers' needs. This will increase his income and lead to improvement of the financial conditions for his family.  

Shehab is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and expand his shop.

loans.name: Churok

texts.ru: Чурок 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. Старшие два сына живут и подрабатывают в столице Кыргызстана, остальные дети живут с родителями. У Чурок - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чурок занимается животноводством, стартовав 39 лет назад, с покупки скота на 300 сом KGS. Сама Чурок и ее супруг долгое время работали чабанами, пасли скот местного населения за определенную плату, в связи с этим опыт в животноводстве большой. Благодаря упорному труду Чурок, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 45 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чурок обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чурок планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Churok is 58 years old, married and raising 6 children together with her husband. Two of the oldest sons live and work in the capital of Kyrgyzstan, and the rest of the children live with the parents.  Churok has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 39 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 300 som (KGS). Churok and her husband spent a long time working as shepherds, taking local residents' livestock to pasture for a set fee, and, hence, have a lot of experience in animal husbandry.  Thanks to Churok's hard work, today her business contains 4 dairy cows and 45 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Churok requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount. Churok plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucara, una ciudad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a realizar trabajos como maestro de obra, cuenta con clientela reconocida de la zona, los trabajos los realiza en el distrito de Pucara, adicionalmente brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros mediante su mototaxi, obteniendo así ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Apolinar a solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas para su mototaxi que le permitirán ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Apolinar is 51 years old and lives with his wife in the District of Pucara. The city has a warm climate and the people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located two hours away from Jaén Province in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Apolinar works as a master builder and is known among his customers in the area. He performs his work in the District of Pucara. In addition, he provides transportation services to passengers with the use of his motorcycle taxi. This enables him to earn additional income for his family.

Apolinar is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy equipment for his motorcycle taxi, which will allow him to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 34-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be loyal and generous. She operates a food stall where she cooks potato chips for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of potatoes, charcoal and cooking oil. Her business goal is to have a restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will save for a better life. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, charcoal and cooking oil

loans.name: Johnmary

texts.en:
Johnmary is a thirty-eight-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce selling as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses, such as plastic chair-hiring, where he earns an extra income. 

He started these businesses to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces a challenge of competition and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern store.

Johnmary is requesting a loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Phoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Phoeurng is 55 years old and also a mother of five children. Currently, only four of her children are under her care - one of them is in school and the three others help with the family’s business. For the sake of her family, Phoeurng farms rice on five hectares of farmland as her primary source of income and also works for others for a fee as a secondary source of income. 

Phoeurng has taken loans for three past loan cycles and has a successful repayment history. She has formed a group of two to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, her living conditions are getting better. For this loan cycle, Phoeurng is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Phoeurng will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline for her rice farming. She hopes that her rice crop yield will be better than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline for her rice farming

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en:
Nomi is a 28-year-old mother of two daughters and a son. Her husband owns a workshop and services rickshaws.  He is a professional and can easily fix engine problems in no time. This maintenance requires various types of tools.   A few days ago he moved his workshop to another place, lost some important and expensive tools, and needs to replace them.  The tools include: a Philips screw driver, flat blade screw drivers, drill machine, pliers, socket & ratchet set, heat gun, try square, G clump, and hammer,  Nomi requests a loan for her husband to compensate for this loss. 

Nomi wants to provide a better education and living standard to her children. She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this loan in a positive way and his monthly income will increase.  

Nomi thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair rickshaws.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 60-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his son with purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of seven children and motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses. Her son has been learning the art of dealing with the customers, products rates, and how to tackle the customers, from his father. She thinks that now her son can handle all affairs alone; so she decided to set up a separate shop for her son.
 
Therefore, she has requested a loan for her son from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy initial stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and a regular client of BRAC Pakistan. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC

loans.use: to set up a general store for her son.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 26-year-old Palestinian. He lives with his wife, four children and his mother in Fawwar. This is a Palestinian town and refugee camp in the Hebron Governorate located six kilometers southwest of Hebron in the southern West Bank. The camp holds more than 8,000 registered refugees.

Bashar has been building a house for his family. They are living with relatives until it is finished. Bashar is applying for a 5,000 USD loan through Ryada to be used to plaster the ceiling and install doors and windows because he doesn’t have enough money to buy the materials he needs.

Bashar wishes to say he is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs for the house he is building.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 27-year-old married man with two children.  He runs a retail shop in Kangemi and has been in this business for four years. Paul earns a monthly income of sixty thousand shillings.

This will be Paul's second loan from Visionfund Kenya and he plans to re-stock sugar, rice, and cooking oil. 

In the future, he wants to be a successful business man.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, cooking fat, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Sokkhim

texts.en:
Sokkhim, 39, is a borrower from Kampong Cham province where she grows crops. She is also a mother of three dependent children who are in school.  

Her main source of income is from growing soybean and cassava. This agribusiness has generated 40,000 KHR in the last two years.  

Sokkhim’s previous loan is the original loan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner.   The positive impact of this loan enabled her to support her cassava business.

She requests 2,000,000 KHR  with VisionFund/Kiva’s partner. She will  buy poles to plant peppers. 

She hopes to increase her family’s income so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy poles to plant peppers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru:
Турсуной позитивная и отзывчивая женщина. Она всегда имеет желание помогать людям, которые нуждаются в помощи. Живёт Турсуной в сельском посёлке. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Дети очень любят Турсуной, потому что она является заботливой матерью. По профессии Турсуной учительница. Она работает в местной школе, её также любят все ученики. Муж Турсуной также работает преподавателем в этой же школе. Но чтобы качественно удовлетворять все нужды семьи, одной заработной платы учителей не хватает. Поэтому Турсуной решила заняться дополнительным делом. Она вместе со своим мужем ведёт бизнес животноводство.

Турсуной вот уже как с 2011 года сотрудничает с Арванд. В первый раз она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить первую корову для откармливания. И по сей день она является ответственным клиентом Арванд. Занимаясь откармливанием  скота она улучшила качество своей жизни. Сейчас она имеет желание  достроить две комнаты для детей в своём небольшом доме, чтобы в этом доме было больше места для проживания. Но у неё недостаточно собственных средств для этого. Поэтому в очередной раз Турсуной обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для постройки своего дома. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Tursunoy is a positive and kind-hearted woman. She always has the desire to help people in need. Tursunoy lives in rural village. She is married and has four children. Tursunoy's children really love her because she is an attentive mother. Tursunoy is a teacher by profession. She works in a local school and all of her students also love her. Tursunoy's husband also works as a teacher in the same school. But in order to completely satisfy the needs of the family, one teacher's salary is not enough. This is why Tursunoy decided to take up an additional occupation. She, together with her husband, runs a livestock breeding business.

Tursunoy has partnered with Arvand since 2011. The first time, she requested a loan to buy her first cow for fattening up. She has been a responsible client of Arvand thus far. By being in the business of fattening up cattle, she has been able to improve the quality of her life. Now, she has the desire to build two rooms for her children in her small house, so that there will be more living space in her home. But she does not have enough personal funds for this. This is why Tursunoy has requested a loan from Arvand this time around to buy construction materials for adding on to her home. She thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him  continue his business. 

Rukhsana is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TIENCELA commune de BENKO préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce céréale, de condiment, de lait et d’encens. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt a SORO YIRIWASO, Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente ASSAN la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales, chose qu’elle a hérite de son père. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs de maïs sur place avec les paysans du village et les revendre. La vente se fait en détail chez elle à clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000Fcfa qui sera en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste dans l’élevage de petits animaux.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI is composed of married women, who average 38 years of age and 4 children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of TIENCELA, in Commune de BENKO, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, milk, and incenses. 

The women of the group TIESSIRI are on their third solidarity loan. For satisfying the enormous customer demand, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, ASSAN, the person standing in the middle, did not go to school. She is currently a vendor of grains. It is a business passed down to her by her father. She intends to purchase 4 sacks of corn locally from peasant farmers of the village and then to resell the goods. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base at her home. 

She plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will in part be reinvested in her business. The rest will be for small animal husbandry.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, 54,is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Juancho and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merlita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. She also sells frozen foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She requests 50,000 PHP to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Merlita dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will always be in good health.  She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business.  She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is a local villager from Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 34-year-old mother of three children.  One child is in school and the other two children are too young.  

To deal with the cost of daily living, she grows rice and raises pigs as the main source of income. To supplement her income, her husband is a construction worker during his spare time. 

This is the original loan for Khoeurn with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner.  She asks for this loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting and to buy more piglets to raise. 

She hopes that she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting and to buy pigs to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Cho's Group

texts.en:
Cho is a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He is 22 years old and single. To make a living, he grows rice as his main source of income. After several years of involvement in his current business, he makes about 18,800 KHR per day. Cho is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  

The original loan, which he has fully repaid, helped him to improve his lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, he is leading a group of three to get a new loan through VisionFund. He is seeking a new loan amount totaling 3,200,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is his loan portion. As the leader, he will spend his portion to pay for the plowing of his farmland. He hopes that his rice crop will provide a good yield to help him increase his income.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing of his farmland.

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
This is Medie, 40, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arthur, an auctioneer, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manage her household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Medie maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as shampoos, colognes, deodorants, perfumes, soaps, fabric softeners, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. 

Medie dreams that her business will grow bigger, and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, and undergarments needed in her business.

loans.name: Nietasso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NIETASSO est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de DJAMBOUGOU, commune de MARKA COUNGO, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de charbon, de condiment, et de fruits et légumes. Les femmes du groupe NIETASSO sont à leurs quatrièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MAGNE la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de dah depuis trois ans. Elle compte acheter avec son argent 4 kg de dah au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 11 000Fcfa par mois qui seront en partie réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group NIETASSO is composed of married women, who average 39 years of age and 3 children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of DJAMBOUGOU, in Commune de MARKA COUNGO, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, charcoal, condiments, and fruit & vegetables. 

The women of the group NIETASSO are on their fourth solidarity loan. For satisfying the enormous customer demand, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  

This client, MAGNE, the first person standing at the right, is illiterate. After having attempted several revenue-generating businesses without success, she is currently a vendor of 'dah' [dried hibsicus flowers]. She has been in this business for three years. She intends to use her money to purchase 4 kg of 'dah' at the weekly market. Sales are made to a mixed customer base at the village market. 

She plans on making a profit of 11,000 francs CFA per month. Part of it will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase 'dah' (dried hibiscus flowers).

loans.name: Indrit

texts.en:
Indrit is married and a father of a two-year-old. He will use this loan to repair his family home. He was photographed in front of the animal stable. Indrit’s main activity is agriculture/livestock; he has one dairy cow and five goats. He sells raw milk and other homemade dairy products to the farmers market of a nearby city and that of a little town also. In addition to the livestock, he has grapevines, cherry and plum orchards and occasionally goes to Greece for seasonal work. He also works in construction in his village. 

Here is what he said to the branch assistant who interviewed him: “I try very hard to support my family. Sometimes I work simultaneously in two or three jobs. Yet, I am happy; I don’t complain.”

His village is known for making delicious composts of peaches, plums, etc. and also for making one of the best wines in the region.

loans.use: to repair his run-down family home

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana, age 42, is a mother of six children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery materials to sell. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult. 

For that his wife, Ramzana, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials, like colorful threads, various buttons and laces, etc. Ramzana is happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials, like colorful threads, various buttons and laces, etc.

loans.name: Ivania Margina

texts.es: Ivania Margina es mayor de edad, con unión libre, con dos hijos menores aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país. Ivania Margina es una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsable con sus obligaciones; propietaria de un tramo ubicado en uno de los mercados de este municipio, en el cual ella ofrece sus productos tales como: ropa nueva, calzado, cosméticos, entre otros productos. Sus compras las realiza en mercados de otra ciudad, y ha camionetas repartidoras, y las realiza al contado; sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo de este crédito es para suplir con las demandas de los clientes e invertir en mercadería en general como: ropa nueva, calzado, gorras entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Ivania Margina is an adult woman who lives with her partner and two minor children, who are under her responsibility. She is original from one of the municipalities in Chinandega, located to the East of the country. Ivania Margina is very hard-working, honest and responsible. She owns a space in one of the markets in the municipality, where she offers her products: new clothes, shoes and cosmetics, among others. She buys the items in another town's market or to distributing vans, and pays in cash. She sells in cash or on credit to regular or occasional customers. 

She will use this loan to buy goods, such as new clothes, shoes and hats, among others, so that she can meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in a variety of styles, among other products.

loans.name: Om-Tamer Group

texts.en: The Om-Tamer group consists of five females from Hodeidah, Yemen. Seham, 21 years old, is a married woman. She works hard to assist her husband in providing for the family. She started her job by creating homemade henna items, like mixing perfumes and creams which are used by brides for their wedding. She sells it to retailers, customers and door to door. Any shortages of her product items will cause her job to stop. That is why she has applied for a loan to buy the required henna items to continue her business. All members of the group are hoping to earn a good income which will allow them to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the required henna items to continue her business.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is a resident from Srey Santhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is 64 years old and a mother of four children. However, only one son still counts on her as he is still in school. The main sources of her income are from rice farming and her occupation as a school teacher. She has been doing this for 30 years and it has returned her almost 4.50 USD per day. 

The main challenge for her is the shortage of financial support for her son who wants to pursue a bachelors degree. Therefore, she is applying for an education loan as a first time loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to cover tuition fees for her son. She hopes that he can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a pork joint owner, is married, with five children aged between 12 years and two years. He is 38 years old and he has been in this business for ten years, having started with a farming business that he still does to supplement his income. His major dream is to educate his children such that they can be independent in the future.

John is requesting a loan to buy pigs for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughter.

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu is a 39-year-old married woman. She has five children. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as transport problems. 

Mwanatibu will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She  will use the anticipated profits to open a hotel.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Dergham

texts.en:
Dergham is a 38-year-old married father of three children who has worked in agriculture for fourteen years. He has a small farm where he raises livestock that are his only source of a living. He is a hard worker and well known in his region with a special reputation for the quality of products he provides.

He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his mother's funeral expenses that weren't expected, and he wasn't saving extra money for unexpected occasions. Dergham is his family's sole breadwinner, and that's why he has to work hard on developing his business to make sure that it will cover his family's needs and expectations.

loans.use: To pay the expenses of his mother's funeral.

loans.name: Babu Baber

texts.en:
Babu Baber is 35 and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. He is running a small business in a nearby town providing services in the form of running a grinding stone.  He speaks in a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built very good relations with his customers. His grinding stone shop is very famous in the town, which is the reason his business is running well. Due to his good relations with his customers, his sales have increased a lot. He sells flour in the shop as well, so he needs wheat to increase his stock of flour in his shop.
 
Babu Baber is the sole earner in his family and he has been providing financial support to his whole family by himself. His expenses are increasing day by day because his children are in school. Therefore, Babu Baber has requested a loan to buy more wheat and a grinding stone (machine). In this way, he can meet his financial requirements.
 
Babu Baber hopes that the lenders support him in the expansion of his business. He is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more wheat and a grinding stone

loans.name: Asia Bano's Group

texts.en:
Asia Bano is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s food business. He sells laddo (Laddu or Laddoo is a ball-shaped recipe popular in the Pakistan subcontinent as well as in regions with immigrants from the Subcontinent. Laddu is made of graham flour, spices and salt, with other ingredients that vary by recipe). 

He uses a four-wheeled manual cart for selling, because as a hawker he can easily reach near the people. Due to good taste he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. He wants to offer his recipe from a small stall instead of his four-wheeled cart, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a wooden stall and more ingredients for making laddoo.

Asia Bano requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a wooden stall, graham flour, cauliflower, onion and ketchup. She feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She wants to save the extra profit amount so that she could utilize these savings for sudden future needs.

loans.use: To buy a wooden stall, graham flour, cauliflower, onions and ketchup.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small truck.

loans.name: Roly

texts.es:
Roly Raul brinda sus servicios en la elaboracion de panes y de la cocina de supervisor, mezcla ingredientes para hacer la masa y hornear panecillos, masa para galletas, cortezas, ingredientes, la formación de hielo, y otros productos preparados. Completa todos los pedidos especiales según sea necesario, con ingredientes de buena calidad.

El vive en casa de sus padres en La Paz, aproximadamente a media hora del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Roly Raul es especializarse en el area de administracion de empresas y abrir una panificadora de renombre. Asi completar sus estudios y mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Roly Raul provides bakery services as a kitchen supervisor, preparing breads, mixing ingredients to make dough and bake muffins, cookies, crusts, and their ingredients. He also makes icing and other bakery products. He fills all of the special orders he takes as needed using good quality ingredients.
He lives in his parents' home in La Paz, about a half hour from downtown La Paz.

Roly Paul's dream is to specialize in the area of business administration and open a renowned bakery. He would like to complete his studies and improve his income and quality of life. 
It is the first time he is apply for a loan with IMPRO and his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his bakery (flour, salt, and other things in bulk)

loans.name: Sagrada Familia. Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está conformada por 08 socios responsables y emprendedores. Hilda de 54 años es casada y  tiene 02 hijos independientes. Ella brinda servicio de costura de prendas de vestir, se viene desempeñando hace más de 6 año donde le va bien. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido brindarles educación a sus hijos El deseo de Hilda es de seguir implementando su negocio y llegar a capturar más  clientes. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de materiales  como hilos, agujas, reglas y tijeras. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” agradece  por hacer posible este crédito. Hilda se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color fucsia.
texts.en: The “Sagrada Familia” group is made up of 8 responsible and enterprising members.  Hilda is 54 years old, married, and has two adult children.  She provides tailoring services and has been doing so for more than six years.  Things are going well for her.  Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to provide her children with an education.  Hilda wants to continue with her business and bring in more customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy things like thread, needles, rulers, and scissors.  The “Sagrada Familia” group is grateful for doing what’s possible on this loan.  Hilda is seated, first to the left.  She is wearing fuchsia.

loans.use: to buy things like thread, needles, rulers, and scissors for her tailoring services

loans.name: Faride

texts.es:
Faride es soltera no tiene hijos vive en casa de sus padres se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel tecnico medio. Trabja en Credinfor como asistente. Con los ingresos que tiene cubre con sus gastos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una lap top.Ya que ella se encuetra estudiando.
El sueño de Faride es terminar una carera a nivel licenciatura.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Faride is single and has no children. She lives in her parents' home in the city of El Alto. 
She has studied to the level of mid-level technician. She works as an assistant in Credinfor. This income is used to cover expenses.
This loan will be used to purchase a laptop. She is already in school.
Faride's dream is to study for a career at the undergraduate level. 

It is the first time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Hrachuhi

texts.en:
Hrachuhi lives in Lor village with her husband and two sons (her elder son is in the photo). She works at the local village school and also is involved in agriculture. The farm that they own includes cows, calves, chickens and colonies of bees. Hrachuhi also cultivates wheat, potatoes and grass. She took out a Kiva loan from SEF last year and successfully paid it back. The cooperation with Kiva was very helpful for Hrachuhi and she was a very responsible client.
She has now applied for this loan to purchase 40 more colonies of bees and forage for the livestock. This will enable her to increase the income from agriculture and cover costs. 
Hrachuhi hopes for lenders' support one more time.

loans.use: to pay for 40 colonies of bees and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: José Hipólito

texts.es:
José tiene 27 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado pues la situación económica que pasaba su familia no le permitió seguir estudiando, él está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 2 hijos, una niña de 6 años y un niño de 5 años que actualmente están estudiando preparatoria en la escuela, en su vivienda solo habitan su dos hijos, su esposa y él.  
 
José se dedica al trabajo de estructuras metálicas como soldador, él manifiesta que tiene aproximadamente 12 años de experiencia en esta área, él decidió montar su propio taller desde hace cinco años, hoy en día tiene mucha clientela a quienes presta sus servicios, el taller está en su casa y eso le facilita para no movilizarse a otros lugares a trabajar. Él aprendió esta actividad cuando trabajaba de ayudante en otro taller, y vio que era una actividad bastante productiva, además se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de granos básicos para su familia. 

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para invertirlo en su negocio de estructuras metálicas, específicamente comprará hierro que es su materia prima para trabajar. El préstamo le permitirá una mayor calidad en sus trabajos y mayores ganancias, esto es una necesidad que José tenía desde hace varios meses. 

Él tiene muchos propósitos a futuro, pues desea tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos y su esposa, sueña con una casa digna para ellos, desea también ampliar más su negocio de estructuras metálicas y darles la oportunidad a otras personas de trabajar con él, para ofrecer un mejor servicio  a los clientes, y para sus hijos desea lo mejor, que sean personas de bien y que logren terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
José, age 27, went to school through the seventh grade.  His family’s financial situation did not allow him to continue his studies.  He is married, and his wife devotes herself to the domestic chores.  They have two children, a six year old daughter and a five year old son.  The children currently attend school.  Only his two children, his wife, and he live at their house.

José works as a welder with metal structures.  He indicates that he has approximately 12 years of experience in this area.  He decided to establish his own shop five years ago.  He now has a lot of customers to whom he provides his services.  The shop is at his house, and this helps because he does not have to go to other places to work.  He learned this business activity when he worked as a helper in another shop.  He saw that it was a very productive activity.  He also grows basic grains for his family.

He needs the loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo to invest in his structural metal business.  Specifically, he will buy iron, which is the raw material that he uses for work.  The loan will allow him better quality in his jobs and greater income.  This is a need that José has had for several months.

He has many plans for the future.  He wishes to have a better quality of life for his children and his wife.  He dreams of a decent house for them.  Also, he wishes to expand his structural metal business and give other people the opportunity to work with him.  He wants to do this to provide better service to his customers.  He wishes the best for his children.  He wants them to be good people who manage to finish their education.

loans.use: to buy iron, which is the raw material that he uses for work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, fruit, and cooking oil

loans.name: Orangel Adonay

texts.es:
Orangel es un joven 19 años de edad, acaba de finalizar los estudios de bachillerato, está soltero y vive en el área rural, actualmente está acompañado y vive con sus padres y su compañera de vida.

La agricultura, es la actividad a la cual se ha dedicado el joven Orangel desde que tenía 16 años, desde entonces comenzó a ayudarle a su padre, quien toda su vida se dedicó a la misma actividad, además el trabajo está cerca de su casa, cultivar maíz ha sido una tradición familiar, siembran cuatro hectáreas de terreno y este año quieren sembrar cinco hectáreas mas.

Orangel necesita de este crédito para invertirtirlo en la siembra de otra hectárea de maíz,  esto le permitiriá mejorar su nivel de vida pues tendrá un mayor ingreso económico, el cual servirá para poder pagar las cuotas del crédito y ayudar un poco mas a sus padres, pues es a ellos a quienes les debe todo.

Él sueña con que sus padres ya no trabajen  y ser él quien les brinde la ayuda economica, pues sus padres se han esforzado durante toda su vida, y Orangel prefiere que ya no vayan al campo a trabajar pues merecen descansar, y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda del crédito por que podrá trabajar, y mejorará sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Orangel is a 19-year old young man who has just graduated from high-school. He is single and lives in the rural area with his parents and life partner. He has worked in agriculture since he was 16 years old, when he started to help his father who had been in this activity his whole life. Corn cultivation has become a family tradition and they have a field close to home. They normally cultivate four hectares, but want to do five more this year. 

Orangel needs this loan to invest in the cultivation of an extra hectare of corn. This will allow him to improve his quality of life thanks to a higher income. He will be able to pay the loan installments and help his parents, to whom he owes everything. 

His dream is to see his parents retired and to become their financial support. They have worked very hard their whole lives and Orangel prefers that they don't go to the field anymore and rest. He thinks this would be possible with the loan because he could work and increase his income.

loans.use: to invest in an extra hectare of corn sowing.

loans.name: Saveth

texts.en:
Saveth is a borrower from Kampong Cham province. She is 47 years old and a mother of five children. To feed her family, she does rice cropping on a half hectare of farmland. To assist her in earning more income, her husband catches fish to sell.  

This is the first loan for Saveth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay her son's tuition fee. He is studying in a local university, majoring in Banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal Province, An is in her mid 50s and a mother of six children. She is a local farmer who grows cucumbers and watermelon as the main sources of her income. She supplements her income by working for others for a fee. The business that she has had for ages currently returns her about 2,500 KHR per day. 

Now, she is teaming up with a large group consisting of six borrowers to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan that she has paid back completely enabled her to support and improve her business gradually. 

Now, the total amount of the loan requested by the entire group is 6,000,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is An's loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, insecticide and fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy seed, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a member of a two-person lending group. She is a housewife and a mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a retailer. He owns a general store where he sells a wide variety of goods like sugar, rice, beans, spices, and biscuits. He is a very hardworking person. 

Nusrat has requested a loan for her husband's general store as the he does not have enough savings to purchase more goods to sell in the store. With the help of this loan, Nusrat would purchase rice and a variety of spices to sell. She hopes that this loan will be helpful for her husband's business. Nusrat dreams of providing a quality education to her children She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods, such as rice and spices, for selling.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a young and kind 36-year-old woman. She is married and has a daughter. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He has his own business to earn a regular income in the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling wooden furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business over ten years ago. Her husband had previously obtained loans for his business. He used two previous loans to add to his selection of furniture. Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to cope with the increasing demand.

Therefore, Tahira contacted BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for her husband to make furniture. Tahira hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy raw material for furniture making.

loans.name: Waleed Group

texts.en: This group, called Waleed Group, consists of four members, all female.  All their projects are home-based and they have many clients, mostly women. They are from Hodeidah, Yemen.  Amnah, the group leader, is a 52-year-old woman who is married and the mother of an adult child. She has been practicing her profession of making women's clothes for a long time. Her main business is tailoring and, due to her good reputation, she gained experience in a sewing lab until she was skilled enough to buy a sewing machine in order to open her business. She took a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase textile fabrics, dresses and other basic materials needed for her business. In the future, she plans to open a big new sewing shop to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, dresses and other basic materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Maya Group

texts.en:
The Maya Group is composed of five dedicated members who are pursuing a second loan cycle. Each of the products offered by the members of the Maya Group are high demand items like milk products, food items made from ground corn, shoes, snacks and textiles. Overall, the group continues to look toward a brighter financial future while utilizing the continued practical advice and training the group members receive from their Namaste Guatemaya business consultants.

Veronica (third from left), forty-nine years old, is a single mother of two with a fourth grade education. Not only is she responsible for her own family of three, but she also cares for the child of her cousin who passed away. Her rented home is located in front of the municipal public market. She knows that living and working close to this hub of activity is a great advantage. Veronica was inspired to diversify her food sales and take advantage of the proximity to the market, which allows her to obtain any type of meat now in popular demand. In fact, the sale of beef organs is her target during the lunch hour and into the evening. During the mornings, she focuses on selling her handmade corn tortillas and chocolate–covered bananas. Her big dream is to reintroduce the sale of “chile rellenos” (a very popular Guatemalan food item) into her business. Veronica knows that the sale of this particular cooked dish will help her business grow as she has enjoyed previous success in the past when she sold them. Because of her determination, organizational skills and great location, she has made her business profitable. Her current profits are 2755 Guatemalan Quetzales, which she hopes to increase by 15%. She wants to invest her loan to buy a larger, new refrigerator to better serve her clientele and take advantage of the size of the current site she now uses.

loans.use: to buy a larger, new refrigerator to better serve her clientele and take advantage of the size of the current site she now uses

loans.name: Jwahr Group

texts.en:
Jwahr Group consists of four women from Hodeida, Yemen. They are applying for a 90,000 YER loan through Al-Amal to buy women's clothes to sell. The loan will be split among them.

Samira, 31, is a member of this group. She knows how to read and write. She works very hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing, but unfortunately the money she makes is really not enough to support the family adequately.

Three years ago, Samira  started going door-to-door selling clothes that only earned her a small income. Now, she intends to expand her business. For this reason she will receive a 20,000 YER portion of the loan to buy more clothes to use for her business. She hopes that she will make a profit selling a lot of clothes to new clients in different places in her city.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to use for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan Pablo es una persona muy trabajadora vive en casa en alquiler en la ciudad de La Paz.  Trabaja como recepcionista. Juan Pablo tambien se dedica al negocio de semillas, por eso necesita credito, para comprar semillas y poder tener mas produccion y asi poder maximisar su produccion con mucha calidad y asi tener mejor ingresos.

El sueño del Sr. Juan Pablo es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is a very hard-working person. He rents a home in the city of La Paz. He mainly works as a receptionist. He also has a seed business. Juan Pablo needs this loan for the purchase of seeds in order to have a greater production and to maximize his quality production. This will allow him to have a better income.
Juan Pablo's dream is to be able to have a greater income given all his family's sacrifices. He hopes to have a calm life. He hopes to have money for his old age that will allow him to have an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire seeds for his business.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovana es soltera  no tiene  hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella acabo sus estudios secundario, actualmente es alumna del tercer semestre de la carrera de comercio Internacional de la universidad Tecnologica Bolviana. Ella para cubrir los gastos universitarios vende verduras  los fines de semana en Chulumani, viaja con su hermana mayor ya que tienen un puesto ya fijo. Por eso los gastos del viaje son menores.
El crédito lo requiere para la cancelacion de mesualidades universitarios ya que cuenta con  un descuento. 
El sueño de Giovana es terminar su carrera y hacer diplomados para enriquecer sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Giovana is single and has no children. She lives at her parents’ house, which is located in the city of El Alto.

Giovana is finishing her higher education. She is currently a third-semester student for a degree in International Business at La Universidad Tecnologica Boliviana. In order to cover her university expenses, she sells vegetables on the weekends in Chulumani. She travels with her older sister since they have an established vending stall, so she is able to save on transportation expenses.

The loan she is requesting will be used to take care of her university expenses so that her payments can be reduced. Giovana dreams of finishing her degree and graduating so that she can utilize her knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es casado y tiene dos hijos que estudian en la universidad, viven en una  casa alquilada, la casa se encuentra ubicada  en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día como empleado en una empresa privada,ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación, alquiler y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo necesita para invertir en el pago de posgrado en la universidad de su hijo por que con los ingresos que tiene no le alcanza para cubrir ese gasto,ya que es el único que solventa a toda su familia.
El sueño de Carlos es tener casa propia ya que desea brindar mas comodidad y seguridad a su familia, mas que todo darles estabilidad ya que le resulta muy difícil el tener que trasladarse.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos is married with two children who are in university. He lives in a rented home located in the Irpavi zone of the city of La Paz.
He currently works more than eight hours per day as an employee in a private company. He has to cover the food, education, rent, and basic service costs of his family.
He needs a loan to invest in the payment of his son's post-graduate education. Carlos' income is not enough to cover the cost; he is the only provider for the family.
Carlos' dream is to have his own home because he wants to provide his family with more comfort and security. Above all, he wants to give them stability because it has been very difficult to move.
This is his third time working with IMPRO and his second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for post-graduate studies.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 41 years old and from Antequera, Bohol. She is married and has four children, ages 10-17. Caroline is engaged in a food vending business, mostly selling snacks like siakoy (fried dough sprinkled with sugar). This has been her business for eight years now. 

Caroline is asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar, margarine, lard, vanilla, and Tupperware. She hopes that with all her hard work, she can give her children a better future. Caroline's income will be used for her family's healthy meals and school fees.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, margarine, lard, vanilla, and Tupperware

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 49-year-old married woman. She has five children, ranging in age from 8 to 26 years old. Doris describes herself as innovative. She operates a grocery store where she sells mangoes and plums. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a highly populated place and her primary customers are the general public. Doris describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Doris will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of plums and mangoes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future she will buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plums and mangoes

loans.name: Nodirakhon

texts.en: Nodiarkhon, 24, is a hard-working woman who is married but does not have any children. Her husband is a decorator. Nodiarkhon works in a school as a  teacher. Nodirakhon is also a student studying politics and business at Tajik State University. She is going to get a higher degree. Nodirakhon must pay her tuition but she has no money. Nodirakhon is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Nick

texts.en: Nick is a 26-year-old married father of one child. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle

loans.name: Samuel Enrique

texts.es: El señor Samuel es una persona responsable que supo salir adelante a pesar de lo difícil que fue su niñez ya que a muy corta edad falleció su padre en un accidente y hace 5 años su madre murió de una enfermedad, actualmente vive en la casa de sus papas con sus hermanos, no tiene hijos que dependan de sus  ingresos lo cual hace que sus gastos no aumenten, el cliente se dedica a la prestación de servicios de moto taxi en una empresa de la ciudad de Cochabamba solo por las noches de miércoles a domingo, y durante el día trabaja en una empresa de Aviación, se esfuerza mucho solo para poder cumplir con algunas de sus metas como poder tener un auto o una casa propia, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar una nueva moto para trabajar con ella, ya que la que tiene actualmente está fallando y presenta problemas, lo que le impide trabajar de forma eficiente y generar mayores ingresos para incrementar su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is a responsible man who was able to get ahead despite the difficulties of his childhood. His father passed away in an accident when he was very young and his mother passed away five years ago from an illness. 

He currently lives at his parents' house with his siblings. He does not have dependent children, so his expenses are stable. He works at night Wednesday though Sunday offering moto-taxi services in a local company in Cochabamba. During the day he works in an aviation company. He works hard to reach his goals, which includes having his own car and house. 

He will use this loan to buy a new motorbike for his job. The one he currently has is failing, which does not let him work efficiently nor improve his income and quality of life, as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so he can work as a mototaxi

loans.name: Celia  Magdalena
