texts.es: Doña Celia es originaria de Granada, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado incrementar sus ventas y diversificar sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Blusas, Camisas, Faldas, Pantalones, Ropa interior y camisolines. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Celia is original from Granada and a single mother of four children. She is a saleswoman and sells underwear. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because thanks to them she has been able to increase her sales and diversify her products. She is now requesting a loan to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, underwear and camisoles. She expects this loan to be of great help as she will be able to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, underwear and camisoles.

loans.name: Shadya Group

texts.en:
This group called Shadya consists of three members, all of whom are female. They are from Sana`a, Yemen, and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same area for a long time. They have different businesses. They have requested a loan of 230,000 YER. 

Shadia is an active and entrepreneurial woman who, at twenty-eight years of age, runs her own medical clinic. The idea came to her when she completed studying in medical college.  From this she saw the opportunity to do a social service, helping others to improve their health, sharing her own life story. 
She works hard to support her family financially and to reinvest in her business. The loan she requests will be invested in purchasing medical supplies for her clinic so that she can offer good services for patients.

Shadia says that her biggest goal is to continue with her clinic, but she hopes to create awareness of healthy living in people.

loans.use: to purchase medical supplies for her clinic so that she can offer good services for patients.

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en: Savon is a villager from Battambang province. She is 29 years old and a mother of two dependent kids who are too young for schooling. To struggle for a living, she does paddy rice farming and grows pineapples as the main sources of income. She is able to supplement her income by working for others for a fee. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. Now, she leads a group of three to get the first loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that she can gain a good income, better than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is a 19-year-old and the fourth born in his family of eight. He is also a former Junior Achievement student of Lenana High School, a former JA Club member, and a student at Kenyatta University. During his high school JA experience, he managed to lead his team to success in a company program where they won various awards, and he was also named CEO of the year in the 1st ever JA Africa Inaugural Company of the Year competitions. He proved to be a young, energetic and enterprising young lad. His business, ROCCO Group deals with tender coconut water and virgin coconut oil. It is based in Chandaria Incubation Center where technical support is offered in terms of product development and also a mentorship to grow the business. 

They already have a finished product and are in the process of marketing and creating awareness. However, the incubation center only provides technical support hence they need financial assistance to market the product. To make this a success, and take his business to the next level, he turned to KIVA and applied for a USD800.

loans.use: to manufacture additional products that will be promoted and sold in the domestic market.

loans.name: Mariglen

texts.en:
Mariglen is the husband of a young woman raised in an orphanage and a young father of two children who has been recycling plastic for long time now. 
A quote from his interview with the responsible interviewing staff member: 

“Being part of the vulnerable ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians, what better can you do but recycling; the majority of us do this type of activity. After I collect the scrap plastic, I sell it to large companies who deal with recycling. To help me in my activity, I need to buy a motorbike type of conveyance that members of our community use and call it ‘tricycle’. I am the only one who works in my family. I never say ‘no’ to work; I collect scrap such as glass, paper, metal and plastic.”

loans.use: to buy a "tricycle" type of vehicle that ethnic Egyptians use in Albania to transport the scrap plastic to factories

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband drives a van in Lahore city. He provides transportation services to passengers from one stop to another. Due to continuous driving, most parts of his van have deteriorated and are in urgent need of replacement.

Therefore, Fouzia has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a field partner of Kiva. She hopes that with this loan, her husband will be able to buy spare parts so he can drive the van again.
 
Fouzia belongs to a poor family. Her husband is the only person earning an income in the family and he does not have any other source of income. She seems very happy and she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her husband's van

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia vive en alquiler con sus 3 hijos en la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto, Cecilia se dedica al comercio de venta de frescos de quisa (una fruta) en la feria de rio seco ex tranca de la ciudad de el alto. Cecilia logro hacer autorizar para la venta de comidas. El credito requiere para compra  de viveres al por mayor, por ejemplo la fruta quisa, asi ingrementara sus ingresos y poder brindar a sus hijos un mejor lugar para poder vivir.

El sueño de Cecilia es poder brindar a sus hijos el sustento y educación suficiente para que puedan ejercer una profesión subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in a rental with her three children in the Tahuantinsuyo zone of the city of El Alto.  Cecilia work in retail, selling drinks made from quisa (a fruit).  She sells them in the Ex Tranca de Rio Seco market of the city of El Alto.  Cecilia managed to become authorized to sell food.  She needs the loan to buy supplies in bulk, such as the quisa fruit.  In this way she can increase her income and will be able to give her children a better place to live.

Cecilia’s dream is to be able to give her children the support and education necessary so that they can practice a profession.  They live in an environment that is increasingly competitive and thus they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her beverage business

loans.name: Marcirene

texts.es:
La señora Marcirene habita en Borbon, provincia de Esmeraldas, tiene 29 años de edad vive con su conyugue y tiene una hija de 10 años y un hijo de 7 años los mismos que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela. Marcirene realizar manicure y pedicure  en su casa y empezó en este negocio con 3 esmaltes (pintura para uñas) desde hace 4 años. 
Ella es una persona perfeccionista, ofrece buen servicio y sobre todo es muy responsable con sus clientas, mismas que son de su localidad de Borbón y también le visitan desde Esmeraldas y Quito ciudades que se encuentran muy alejadas de su local. El crédito será utilizado en la compra de materiales de belleza y tener mayor variedad en sus productos.
Marcirene aspira poder mejorar su local,  contratar personal para que le colabore, ofrecer más servicios y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos para darle a sus clientes más comodidad y a sus hijos poder comprarles lo necesario para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Marcirene lives in Borbon, in the province of Esmeraldas.  She is 29 years old and lives with her life partner.  She has a 10 year-old daughter and a 7 year-old son, both of whom are in school. 

Marcirene does manicures and pedicures from her home and started this business with three nail polishes four years ago. She is a perfectionist, offers good service, and above all, is responsible with her customers.  They come from her town of Borbon and they also come from Esmeraldas and Quito which are some distance away.  

The loan will be used to buy beauty products so she can have a greater variety. Marcirene plans to improve her shop, hire people to help her, and offer more services.  In this way she will increase her income so she can make her customers more comfortable and buy her children the things they need so they can continue to study.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, a manicure table and a nail polish rack.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 25-year-old from a family of four. She first stumbled upon Junior Achievement Kenya in her secondary school, Kenya High, where she was actively involved in the company program and nurtured her entrepreneurial skills.
 
She has been exposed to the photography industry for six years and has been working with Nairobi's leading studios as head of photography. She also has a wealth of knowledge in both candid and posed photography. After encountering a lot of clients who showed interest in her work, her zeal and desire to venture out on her own grew and she started her business Black Swan Media in 2013. She has worked on projects ranging from weddings, studio photo shoots, model portfolios and property interiors.

She intends to tap into the high-end clientele, because of the growth of the entertainment industry and corporate events in the country, by investing in state of the art equipment that she will purchase with the loan.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for photo editing, flash units tripod, an additional camera and lenses that will improve the quality of her photography.

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a member of a two-person group. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He sells refined oil in the market at a profitable price. Presently, he needs to purchase cans for preserving the refined oil for selling purposes. However, due to insufficient savings, he is unable to purchase the cans. His wife wants to help her husband buy requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to continue his work efficiently. 

Amna is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchsae cans to store refined oil to sell.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur, s’appelle Babacar, il est âgé de 57 ans et évolue dans le commerce depuis des années. Il est sociétaire dans un des guichets d’IMCEC qui se trouve au centre du Sénégal. Il a déjà eu à bénéficier de 2 crédits. Babacar achète du mil dans les marchés hebdomadaires les plus proches et vient revendre dans son voisinage. Le mil étant une denrée très prisée dans cette zone, sa marchandise ne reste pas invendue pendant longtemps, ce qui lui permet de renouveler rapidement son stock afin de satisfaire rapidement sa clientèle.
Babacar est mariée et arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux bénéfices tirés de son activité. Il aimerait construire un magasin de stockage afin de pouvoir acheter en grande quantité et de profiter des prix bas selon la période.
texts.en:
This is Babacar, age 57. He has been conducting commercial activities for many years. He is a member of an IMCEC branch located in center Senegal, and he has previously benefited from two loans. 

Babacar buys millet at the closest weekly markets and sells it in his own neighborhood. Because millet is in high demand in that area, his stock goes fast and he has to replenish it quickly to meet customer demand. 

A married man, Babacar manages to support his family with the profits earned through his activity. He would like to build a storage facility, which would allow him to buy larger quantities and to take advantage of the drops in price that occur from time to time.

loans.use: to buy millet for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be time conscious. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have good living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle

loans.name: Arina

texts.en:
Arina lives in the village of Ashotavan in the Syunik region with her son, daughter-in-law, and two little grandchildren.

Arina's son and daughter-in-law are employed in the private sector, and Arina runs a farm. The salary that they earn is only enough for covering the family's basic needs. So, the family needs an alternative source of income in agriculture. 

The farm that Arina runs includes two cows, 20 sheep, and 14 chickens. She also owns farmable land where she cultivates wheat, corn, and potatoes. The harvest is sold locally.

Arina asked for financial support to increase her livestock by 30 sheep. The loan is important for this hardworking woman to enlarge her farm and provide a better life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy 30 sheep

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 36-year-old married mother of two children. She has been employed at a furniture-selling company since February 2013, with seven years of experience in her domain.

Her low salary forces her to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's unexpected additional school tuition fees.

She is very anxious about this loan and is working hard to establish her own business one day to develop and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Rushango Bafumbo Twimukye Association. Group

texts.en:
Calveri is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income but also practices farming where he grows maize, beans, Irish potatoes, sugarcane and bananas as his side income. It is from this business that he has been able to sustain his family and educate his children.  He faces challenges of weather and seasonality changes but has hopes to expand his business into new markets.

He is requesting a loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt and sodas to sell. Calveri is a member of the Rushango Bafumbo Twimukye Association group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 36-year-old woman who is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Rubina’s husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Rubina's husband is unable to attract passengers due to his ugly-looking vehicle and is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new rickshaw body as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of available of funds, he finds it difficult to cover the cost. 

Rubina is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of the rickshaw body. Her loan will help her husband continue his business. Rubina is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body

loans.name: Al-Majd Group

texts.en:
The Al-Majd Group consists of four women from Al-Hodeida governorate, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER, which they will use to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell. 

Badria is 29 years old, married, and the leader of the group. Her husband works for many hours every day to cover the expenses of his family. She decided to help him and started a small business. She sells clothes and cosmetics door-to-door, which she has been doing for four years. She wants to buy more clothes and cosmetics to meet the demands of her clients. She is requesting a loan from AMB for 50,000 YER. She looks forward to opening her own clothes store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza was born in 1995. She is not married and has no children. She lives with her parents in the southern area of Tajikistan. 

Gulnoza began her own business growing watermelon, potatoes, tomatoes, and wheat three years ago on her own land. She works with great desire and always works with new aspirations. Her parents help her with managing the business.

She wants to sow more crops but she does not have the money to buy the needed mineral fertilizers and seeds. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mundia

texts.en:
Mundia is a successful mobile money transfer agent located in the western province town of Mongu, Zambia.  Through years of hard work and dedication he has steadily grown his business from one outlet to 14.  Currently, Mundia has 22 employees working at his 14 locations throughout western and northwestern Zambia.  

Upon receiving his first Kiva loan Mundia was able to invest in his working capital to grow the business by serving more customers needing to send and receive money.   In time, he opened three additional outlets with his increased profits.  

Mundia talks about how, by reinvesting back into the business, he was able to earn more commissions and with his increased revenue, open new locations.  Some locations may not be profitable for up to six months but in time all of Mundia’s outlets have become profitable.  Having access to finance has fueled Mundia’s expansion and allowed him to provide 22 jobs in rural locations throughout Zambia where employment is very difficult to find.  
Mundia is happy now because he is able to provide well for his family.  Two of his children recently completed secondary school.  Another two of Mundia’s children help manage his outlets in rural locations.  The mobile money business has improved his and his family's income and well-being greatly.  

Now, Mundia is requesting his fourth Kiva loan to purchase two trading booths  which he will use to expand his business further.  He will also use the loan to add working capital to the three mobile money outlets he is about to open.

Mundia remains grateful to all the Kiva lenders who have provided him the financial opportunity to expand his business

loans.use: To purchase two new booths to expand his mobile money business to serve more customers in need of sending or receiving money

loans.name: Abdulrhman Group

texts.en:
Abdulrhman is a four-member group from Hodeidah, Yemen. All the members are women.  Lila, 42, is the mother of six children. She works very hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothes. Unfortunately, the money she makes is not enough.

Lila has been selling clothes, perfumes, and cosmetics to cover household expenses. Now, she intends to increase her income. She asked for a loan of 20,000 YER to buy clothes, perfumes, and cosmetics to resell. 

She hopes that she makes profits from buying a lot of products and selling them to new clients in different quarters and places in her city.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, and cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 27-year-old lady and the mother of a son and a daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own embroidery business for the past 12 years. He is the only person responsible for feeding his entire family and managing the household.

Riffat's husband needs different types of embroidery accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial resources, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Riffat has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan to purchase the relevant items to fulfill her husband's business needs. This will also help him to expand the size of his business and increase his profit margins.

Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidary accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 35-year-old single man who has been working at repairing cars' bodywork for twenty-one years. He was only fourteen years old when he started working to support his family. 

Rabih is his family's sole breadwinner, responsible for earning a living for three members of his family. He is a hard worker with a very good reputation in his region and domain. In 2002, he established his own business to improve and develop his family's living.

Today Rabih is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary highly requested tools and machines  to develop his business and respond to customers' special needs and requests.

Rabih is working hard to develop and expand his business, to work on more cars and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and machines to develop his business and respong to customers' special requests

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Juana Angélica sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.  
La socia Juana Angélica continua dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza,la socia trabaja a pedido a todos sus clientes que solicitan sus productos como amistades,familiares,entre otros, la socia vende lo que son perfumes,colonias,cremas,collares entre otros,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia,ya son años que la socia lleva su negocio bien y desea poder continuar asi.

La socia solicito el credito para la compra de perfumes.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juana Angélica continues to belong to the Mujeres Unidas communal bank, part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  
Juana Angélica still sells beauty products. She tries to treat all customers who request her products as friends and family. She sells perfumes, colognes, creams, necklaces, among other things. She wishes to continue working in this way to continue to support her family. She has had this business for several years and hopes to continue it.

Juana Angelica requested this loan for the purchase of perfumes.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es:
NILTON es muy trabajador, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en la casa de sus padres de su señora esposa, se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel Secundario. Trabaja como chofer propietario en la linea de trufi 1 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de neumaticos y dar mantenimiento a su vehicul.
El sueño de NILTON es poder, poder comprar otro vehiculo para asi poder mejorar sus ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nilton is a very hard worker.  He lives with his wife and two children in his in-laws' house, which is located in the city of El Alto.  He attended school only until secondary school  He works as a fixed route taxi driver for trufi 1.  He is requesting a loan to purchase tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.  Nilton's dream is to be able to purchase another vehicle in order to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tires and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es:
Desde hace más de una década, Marjorie habita en la parroquia Borbón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas. Tiene 29 años, de estado civil unión libre, con 2 hijos varones de 13 y 15 años, quienes asisten regularmente a clases.
Marjorie, desde hace 8 años, se dedica a su hogar y al negocio de ventas de lubricantes y aditivos. Tiene actualmente 3 empleados en su negocio. Viene trabajando con FODEMI desde hace un año y el crédito anterior fue de mucha utilidad, ya que permitió la ampliación del negocio y por este motivo la mayor acogida del mismo.
Con esta préstamo Marjorie espera aumentar sus compras y ventas y en un futuro no muy lejano llegar a vender llantas y baterías para vehículos.
Menciona que su fortaleza es estar en su propio local y que goza de mucha clientela.
texts.en: For over a decade Marjorie has lived in the parish of Borbón in the province of Esmeraldas. She is 29 years old and has a common-law marriage. They have two children aged 13 and 15 years who regularly attend school. Marjorie has earned her living in her home business for 8 years. She sells lubricants and additives for vehicles. She currently has three employees in her business. FODEMI has been working with her for a year and her previous loan was very useful as it allowed her to expand her business. With this loan, Marjorie expects to increase her sales in the near future and expand to sell tires and batteries for vehicles. She mentions that her strength is having her own location and that she benefits from a wide clientele.

loans.use: to sell lubricants and additives for vehicles.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Ella se llama Clara nació el 26 de agosto, tiene 26 años, desde que tiene conocimiento  y gracias a los valores impuestos por la madre quien es el motor de la vida se ha dado en la tarea de salir adelante  buscando cumplir con las metas y sueños. 
El trayecto laboral ha estado encaminado a buscar una mejor estabilidad  para así poder cumplir con las obligaciones diarias, durante un tiempo busco estudiar algo que cambiara el rumbo y la monotonía  que a muchos  molesta y que al mismo tiempo fuera una profesión  que le gustara y le apasionara como lo es ahora estudiar servicios farmacéuticos, la idea que surgió en ella después  de que descubriera el interés por los medicamentos  y la gran utilidad  que tiene para los seres humanos. Para ella estudiar y realizarse como persona es tan importante como lo es servir a la comunidad y que mejor manera  que brindando un servicio  con un oficio o profesión relacionado con el área de la salud.
Finalmente Clara  busca capacitarse en el área de servicios farmacéuticos para brindarse un conocimiento más a la vida, una mejor calidad de vida para ella y la familia, también poder compartir  los conocimientos y capacidades a las personas que lo necesiten, el convenio con kiva seria de gran beneficio para ella ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder  cancelar el valor de las mensualidades en la totalidad y el valor que le quedan con el subsidio de kiva es más fácil y cómodo para pagar.
texts.en:
This is Clara.  She was born on August 26th, and she is 26 years old.  Ever since she has been able to think about it, thanks to the values given to her by her mother, who is her driving life force, she has worked at getting ahead and seeking to fulfill her goals and dreams.

She has been traveling along the path of her work seeking better stability in order to be able to fulfill her daily obligations.  For some time she sought to study something that would change the direction and the monotony that bothers many. At the same time, she wanted it to be a profession that she would like and be passionate about like she is now studying pharmaceutical services. 

She got the idea after she discovered her interest in medication and its great usefulness to human beings.  To her, studying and fulfilling herself as a person is as important as it is to serve the community.  What better way to do so than providing a service with a trade or profession having to do with the health field?

Lastly, Clara is seeking to be trained in the area of pharmaceutical services in order to provide more knowledge in life and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  She also wants to be able to share the knowledge and training with the people that need it.  A Kiva loan would be a big benefit to her.  She does not have enough financial resources to be able to completely cover the monthly payments.  The amount of the Kiva loan is much easier and more comfortable for her to pay.

loans.use: to pay registration for a semester.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos, una niña de 3 años y un niño de 11 años. Se dedica a vender medicamentos en su propia farmacia que adquirió en el sector de Borbón, Esmeraldas. Ella va usar el préstamo para abastecerse de muchas variedades de medicamentos que necesitan las personas del sector para su venta. La ubicación de la farmacia está situada en un sector estratégico, cerca del centro de salud de la zona. Además ella es una persona emprendedora y responsable al momento de atender a sus clientes los cuales se sienten satisfechos con el trato que aquí se les da. Su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio haciendo que ella y su familia lleven un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Maria is a woman of 34 years of age. She lives in a civil union with her partner. They have two children, a 3-year-old girl and a 11-year-old boy. She sells medications in her own pharmacy in the countryside of Borbón, Esmeraldas. She will use to loan to stock many varieties of medications that people need her to have for sale. The location of her pharmacy is strategically placed near the area's health center. Plus, she is an enterprising and responsible person. Her customers are satisfied with the treatment that they are given by her. Her greatest desire is to grow her business so that she and her family will have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to stock her pharmacy with medications.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Romelia vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como secretaria.

El credito que solicita es para concluir dos tiendas que esta haciendo construir en su casa para darlas en alquiler y de esta manera poder generar mas ingresos para su familia ya que su sueldo es muy poco.
 
El sueño de Romelia es poder terminar su casita y darles comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Romelia lives in her own home with her two children in the city of La Paz. She works as a secretary.
She is requesting a loan to finish building two spaces in her home in order to rent them out and generate an income for her family, since her salary is very low.
Romelia's dream is to be able to finish her home and provide her children with comfort.

loans.use: to outfit her home.

loans.name: Mohinur

texts.en:
Mohinur is an ambitious woman. She was born in the year 1994. Mohinur is not married and lives with her parents in a village. 

She always wanted to organize her own business. Nowadays, she is going to organize her own business of growing crops. She studies at a course, “To Get Ahead”, at a women’s organization and got a certificate. 

She will grow crops and potatoes and sell them in a local market. Her parents promise to help her with managing the business. Mohinur is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. 

With the profit from her business, she is going to organize her wedding party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo vive en alquiler en un acabado fino y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de Diseñador Grafico. Gonzalo necesita el crédito para  aumento de capital de trabajo ya que esta instalando un servicio de amplificacion.
El sueño de Gonzalo es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir como arrendatario y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia..
texts.en:
Gonzalo lives in a rental property that is finished with solid materials and has a cement floor. It is located in the city of La Paz. He is a graphic designer by trade. Gonzalo needs a loan so that he can increase his operating capital for starting a disk jockey service.

Gonzalo dreams of having enough money so that he can stop renting and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy speakers to start a disc jockey service for parties and social gatherings

loans.name: Gulaim

texts.ru: Гулаим 61 год, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитала своих детей. Двое старших сыновей находятся на заработках в России, помогают матери материально. У Гулаим - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулаим занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулаим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулаим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулаим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение помещения для скота.
texts.en: Gulaim is 61 years old, a widow and raised her children alone after her husband's death. Two of her older sons work in Russia and help their mother financially.  Gulaim has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 30 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 1,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulaim's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow and 10 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulaim requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount. Gulaim plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to expand the space for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mónica Alejandra

texts.es:
Mónica es una joven activa, dinámica y emprendedora de 21 años de edad; su espíritu de superación la impulsó para buscar alternativas para generar ingresos y aportar a la economía de su hogar.
Desde hace aproximadamente 1 año, comenzó a vender productos por catálogo de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial, orientada y asesorada por una amiga que distribuye estos productos, sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido, pues depende del horario en el que sus clientes la puedan atender.
Se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido de mercancía al por mayor (batidos, malteadas, multivitamínicos, suplementos dietarios), aprovechando que de esa forma bajan los costos, por lo que puede aumentar el margen de utilidades que recibe al momento de las ventas; esto le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela, abriéndose paso para ser más competitiva en el mercado.
Mónica sueña con lograr aumentar sus ventas significativamente para mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y, en un futuro, tener la oportunidad de realizar estudios universitarios para convertirse en una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Monica is an active, dynamic and entrepreneurial 21-year-old; her spirit of improvement pushed her to find alternatives to generate income and provide to the economy of her home.

Approximately one year ago, she started doing catalog sales of a well-known brand trained and mentored by a friend that distributes these products, her main customers are family, friends and neighbors, she doesn't have a set work schedule because she adapts to her clients' schedule.

She is motivated to request a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale (smoothies, milkshakes, multivitamins and daily supplements), taking advantage of this reduces costs and increases her profit margin when she sells, this will allow her to have more variety of products to offer and satisfy different preferences and needs of her clientele, making her more competitive in the market.  Monica dream to increase her sales significantly to improve the family's quality of life and in the future be able to access university education to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale such as smoothies, milkshakes, multivitamins and daily supplements.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de DIOILA, commune de KALADOUGOU, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe BADEYA sont à troisièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJENEBA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter 50 kg d’oignon, 25 kg de sel, 25 kg de poisson fumé, et des cubes Maggi chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à une clientèle mixte à Dioïla. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 27 000Fcfa par mois, qui seront réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The BADEYA group consists of married women who average 39 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in the city of DIOILA, commune of KALADOUGOU, which is located in the prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They sell condiments and clothing, and they provide restaurant services.  

To meet their massive customer demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their 3rd group loan cycle. The funds will be used to stock up on merchandise to sell. 

Djeneba, standing first from the left, never received any formal education. After attempting several income-generating activities without success, she is now a reseller of condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy 50 kg of onions, 25 kg of salt, 25 kg of smoked fish and some Maggi bouillon cubes from wholesalers at the weekly market. She retails her stock in Dioila, for cash, to a diverse clientele. 

Djeneba expects to earn a monthly profit of 27,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Jhony Julio

texts.es: El señor Jhony tiene 40 años, casado con 2 hijos que son una Hija de 17 años y un hijo de 11 Años,  el se dedica a la actividad de Artesanía en oro y Plata, mejor denominado como orfebre, realiza todo tipo de Joyas de acuerdo al pedido y gusto de sus clientes tiene su joyería en Zona Villa El Carmen, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Jhony va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos y material de trabajo como oro, Plata,  ácido Sulfúrico, brilla Metal, para su negocio, el señor Jhony enfrenta retos en su negocio que la preocupación por la seguridad , ya que  posteriormente tiene que invertir en mejorar la seguridad de su negocio, el deseo del señor Jhony es el de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia,  por lo que trabaja arduamente y sin descanso.
texts.en:
Jhony, 40, is married with two children: a 17-year-old daughter and an 11-year-old son. He makes a living crafting gold and silver, better known as goldsmithing. He makes all types of jewelry, depending on the orders he receives and tastes of his clients. His jewelry store is in the Villa El Carmen area. 

This loan is his first loan cycle with the institution. Jhony is going to use this loan for the purchase of supplies and work materials such as gold, silver, sulfuric acid and metal polish for his business. Jhony confronts challenges in his business such as security concerns, and in the future he will have to invest in the improvement of his business´ security. Jhony´s wish is to improve his family´s quality of life, which is why he works hard and tirelessly.

loans.use: to buy materials for his artisanal goldsmithing business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: La señora Jacinta, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, tiene 27 años, vive en Monteagudo en un domicilio alquilado, donde también se encuentra su lugar de trabajo, su actividad principal es la confección de ropa deportiva y venta de pan, de la cuales genera todos sus ingresos para su diario vivir, tiene una hija pequeña de 3 años de edad que depende de ella, actualmente vive sola. Como no tiene muchos recursos, solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina recta siruba, una maquina overlock y compra de materia prima para la confección de ropa deportiva, con todo ello podrá incrementar la cantidad de trabajo que tiene y generara mayores ingresos de su actividad con el objetivo de lograr mejores condiciones de vida para su familia y asi podrá ofrecerle a su hija mayor bienestar.
texts.en: Jacinta is a responsible and hardworking person. She is 27 years old, she lives in Monteagudo in a rented house, where her activity is also located. She engages in fashioning sport clothes and in selling bread, and thanks to these activities she earns an income to pay for her daily necessities. She has a young girl aged 3 who depends on her, and she currently lives alone. As she hasn't got enough capital, she is requesting a loan to buy a Siruba sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and basic materials to fashion sport clothes. Thanks to this her requests will increase, and she will earn a better income: her goal is to achieve a better standard of living for her family in order to grant her daughter the best comforts.

loans.use: To buy a Siruba sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and basic materials.

loans.name: Germie

texts.en:
Germie is 51 years old and from the town of Panglao in Bohol. She is married with two children. For six years now, she has had a business using her van for tour services. 

Germie is asking for a loan to buy tires, fuel, oil for an oil-change, and a labor fee for repair. Germie is aware that these are all necessary for her business to always be operational. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business for increased profitability.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel, oil for an oil-change, and a labor fee for repair.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Feliciano es de la provincia Campero del departamento de Cochabamba,  hace 5 años que vive en concubinato, tiene un hijo dependiente al que ayuda en su educación junto a su pareja, hace más de 15 años vive en Ivirgarzama; estudio hasta nivel primario porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos,  por eso no pudieron solventar sus estudios, cuando él se independizo se dedicó a vender helados, y después se fue a Puerto Villarroel a vender comida y hace dos años se dedica a prestar el servicio de juegos en red, ahora quiere continuar vendiendo pulpas de frutas tropicales, actividad que realizaba paralelamente cuando vendía comida, pero para continuar esta actividad solicita un crédito para comprar un refrigerador, lo que le ayudara a tener mayores ingresos y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y poder cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Mr. Feliciano is from the Campero province of Cochabamba. He has lived in a common-law marriage for five years, and has a dependent child whose education he and his partner help with. He has lived in Ivirgarzama for more than 15 years. He studied until primary school level because his parents had scarce economic resources and they could not afford his studies. When he became independent he began selling ice cream, and later he went to Puerto Villarroel to sell food. For the past two years he has also been providing internet web games. Now he wants to continue selling pulps of tropical fruit, an activity he did while he sold food. To continue this business, he is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator which will help him have more income, improve the standard of living for his family, and fulfill his obligations.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en: Phylis is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 2 and 6. She describes herself to have potential. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are from humble backgrounds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy stock of beauty products for use in her salon. Her business goal is to open another branch within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a boutique. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy stock of beauty products

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 48-year-old hardworking married man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices farming as his main source of income alongside livestock production as his side income. He started this business to earn a living and look after his family.  Charles is challenged by price fluctuations that lead to a low market for his products but hopes that his business will improve to better standards and he will be able to build a permanent house.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his gardens.

loans.name: Karla Yuniesca

texts.es: Karla Yunieska, soltera, mayor de edad, con un hijo menor aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega. Ella  es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para ofrecer a los clientes productos como: granos básicos, aces, jabones, productos congelados, entre otros; también se dedica de manera ambulante a la venta de ropa usada. Karla Yunieska realiza sus compras al contado en uno de los mercados. El objetivo de solicitar este crédito es para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería en general
texts.en:
Karla Yunieska, is a single adult with a minor son who is still in her care. She is originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega. 

She is the owner of a small grocery store located in the house where she lives. She opens the doors to her business very early to offer products such as basic grains, detergent, soap, frozen products, and more to her clients. She also works selling used clothing on foot. 

Karla Yunieska makes her purchases in cash in one of the markets. She is taking out this loan with the objective of investing in general merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy consumer products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, and more, for her small grocery store

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en: Dilfuza was born in 1973. She is a careful mother of four children. Her children are not yet adults. Dilfuza’s husband works in a state organization. His income is small. Dilfuza wants to organize her own sewing business. She can sew Tajik national women's dresses. She is going to service her clients in her house. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La señora Cinthia vive en el sector candelaria del municipio de Colomi, de 19 años de edad, vive en concubinato y tiene una hija pequeña, económicamente es independiente percibe ingresos económicos de la actividad agrícola,  siembra en terreno de 2 Has, en terreno comunal produce papa, oca y haba, con rotación de cultivos, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro. Ahora requiere un crédito para la construcción de vivienda ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres y la misma ya se encuentra deteriorada, con la época de lluvia se incrementaron los deterioros y tiene más goteras en el techo, por ello quiere construir dos cuartos pequeños para poder vivir más cómodamente con toda su familia, mejorando las condiciones en las que se encuentran.
texts.en:
Cinthia lives in the Candelabra area of the Colomi Municipality. She is 19 years old, has a cohabiting relationship, and has a small daughter. She is financially independent due to farming, planting 2 hectares of communal land with potatoes, oca and beans, rotating the crops, as she has experience in this work.

She needs a housing construction loan as she currently lives in her parents’ home and it is in a state of disrepair and with the rainy season it’s deteriorating more and there are more leaks in the roof. Therefore, she wants to build two small rooms in order to live more comfortably with all her family, improving the conditions in which they find themselves.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 46-year-old divorced mother of four children. She started a clothes-selling business a year ago to provide her beloved children with the necessary living needs.

At the beginning, Dalal started selling underwear from her house, and gradually she started diversifying her merchandise according to her customers’ needs and requests.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to open a café for her son to develop his living and support her in their family's financial needs. At the present time, she is the family's sole breadwinner since she got a divorce a year ago.

Dalal is working hard to increase her business capital to attract more customers and satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to open a café for her son to develop his living and support her in their family's financial needs.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is 23 years old. She is married and has 2 little children. Her husband is a farmer. He works on his own land. Nilufar and her family live poorly and she wants to improve her living condition. 

She is going to start her own sewing business to find new source of income. Nilufar took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ by a women's organization. 

She is asking for a loan of 1100 Somoni to buy a Chayka sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a Chayka sewing machine to start her new sewing business

loans.name: Senamar

texts.en:
Senamar is 30 years of age, married and blessed with three children. To raise them, she is engaged in a food stall business. She has been in this business for seven months and usually earns about PHP 500 a day. 

She wants to improve her business. To make it possible, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables, pork and chicken meat to cook and sell.

She hopes that someday she can improve their business more and probably lift their living conditions out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, pork and chicken meat to cook and sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La Señorita Laura tiene 21 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en Psicología en una universidad muy reconocida de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Laura trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja en recepción de remesas que llegan de España,  la Señorita Laura va a usar este préstamo para  los tramites que implica la titulación y la inscripción para su tesis, la  Señorita Laura enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  vive en la zona de Pampahasi, su deseo es poder terminar sus trámites y poder encontrar trabajo para ejercer su profesión y con el tiempo poder estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Laura is 21 years old and single.  She is studying for her degree in Psychology in a very well-known university in the city of La Paz.  Laura works to pay for her studies.  She works as a receiver of remittances that come from Spain.  Laura is going to use this loan for the procedures that are involved in getting her degree and enrolling to complete her thesis.  

Laura faces challenges in her studies such as the lack of financial support from her parents and having to work and study is very difficult but she has the desire to get ahead, excel, finish her studies and be able to practice her profession.  She lives in the Pampahasi area.  Her desire is to be able to finish the process of getting her degree and be able to find work to practice her profession and with time be able to study for her master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for the process of getting her degree and enrollment to complete her thesis.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza was born in 1981. She is divorced and has 3 children. She is the only provider for her children.  

Nargiza has had her own business for more than 8 years, selling food items in her own food shop.  Nargiza runs the business alone and knows her  business well. Nargiza is going to be successful in future. 

She studies at the Khujand State University in absentia (off campus). She must pay for her tuition at the university and is asking for a loan of 4500 Somoni to help pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is forty six year old, married and has eight children. He lives with his family in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He used his previous loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.  His business goal was to buy land to grow crops to diversify his income, which he did, and his personal goal is to educate his children. In Uganda, he faces the challenge of competition and limited capital to invest. 

Peter is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Claudia es originaria de Granada, casada y madre de tres hijos, uno de ellos ya independiente. Tiene 50 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida. Inicio su negocio a los 36 años de edad con la ayuda de su esposo y poco a poco logro salir adelante y ahora cuenta con un negocio próspero y en crecimiento. Su meta próxima es ofrecer una amplia variedad de platillos a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos tales como: Arroz, Frijoles, Aceite, Azúcar entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para obtener una mayor cantidad de productos para la elaboración de sus platillos. Su plan futuro es remodelar el local para brindarles una mejor presentación a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia is originally from Granada. She is married and the mother of three children, one of whom is already independent. She is 50 years old. She is a saleswoman by profession, making a living selling food. She started her business when she was 36, with the help of her husband, and bit by bit she was able to progress and now she has a flourishing and growing business. 

Her next goal is to offer a wide variety of dishes to her customers. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of basic grains such as rice and beans, oil, sugar, and more. She thinks the loan will help her very much to obtain a greater quantity of products for the preparation of these dishes. Her future plan is to remodel her work site so that she can present a better site to her clients.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, oil, sugar, and more

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Joven Teresa de Jesus habita en el municipio el sauce departamento de león, una ciudad hermosa donde existen diversas actividades comerciales.

Es una joven de 46 años de edad casada, cuenta con 4 hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener a sus hijos que tanto ama y estima. 
Desde hace Nueve años inició su negocio el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos, y alimentación para la población, este negocio lo empezó con un pequeño capital que con esfuerzo propio lo logro a obtener trabajando fuera del país.

La forma de vender su producto, esto lo hace en su propia habitación, esta idea le surgió porque cuando emigro fuera del país logro a trabajar en una pequeña pulpería y desde ahí le surgió la idea de obtener su propio negocio. 
Se siente a gusto con su negocio porque le da para vivir dignamente y le ayuda a sobrevivir con su familia. 

Este es el crédito numero 3 solicitado con ceprodel para el desarrollo de esta actividad, ella comenta que sus sueños lo ha ido cumpliendo a través de la mano amigable que le ha brindado ceprodel y kiva realizándole pequeños créditos que han ayudado a mejorar su vivienda. 
Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesus lives in the city of El Sauce in León, a beautiful city with many diverse commercial activities.

She is 46-year-old woman, married, with 4 children in her care. With the little that she earns through hard work she helps to provide for her children whom she loves and adores so much.

Nine years ago she started her business of cosmetic sales and food for the community. She started the business with a little capital which, through her own efforts, she managed to obtain working outside the country.

The way she sells her product is in her own home. This idea occurred to her because when she left the country she found work in a small grocery store and from there she had the idea of obtaining her own business. 

She feels happy with her business because it lets her live with dignity and it helps her survive with her family.

This is the third loan requested with CEPRODEL for the development of this business. Teresa says that her dreams have come true through the friendly hand offered by CEPRODEL and Kiva, giving her small loans that have helped her to improve her home. She hopes to God to continue receiving this privilege of these small loans that help her so much.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, oil, rice, and cosmetics for a better supply in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old single man who opened his own bakery four years ago. He is well-known in his region with the good reputation he has, in addition to the special products he serves.

Ali is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials for his business development, such as cheese, thyme and flour, in addition to a power generator and necessary bakery items such as paper bags and cleaning supplies.

Ali is working hard to develop his bakery, which is specialized in producing the traditional Lebanese Manakish (a folded dough with special toppings served during the day, especially for breakfast).

He is working hard to expand his bakery to attract new customers and increase his income. He might open a special zone for eat-in services.

loans.use: To buy cheese, thyme and flour, in addition to a power generator, paper bags and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Joao

texts.en:
A little more than a year ago, Joao opened his massage therapy office, and since then, offered a new option in health care for the Kenner, Louisiana community. With his new working capital, Joao was able to obtain an additional certification as well as buy more equipment to be able to grow his business in order to serve a larger part of community. 

Joao's therapy salon includes a traditional western red cedar sauna, state-of-the-art massage tables and hot towel therapy. Joao strives to be the best at what he does and strives to deliver the best customer service to all of his patients and clients. In addition to massage therapy, Joao offers six different lines of massage products, including creams and oils.

loans.use: to obtain an additional certification and buy more equipment

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Dúo Nueva Esperanza, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Angelica de 34 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, en esta ocacion esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz por mayor ya que asi obtendra el productos un poco mas economico, esperando que le sigan apoyando, ella a trabajado otros creditos anteriores y no ha caido en mora.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of Nueva Esperanza Duo.  She has earned a living for several years making and selling tortillas.

Currently she's requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale because the products will be a little more inexpensive.

Angélica has had other loans previously and hasn't defaulted, and she hopes for continued support.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Señorita Yolanda tiene 23 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de técnico superior en sistemas en un instituto muy reconocido de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Yolanda trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja de mensajera en un institución,  la Señorita Yolanda va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una portátil y para el pago de sus estudios, la  Señorita Yolanda enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  vive en la zona de Urkupiña, su deseo es poder terminar sus estudios y poder encontrar trabajo para ejercer su profesión y de esta manera colaborar con su familia con los gastos del hogar se siente muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Srta. Yolanda is 23 years old and single. She is studying to become a Systems Technical Engineer in a well known institution in the city of La Paz. Yolanda works as a messenger in an agency to pay for her studies.

Yolanda will use this loan to purchase a laptop and to pay for her studies. She confronts challenges in her studies due to her parents lack of economic resources and the need to work while she studies, which is very difficult for her. Nevertheless she wants to get ahead and succeed by finishing her studies and being able to practice her profession.

She lives in the Urkupiña area. Her desire is to be able to finish her studies and then practice her profession so that she can help her family with household expenses. She is  very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for her studies and purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, milk, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar and other items she sells. Her business goal is to be reliable within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more animals, such as goats, to the existing herd

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 25 años de edad, está estudiando segundo año de doctorado en medicina en la universidad, él está soltero y vive en la casa de su padre quien lamentablemente falleció en  el año 2013 y quedaron solos con su hermana menor que solo tiene 17 años y su madre, es por ello que él y su madre llevan las riendas de la casa.

El joven Carlos tiene 3 años de trabajar en una agroservicio como cargador  de quintales de concentrado, este trabajo lo pudo conseguir gracias a su padre quien era muy amigo del dueño del negocio, el trabajo le queda muy retirado, a casi dos horas de distancia, es por medio de este trabajo que él se paga sus estudios.

Él necesita de este crédito, pues lo utilizará para pagar la matrícula de la universidad para este próximo año, y espera pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtenga de su trabajo en la agroservicio.
Este joven emprendedor tiene un gran sueño en la vida, y es lograr graduarse como doctor de la universidad y asi poder ayudar a su madre y su hermana para que siga estudiando y sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 25-year-old young man who is in his second year studying for a doctorate of medicine at the university. He is single and lives in his father's house. Unfortunately his father died in 2013, leaving him with only his younger sister, who is only 17 years old, and his mother. This is why he and his mother have taken the reins at home.

For three years, Carlos has worked at an agro-service company as a loader of quintals of concentrate. He was able to get this work thanks to his father, who was a very good friend of the business owner. The work is very far away, almost two hours away. He pays for his studies by means of this work.

He needs this loan, as he will use it to pay the tuition for the university for this next year. He hopes to pay the loan with the income he obtains from his work at the agro-service company.

This young entrepreneur has a great dream in life, and it is to be able to graduate as a doctor from the university and thus be able to help his mother and his sister so that she can keep studying. And he knows that he will be able to do this with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods and expand her vegetable business

loans.name: Arelis Nohemí

texts.es:
La Joven Arelis Nohemi habita en el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio para sobrevivir. 

Es una joven de 36 años de edad Madre soltera con 2 hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus hijos que tanto ama y estima. 
Desde hace dos años ejerce el trabajo como domestica, pero son de sus sueños tener una vida mejor con sus dos hijitos. 
Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie un crédito, para la compra de un televisor de 21 pulgadas, esto lo ve de importancia para que sus dos hijitos mantengan mejores condiciones en su hogar. 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho con su familia. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le a brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
The young woman Arelis Nohemí lives in the municipality of Achuapa in the department of León, a city where residents make a living from diverse commercial activities in order to survive. She is a 36-year-old young woman and a single mother with two children in her care. What little she earns is barely enough to help sustain her children--who she so loves and values--on a daily basis. For the past two years she has worked as a domestic worker, but she dreams of having a better life with her two little children. 

She greatly needs Ceprodel and Kiva to finance her with a loan to buy a 21-inch television. She sees this as important so that her two little children can maintain better conditions in their home. She feels pleased with this type of employment because it has helped her a lot with her family. She is thankful for the support that Ceprodel and Kiva have provided her and hopes to God that she will keep receiving the privilege of these small loans, which help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy a 21" television

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es:
La Joven Diana Maria habita en el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, una ciudad hermosa donde existen diversas actividades comerciales he industriales.

Es una joven de 25 años de edad soltera, con 3 hijos bajo su cargo dos de ellos están en la educación, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener a sus hijos y el de su estudios.
 
Desde hace cinco años se dedica a trabajar como empleada, ejerciendo el cargo de responsable de fierro en una de las instituciones del municipio, 

A llegado a ceprodel por tercera vez con el objetivo de solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de medicamento para el mejoramiento de su salud ya que ha estado un poco mal y sus sueños es seguir luchando que sus hijos alcancen una educación profesional.

Se siente a gusto a verse encontrado con ceprodel y Kiva porque este le han dado su mano a amigable y la han sacado adelante, por lo que espera en Dios una nueva oportunidad con este financiamiento que sería de gran importancia para su persona.
texts.en:
The young woman Diana Maria lives in the municipality of Achuapa, department of León, a pretty city where there exist diverse commercial and industrial activities.

She is a 25-year-old single woman, with 3 children in her charge. Two of them are in school, and with the little she makes she is barely able to take care of her children and their studies.

For 5 years she has worked as an employee, exercising the office of the Head of Iron in one of the municipal institutions.

She has come to CEPRODEL for the third time with the objective of requesting a new loan to buy medicine to improve her health, since she has been unwell, and her dream is to keep fighting so her children will receive a professional education. 

She feels comfortable to have found herself with CEPRODEL and Kiva because they have given her a friendly hand and have brought her forward. For this she hopes in God for a new opportunity with this financing that will be of great importance for her personally.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her health and the health of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
La  señora Rosibel es una persona responsable, emprendedora y trabajadora que vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras con esposo. Su negocio es una  venta  de comida y golsinas. 
Doña Rosibel su negocio le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos el cual consiste en la venta de tacos, enchiladas, tajaditas entre otros comidas que elabora para vender. Ella vende sus productos  a las  personas que viven  cerca de su lugar de residencia así como también a personas que trabajan comerciando en esa zona. 
Doña Rosibel en su negocio le ayudan su esposo  ya que su negocio es muy visitado por los clientes. Necesita el préstamo para poder comprar arroz, aceite, pollo, res, chile verde, pataste, etc. todo lo necesario para realizar sus productos   porque  con el dinero que cuenta ahora no es suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Doña Rosibel espera así también aumentar su nivel de ventas para poder  tener una mejor calidad de vida y ayudar a su familia.       


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del 2014
texts.en:
Rosibel is a responsible, enterprising, hardworking person who lives in a village in the south of Honduras with her husband. She has a business selling food and snacks.

Rosibel's business generates most of her income. She sells tacos, enchiladas, sautéed plantains and plates of food. She sells her products to people who live near her home, as well as to those who work in the area. Her husband helps her with her business because she has many clients. She needs this loan to buy rice, oil, chicken, beef, green chili, potatoes, and everything she needs to make her dishes, because the money she has now is not sufficient to satisfy her clients' demands.

Rosibel hopes to increase her sales so that she can have a better quality of life and help her family.

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy tacos, enchiladas, sautéed plantains, and plates of food for her business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, a Cuban-American, has been styling hair for over 28 years after graduating from a prestigious New York City beauty school. He met his wife Gina soon afterward. The two married and opened a salon together with one another partner. However, when the economic recession hit Miami, the two were forced to sell their part of the business. 

Seeking a way to earn a living for themselves and their three young boys, Joel and Gina decided it was time to start a new business from scratch.  Joel was happy to find that his clients not only are returning to seek his services, but have been bringing others as well. However, Joel and Gina have run into a problem. They don’t have enough capital to purchase improvements for the business. Joel is seeking a loan to purchase better equipment such as a hair dryer and shampoo bowl. 

Help Joel and his family build their business and provide a better life for themselves!

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer, shampoo bowl and other equipment

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has four years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. It’s her first year with BRAC Pakistan. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy salt, biscuits and beverages to sell

loans.name: Gachomo

texts.en:
Gachomo is a 52-year-old landlord in Marikani, Kenya. He is a married man who supports five children and his spouse is a housewife. Having been in this business for the last twenty-four years, he is doing well and has a transport business, too.

This marks his first time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to help him renovate his rental houses. He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and expand his transport business. He hopes to own sustainable businesses in future.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Kounain Ali Shah

texts.en:
Kounain Ali Shah is 35 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. He has been running a small herbal shop in a nearby town to the help the poor people. He wants to help poor people, which is the reason he decided to open an herbal medicine shop in a poor society. Such poor people do not have the power to afford allopathic medicine. He can treat minor diseases at very low service charges and he provides herbal medicines according to his experience. In this way, he gets some income to run his house as well.

He is very famous in his area due to his kindness. This is why the demand for herbal medicines has been increasing and why he needs to buy more herbal medicine to cope with the demand.  He wants to buy herbal medicine in bulk but does not have enough capital to invest because he has to spend a large part of his savings for his household expenses.

Therefore, Kounain Ali Shah requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that the lenders will support him for his noble work.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicines

loans.name: Hay Alsalam Group

texts.en: This group is called Hay AlSalam. It consists of four members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 130,000 YER. Fatima is a 38-year-old married woman who has children. She currently has a business drawing tattoos on ladies' hands. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. She has worked in this business to provide her family with income for expenses. Most of her customers are brides. She would like to expand her business so she applied for a loan from AMB. She will use the loan to increase her capital, and buy pigment (khodhab) materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy pigments to draw tattoos on ladies' hands.

loans.name: San Felipe Xi Group

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un Agricultor de 39 años de edad del departamento de La Libertad, el forma parte del grupo solidario conocido como San Felipe XI,todos se dedican a la agricultura.
Juan Carlos esta acompañado, estudio hasta primer año de educacion media, ya que por ser parte de una familia de escasos recursos tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar al sostenimiento familiar,tiene 3 hijos entre las edades de 7 y 16 años, los 3 estudian actualmente.
Juan Carlos tiene 24 años de experiencia en los cultivos de maiz,frijol,maicillo, y citricos, actividad que le permitio en su momento colaborar con sus padres y en la actualidad esto es lo que le ha ayudado al sostenimiento de su grupo familiar.
Juan carlos necesita el credito para la compra de insumos que le permitan la siembra y manejo de los cultivos de granos basicos asi como de citricos, pues el espera que estos le generen los ingresos necesarios para seguir brindando a sus hijos el estudio que les permita tener mejores oportunidades en la vida y asi cumplir su sueño de verlos realizarce como profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 39, is a farmer in the department of La Libertad.  He belongs to a solidarity group known as San Felipe XI in which all the members work in agriculture.

Juan Carlos is married.  He has three children between the ages of 7 and 16; all three currently attend school.  He studied up to the first year of middle school.  He had to work from an early age to help support the family because he was from a low-income family. 

Juan Carlos has 24 years of experience growing corn, beans, millet, and citrus, which allowed him to work with his parents.  Currently this is what has helped him support his family.

Juan Carlos needs the loan to buy inputs so he can plant and take care of his basic grains crops as well as his citrus.  He hopes to generate the income he needs to keep on giving his children an education so they can have better opportunities in life and he can achieve his dream of seeing them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is a 46-year-old Cameroonian married mother of six children, the oldest 25 years old and in university, the youngest a 10-year-old primary school student. 

Victorine has had a stable and successful restaurant business located in a busy urban area for over six years. She will use this loan to buy more food to cook and sell, thereby expanding her operation.

loans.use: to buy more raw food to cook and sell

loans.name: Gardenias Group

texts.es:
