To help financially support the family, two of their children are employed as paid workers. 

In this regard, he has requested a loan of KHR 3,000,000 which will be used to buy a piece of farmland to enlarge his farming area. He hopes to have better yields next crop season, so he can further improve his living conditions and financial stability. He expresses thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland to enlarge his farming area.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin is from Kang Meas village, Baray, Kampong Thom province. He is 38 years old and is employed as a construction worker to support the family’s needs. He is happily married to a local woman who is a fish seller and a loving mother of two children. Chin has been working in this field for almost 10 years and earns approximately KHR 13,000 per day. 

Recently, Chin asked for financial assistance of KHR 2,000,000 to buy materials for home renovation. This will help him improve his general living conditions. He has found assistance for their financial needs through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) and he is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy materials for home renovation.

loans.name: At

texts.en:
Being a hardworking mother of three children from Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham, At is a 53-year-old farmer who owns a few pieces of land for growing rice to nourish her family. Having great support from her husband, she is able to make a suitable income which she uses for daily meals and other commodities. She has been a farmer for over 30 years now.

Recently, At requested a loan of USD500 to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and other farm inputs. She aims to develop her farming business so it is more productive and to make a consistent income to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Kimsry

texts.en:
Kimsry, age 51, is married to a humble man who is a palm juice collector. Kimsry gathers all the palm juice collected by her husband and makes red sugar to sell in her community. She also supplements her income by managing one hectare of farmland in Kampong Thom province. From her current business, she is able to earn approximately KHR 30,000 per day.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of KHR 2,600,000 to be used in buying a water pump which she will use for the maintenance of her paddy fields. She knows that supplying her crops with complete farm supplies will enable her to gain better yields and income. She wishes to grow better crops through using this loan amount so she can further improve her living conditions and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a water pump which she will use for the maintenance of her paddy fields.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Chhoem is a diligent farmer who has been engaged in the farming business for almost 25 years. She lives and works in a remote area of the Prey Chhor district with her husband and two unmarried children. Farming rice is her main source of income.

Currently, she is asking for a loan to be used in building a kitchen where she can cook and serve her family with their daily meals. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham, Chen is a 43-year-old married man and a responsible father of four children who are of various ages. To overcome the hardships of living, Chen is engaged in cultivating rice and raising pigs in his backyard for additional income. His wife and children are his great help.

Chen has been an honest client with HKL for three loans already. He has a good credit history and repaid back his loans successfully. Now he is requesting a new loan of KHR 3,000,000. The loan is intended to purchase pigs, feed for them, and to expand his piggery. His dreams are to have a successful business, obtain more income, improve his home and educate his children up to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed for them, and to expand his piggery.

loans.name: Sangim

texts.en:
This is Sangim. She is a 37-year-old married woman and an experienced farmer from Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She previously used a loan to buy a cow to contribute to the maintenance of the rice fields. The loan was a great support and provided a positive impact on developing their farming business. Sangim has been farming rice for almost 20 years.

She has requested a loan of USD1,050 in order to buy a motorcycle for their transportation needs. In this way, she will be able to reduce unnecessary expenses on private transportation services and save more for the farming business and for future emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for their transportation needs.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Kampong Cham, a province with a high density of population. The inhabitants work with agriculture, sales and livestock. Like other people in her region, Thy is dedicated to the agricultural sector, growing rice and other seasonal crops to sell as the main source of her income. She has been doing this for almost 20 years. Her husband supports her with her daily farming activities.

Thy has requested a loan in the sum of USD1,000 from Hattha Kaksekar Limited in order to buy a used motorcycle for the family’s transportation needs. That way she'll prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi service and will save more for their future business and emergency needs. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for the family’s transportation needs.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is a 55-year-old mother of six grown-up children who are living around Kampong Cham province. She and her husband operate a farming business as the major source of their income. They have been engaged in rice farming for almost 35 years and earn a proper income to cover their family’s living needs.

Yon would like to obtain a loan in order to help her married daughter renovate her house for suitable living. Being a mother, she must help all her children resolve their concerns when they need assistance from her. Yon hopes that the loan help will provide their family with a more comfortable lifestyle than ever before.

loans.use: to help her married daughter renovate her house for suitable living.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is married with three children who still depend on her income. She is now 33 years old and lives with her family in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has a business of growing rice crops where she works to earn a living. She has been in this field for more than 10 years and learned to do this from her parents when she was very young. Her husband is her main support by tilling their farm, and he also provides transportation services to supplement the family’s income.

When her husband's motorcycle was broken, he was unable to continue providing his services and it affected the family’s economic situation. That’s why Sothea has requested a loan to fix their motorcycle. This way she hopes to sustain her family-owned businesses and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to fix their motorcycle.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
This is Sun. She is a 38-year-old farmer from a small village in the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She previously used a loan to buy a cement mixing machine to support her husband’s construction work. The loan was a great help and had a positive impact on developing their business as well as their general living conditions. 

She would like to have a new loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to be used to buy construction supplies to support her husband's construction business. The income she expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan will be used for the family’s daily meals, school allowances for her children and for future emergency needs. She is very thankful and hopes the loan will be granted to her again as her second loan from Kiva lenders, so she can improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to support her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Santos Benjamín

texts.es:
Santos tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen cuatro hijos y todos asisten a la escuela.

Desde que Santos tenía la edad de nueve años, su padre lo llevaba junto a sus hermanos a trabajar en la siembra de maíz y frijol, así fue como aprendió el oficio en la agricultura. Ahora siembra dos hectáreas de maíz, de esa producción dependen todos sus ingresos.  
Para dirigirse al lugar donde cultiva, debe trasladarse a 1000 mts de su casa, se levanta desde muy temprano para comenzar sus actividades a las 6:00 de la mañana y termina a las 11:00. a.m.

Santos necesita mucho de este crédito, pues tiene la necesidad de comprar insumos agrícolas, pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra y realizar las labores agrícolas de pre-siembra.

Él sueña con tener ganado, pues sería una fuente de ingresos adicional para él y su familia, y así no dependerá solo de la agricultura, eso le permitiría a Santos mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y a la vez, podrá tener más posibilidades de ayudar a sus hijos, para que continúen sus estudios y sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old and studied through second grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. He has four children and they all attend school.

Since Santos was nine years old, his father took him and his siblings to work in the plantation of corn and beans, which was how he learnt this trade. He now sows two acres of corn, and all his income comes from there. 

To go to the plantation, he has to travel 1000 metres. He gets up very early to start work as 6:00 am, and finishes at 11:00 am.

Santos needs this loan very much, because he has to buy agricultural inputs, pay for the lease of the land and do some presowing agricultural work. 

He dreams of owning cattle, as it would be an additional source of income for himself and his family, and would not depend only on agriculture. This way he would be able to improve his family's quality of life and, in turn, have more possibilities of helping his children, so they can keep on studying and become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, pay the lease for the land and do presowing agricultural work

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en: Bunthoeun is a male farmer who is 24-years-old. He is single and he can make $2 per day. He lives with his father and three other siblings. All of his siblings work at the factory. As he wants to get more harvest for his family, he would like to ask for a loan of $1,500 to buy farmland. This loan can help him make more income for his family. Last but not least, he also wants to take another loan to run a small business buying and selling rice.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal is 31-years-old. She is married and resides with her mother in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food for more than two years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband who is joining her in the picture is a rice farmer. He makes an income of $3 each day. Since her food store became more popular, Saphal needs more funds to expand her business. Therefore, she asks for a loan of $1,000 to purchase tables, chairs and utensils to expand her store. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and utensils to expand her store

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Sophat is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 a day. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, is a construction worker. He makes an income of $5 each day. To improve her family finances, Sophat is asking for a loan of $1,500 to purchase cashew nuts to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su esposo es agricultor, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales solo 3 están estudiando. 

Los padres de Yanira eran agricultores y ella les ayudaba en la siembra de maiz, hoy en día junto con su esposo siembra una hectárea y media de maíz, también se encarga de cuidar a sus hijos y a realizar los quehaceres del hogar.

Yanira solicta este crédito, pues necesita comprar 2 novillas para venderlas dentro de un año a un mayor precio, esto le estaría garantizando los ingresos económicos para sostener a su familia y que no les falte nada.

El sueño de yanira, es tener mas ganado y que sus hijos estudien y se preparen en una carrera universitaria para que tengan un mejor empleo que ella.
texts.en: Yanira, 33, studied up to ninth form. She is married to a farmer, with whom she has 4 children, of whom only 3 are going to school. Yanira's parents were farmers too and she used to help them sow sweetcorn. Nowadays, she grows one hectare and a half of sweetcorn with her husband. She also raises the children and takes care of the household. She asks for this loan in order to buy two heifers, so as to sell them for a profit in one year. This would generate income to support her family and make sure her children want for nothing. Yanira's dream is to have more cattle and to see her children go to university, so that they can make a better living than she does.

loans.use: to buy 2 heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: María De La Paz

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años de edad, actualmente está casada y tiene 3 hijos, pero solo vive con su esposo y una nieta, su pareja trabaja como albañil y ella solo se dedica al oficio de la casa y a algunas labores agricolas. 

La señora tiene 15 años de dedicarse al engorde de ganado en repasto, a sembrar maiz y frijol, estas actividades económicas son las que le han ayudado a criar y brindar los estudios a sus hijos, los cuales ahora son independientes. 
Su trabajo lo lleva a cabo en terrenos cercanos a su casa y tiene la ayuda de su esposo, para realizarlos.

María solicita un préstamo de $ 500.00 a CREDICAMPO, para comprar una novilla de repasto, también le comprará una computadora a su hija, ya que estudia segundo año de licenciatura en administración de empresas y es un elemento importante en su formación, y una computadora le facilitará hacer sus tareas. 

La señora tiene como objetivo, ahorrar y trabajar duro, y de esta lograr que su hija se pueda graduar como licenciada, pues ella sabe que lo lográ con esfuerzo.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, she is married and has 3 children, but she only lives with her husband and a granddaughter. Her husband works as a mason and María does the household chores and some agricultural work.

María has engaged in the fattening of non-dairy cattle and in growing corn and beans for 15 years. These economic activities have helped her raise her children and pay for their education. The children are now grown up. María works on a piece of land close to her house and her husband helps her with the work.

She asks for a loan of $ 500.00 with CREDICAMPO in order to buy a new heifer. Additionally, she wants to buy a computer for her daughter who is in her second year studying for a degree in business administration. A computer is an important item for her studies and will make it easier for her to do her homework.

María’s goal is to work hard and make savings and by this to to able to help her daughter achieve her bachelor’s degree. She knows that her daughter will be able to get her degree if she works hard.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and to buy a computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan tiene 63 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta octavo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene 5 hijos que ya formaron sus propios hogares.

Juan se dedica el trabajo en la agricultua desde que tenía la edad de 15 años, además aprendió el oficio de sastreria y cuida 3 novillas. 
En cuanto al trabajo en la agricultura y ganaderia, los aprendió por sus padres, y el negocio de sastreria lo aprendió gracias a un amigo, hoy en día él siembra 2 hectáreas  de maíz y lo realiza desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:30.

El préstamo que Juan está solicitando, lo necesita para comprar 2 novillas, ya que le gusta tener ganado. 

Algunos de sus sueños son, en un futuro tener más ganado, también le gustaría sembrar una hectárea mas de maíz, además desea aprender el trabajo de panaderia y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 63 years old and only studied up to eighth form. He is married and his wife takes care of the household. They have five children, all of whom founded their own families. Juan has been a farmer since he was 15 and also learned to be a tailor. He has three heifers. He learned farming from his parents and tailoring from a friend. He works every day from 6 am to 11.30 am to tend to his two hectares of sweetcorn. He asks for a loan in order to buy two heifers, because he enjoys animal husbandry. His dreams include having more cattle and growing one more hectare of sweetcorn. He would dearly like to learn breadmaking in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEME  est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de MADOUDIARRABOUGOU, commune de, KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de céréale, de l’habillement, et du savon. Les femmes du groupe DEME sont à leurs troisièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente SADIO la deuxième personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite. Elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habits en friperie depuis 5 ans. Elle compte acheter une balle de friperie chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail à une clientèle mixte chez elle et parfois ambulante. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 21 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera en partie injectés dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Deme group is made up of married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, Kerela commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the republic of Mali). They got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell condiments, cereal, clothing and soap. The women of the Deme group are on their 3rd group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their enormous customer demand.

Sadio, the woman sitting second from the right, did not get an education. She has been selling clothing and second-hand clothing for 5 years. She plans to buy a bale of second-hand clothing from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales to a varied retail clientèle at her home, and occasionally on the streets. She expects to make a monthly profit of 21 000 francs, part of which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de DIOILA, commune de KALADOUGOU, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce d’ustensile en plastique, de condiment et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à troisièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente FANTA la troisième personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’ustensile en plastique. Elle compte acheter 12 pièces de bassine et 10 pièces de tasses en plastique chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce à une clientèle mixte à Dioïla et chez elle. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000Fcfa par mois, qui seront réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is made up of married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioila, Kaladougou commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the republic of Mali). They got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell products including prepared food, plastic utensils and condiments. The women of the Djekafo group are on their 3rd group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their enormous customer demand.

Fanta, the woman standing third from the left, did not get an education. Having tried several revenue-generating activities without success, she now sells plastic utensils. She plans to buy 12 plastic bowls and 10 plastic cups from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash to a varied retail clientèle in Dioïla and at her home. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de DIOILA, commune de KALADOUGOU, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de de condiment, de savon, de parfum et de fruits et légumes. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à quatorzième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MAH la personne assise au milieu n’est pas instruite. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter 5 sacs de choux  fleur, 1 carton de poisson fumé chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce à une clientèle mixte à Dioïla. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20.000Fcfa par mois, qui seront en partie réinjecté dans l’activité, et le reste dans l’élevage de petits animaux.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is made up of married women with an average age of 38 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioila, Kaladougou commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the republic of Mali). They got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell condiments, soap, perfume, fruits and vegetables. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their 14th group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their enormous customer demand. The loans will be used to buy the merchandise already mentioned.

Mah, the woman sitting in the middle, did not get an education. Having tried several revenue-generating activities without success, she now sells condiments. She plans to buy 5 bags of cabbages and 1 box of smoked fish from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash to a varied retail clientèle in Dioïla. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business and the rest of which will be spent on breeding small livestock.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of cabbages and 1 box of smoked fish.

loans.name: José Santiago

texts.es:
José es un joven de 19 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a cuidar a su hijo de 3 años y a realizar los oficios del hogar. Vive con su madre pero solo su pareja y su hijo dependen de él.

Desde que ya no pudo continuar sus estudios, inició a trabajar en la agricultura a la edad de 14 años, junto con sus padres sembraban 2 hectáreas de maiz y una de yuca, también aprendió lo necesario para el manejo y el cuidado del ganado ya que trabajó como corralero en una hacienda. 
Ahora José produce 1 hectárea de maíz, la cual está a 900 metros de distancia de su casa, además trabaja como jornalero en los cañales que están cercanos a su vivienda.

José solicita este crédito, pues necesita comprar dos novillas, de esta forma logrará iniciar con otra actividad productiva. 

Él sueña con tener un lugar propio donde vivir y construir su casa, además trabajará muy duro para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que es una de las metas que se ha propuesto conseguir.
texts.en:
José, 19, is a young man who could only study up to the sixth grade. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of their three-year-old child and does the household chores. He lives with his mother, but only his partner and his son depend on him.

Since he could not continue with his studies, he started to work in agriculture when he was 14. He and his father grew corn and cassava in a two hectares plot of land. He also learned how to raise cattle when he was in charge of taking care of the livestock at a farm.

José is now growing corn in a one-hectare plot of land located 900 meters from his house. He also works as a day laborer in the sugar cane fields that are close to where he lives. He is requesting a loan to buy two heifers with the intention to diversify his activities.

His dream is to have a place where he can build his own house. He will work hard to improve his family’s quality of life, which is one of the goals he has set for himself.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Timinadia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIMINADIA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de DIOILA, commune de KALADOUGOU, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, et le commerce de condiment. Les femmes du groupe TIMINADIA sont à treizième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente YOUMA  la troisième personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte acheter150 kg d’arachide non décortique  avec les paysans à Zéta, elle le décortique et le transforme en pâte. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce à une clientèle mixte au marché journalier. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 10 000Fcfa par mois, qui seront réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Timinadia group is made up of married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioila, Kaladougou commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the republic of Mali). They got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell prepared food and condiments. The women of the Timinadia group are on their 13th group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their enormous customer demand.

Youma, the woman standing third from the left, did not get an education. Having tried several revenue-generating activities without success, she now sells groundnut paste. She plans to buy 150 kilos of unshelled groundnuts from the farmers in Zéta. She will shell the nuts and turn them into paste. She makes her sales for cash to a varied retail clientèle at the daily market. She expects to make a monthly profit of 10 000 francs, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy 150 kilos of unshelled groundnuts.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a 69-year-old farmer from Khlouy Ti Bei village, Mien, Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. She is married with five grown-up children, one of whom is married and lives separately. Together with her husband, Touch works on a few pieces of farmland for rice cultivation. She has been in this occupation for more than 30 years and earns a daily income of USD 5 per day.

Being a responsible mother, Touch is asking for a loan amounting to USD 500 to help her married daughter in the purchase of merchandise such as food ingredients and grocery items to sell. She hopes that the loan will be sufficient capital to help her daughter sustain her current business, so she can increase her volume of sales and stabilize her household income.

loans.use: to help her married daughter in the purchase of merchandise, such as food ingredients and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la  ville de Fana commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de tissus, de charbon et de boisson. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à neuvième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente ALIMATA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assise n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de boisson depuis 4 ans .Elle compte acheter avec 12 casiers de boissons non alcoolisées chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce dans son muni alimentation sise au carrefour de Dioïla. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000CFA qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women with an average age of 38 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the republic of Mali). They got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell cereals, fabrics, charcoal and drinks. The women of the Danaya group are on their 9th group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their enormous customer demand.

Alimata, the woman sitting on the left, did not get an education. She has been selling drinks for 4 years. She plans to buy 12 cases of soft drinks from the wholesalers in Fana. She makes her sales for cash to retail customers in her small kiosk at the Dioïla crossroads. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy 12 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Sot, aged 46, is an experienced farmer from a rural area of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham. She is a widow now and has four children. The primary source of her income is from farming, which is a traditional family business. She has been growing rice for more than 20 years and earning a daily income of USD 5.

One of Sot’s children has been engaged to be married soon, so she will prepare a wedding party for her daughter and she realizes that this will be a great expense. Due to insufficient capital, Sot wants to obtain a loan to cover the expenses incurred by wedding party preparation. She hopes to get this loan from Kiva lenders and she is confident to pay it back on time as it’s now her fifth loan cycle from HKL. She is very thankful in advance.

loans.use: to cover the expenses incurred by wedding party preparation.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Muslima was born in 1975. She is married. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. Muslima has five children. 

Muslima works in a local hospital as a cleaning woman. Muslima has worked there more than eight years. Her salary is small and is not enough for improving their living conditions. 

Her son is ill now. She must to buy medicines for his treatment but she has not money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy medicines. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment of her son.

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.en: Mansurjon is a young and purposeful man. He is 29 years old. Mansurjon lives with his wife and two children in a village in Tajikistan. He likes his country and works there with pleasure. Mansurjon has been busy with a taxi business more than 6 years. He runs his business successfully. He works hard but he has a hard time covering his daily costs. His son is ill, and he must to buy medicines for his treatment. Mansurjon is asking for a loan of $1,300 US to buy medicines for the treatment of his son. He awaits your support. This loan will help him to make better the health of his lovely son.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment of his son

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is a 43-year-old lady who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures wooden four-wheel carts. Her husband has been making wooden carts for many years and teaching his arts to his son as well.
 
Now the son has become a fine carpenter and can easily run a separate business, so he opened a new shop. Now he wants to buy tools and materials for making carts.
 
Therefore, Hafeezan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy materials such as wooden planks, wheels and tyres for making carts.
 
Hafeezan is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wooden planks, nails, wheels and tyres for making four-wheel manual carts to sell.

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en:
Wesam is 22 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her five siblings and her parents. Her father is a teacher. 

She is a university student majoring in Functional Treatment. Wesam is planning to find a better job after her graduation and to earn better income in order to support her family financially. But because she is facing a financial crisis, she is not able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: 08-01-02-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Hương has a retail business selling dry food and general goods. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food and general goods such as milk, candy and sugar to resell.

Hương is 34 years old and she is single with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

Hương is the group leader of the 08-01-02-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of five members. In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and items such as milk, candy and sugar to resell.

loans.name: 08-01-07-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood to make wood furniture.

Minh is 44 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her children are grown up. With her business profit, Minh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

In 2011, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 08-01-07-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of four members.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make wood furniture.

loans.name: 08-01-05-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Ms. Sáu has a retail business selling dry food and general things. She is 64 years old and she is single with five children. Sáu is the group leader of the 08-01-05-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, as her children are grown up.

In 2011, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sáu has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

She has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Sáu faces in her business is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food and general things to resell. With her business profits, Sáu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and general things to resell.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 35 years old and she lives with her family in Kapan city. Gayane got married very young and she did not manage to have higher education, since very soon her two children were born. Now her daughter is school-aged and her son has graduated school and looks for some job. Gayane’s husband works at the private company as a worker. Gayane herself tries to do her best in order to make their family income more. Now she works at the kindergarten and at the same time she is engaged in giving hairdressing services.  

The incomes that these spouses earn from their occupations hardly cover their family needs, but they greatly want to provide their children with comfort and now they rely on Kiva lenders’ support. Gayane asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some furniture (kitchen furniture and a sofa for the guest-room) for their flat.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for their flat.

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Run is a 52-year-old mother of three dependent children. To earn a living, she grows paddy rice, raises pigs, and sells grocery items as the main sources of her family’s income. It is the business that she has had for more than 20 years. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for six loans with a successful repayment. Now she leads a group of two to get a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more pig feed and piglets for raising. She hopes to raise her pigs healthily so that she can sell them at a good price.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a Kiva borrower. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 years to 19 years. She describes herself as trustworthy and committed to work. 

She operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk for selling and she also keeps poultry that produce eggs for selling. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more milk for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will enable her to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la  ville de Fana commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments, et de tissus. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leurs quatorzièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt a SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente NANA  la personne au milieu n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagnes wax depuis 8 ans .Elle compte acheter avec son argent 4 pièces de pagne wax chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail  en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 23 000Fcfaqui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women who average 49 years of age with five children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana in the Guegneka commune, which lies in the prefecture of Dioila in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they practise restauration activities and trade in cereals, condiments and fabrics.

The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their 14th group loan. They turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of satisfying their huge customer demand.

The customer, Nana, who is in the middle of the photo, did not go to school. She has been  selling "pagnes wax" (highly colorful and decorative pieces of fabric) for the past eight years now, and with her money she intends to buy four pieces of "pagne wax" from wholesalers in Fana. She sells her products retail and for cash at home and sometimes door-to-door to a mixed customer base. She expects to make a monthly profit of 23,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.,

loans.use: to buy "pagnes".

loans.name: Aqdan

texts.en:
Aqdan is a responsible mother of three daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance of his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore Aqdan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Aqdan's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income.

Aqdan  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Aqdan is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 37 years old, and he lives with his parents and his brother in the city of Vanadzor in Lori Region. For several years, he and his brother were engaged in the production of soft drinks. Now the two have started another business; they produce table napkins. His brother is busy with the production, and Gevorg uses his own car to deliver to more than 500 shops in the Lori and Shirak regions. They also receive great orders from fast-food centers. Gevorg and his brother are very resourceful and clever businessmen. They manage to have a decent income from their joint business and provide for their retired parents. 

Gevorg asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy raw materials to prepare a range of modern napkins for sale.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to prepare a range of modern napkins for sale

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de WARASSALA commune de WARASSALA préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de charbon, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leurs vingt quatrième  prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente WASSA la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse  de condiments depuis 6 ans. Elle compte acheter avec son argent 50 kg de sel 1 panier de légumes, 1 sac d’oignon et 1 sac de feuilles de baobab séché chez les grossîtes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché journalière du village à une clientèle composé de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa. Ce bénéfice sera en partie utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Laidou group is made up of married women who average 40 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, in the Warassala commune, which lies in the prefecture of Dioila in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they trade in condiments, charcoal and a variety of other products.

The women of the Laidou group are on their 24th group loan. They turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of satisfying their huge customer demand.

The customer, Wassa, who is standing in the middle of the photo, did not go to school. She has been  selling condiments for the past six years now, and with her money she intends to buy 50kg of salt and a basket of vegetables, a sack of onions and a sack of dried baobab leaves from wholesalers in Fana. She sells her products retail and for cash at home and at the daily village market to a female customer base. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will be partly used to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de WARASSALA commune de WARASSALA préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de charbon de bois et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leurs vingt quatrième  prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt a SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente NAH  la première personne a partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 5 ans. Elle compte acheter avec 60 sacs de charbons de bois sur place avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait uniquement à ses clients venue spécialement de Bamako. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000CFA qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Djantoyerela group is made up of married women who average 44 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala in the commune of Warassala, which lies in the prefecture of Dioila in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they trade in condiments, charcoal and various other products.

The women of the Djantoyerela group are on their 24th group loan. They turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of satisfying their huge customer demand.

The customer, Nah, who is standing on the left of the photo, did not go to school. She has been  selling charcoal for the past five years now, and with her money she intends to buy 60 sacks of charcoal locally from peasants in the village. She sells her products solely to her customers who come specially from Bamako. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.,

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat is young and hardworking woman. She is 18 years old. Saodat is not married. She lives with her parents in the southern part of Tajikistan. She began her own sewing business three years ago. She services her clients in her house. Saodat has regular customers, thanks to her good service. She wants to buy computer to use in her business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Tajikistani Somoni (TJS) to buy a computer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy computer for her business.

loans.name: Fulgence

texts.en:
Fulgence comes from a rural subcounty in Ibanda district.  He is a 48 year old married man with five children of which three are in school and the rest are still too young to go to school.  Fulgence deals in coffee farming and trade where he has been able to earn a living to take care of his family. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX.700,000 to help him buy pesticides and manure to prevent pests and diseases from his coffee plantation.  He hopes to increase his production to 100 bags of coffee every season.  His major challenge is thieves who steal his coffee when it is still in the field.  Fulgence hopes to construct a permanent home for his children.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and manure

loans.name: Josefa Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefa, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante y mecánico. 
Doña Josefa como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito  para su esposo el cual se dedica al comercio,  el un día a la semana se desplaza al mercado mayoristas a surtirse de frutas y legumbres en un camión que tienen, para luego trasladarse a Santo Domingo ciudad en la cual entrega sus productos a comerciantes minoristas, luego de entregar estos productos él se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Quevedo a comprar plátano el mismo que de igual manera lleva hasta su ciudad y vende a los habitantes de su ciudad, así el aprovecha de llevar productos y de regreso comprar más barato y luego vende a buen precio, el lleva 6 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y plátano. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda. Sus sueños son tener otro camión más nuevo.
texts.en:
The Salud y Vida communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This place is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Josefa lives.  She is 32 years old and married.  They have two children, ages 11 and 6.  The children go to school.  Her husband is a merchant and a mechanic.

Josefa, as a good wife, is requesting the loan for her husband, a merchant.  One day a week he goes to the wholesale market to stock up on fruit and vegetables in a truck that they have.  He then goes to Santo Domingo, the city where he delivers his products to the retail merchants.  After delivering these products, he goes to the city of Quevedo to buy bananas, which he takes to his city and sells to the inhabitants of his city.  This way he takes advantage of taking the products and buying them cheaper upon his return.  He then sells them at a good price.  He has been engaged in this business activity for six years.  He gets his family ahead through this business.

This loan is to buy fruit, vegetables, and bananas.  She has been in the communal bank for over ten years.  She likes it for the help.  Their dream is to have a newer truck.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and bananas.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de WARASSALA commune de WARASSALA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de céréales et de charbon de bois. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur vingt quatrième  prêt solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt a SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente DJELIKA la première personne a partir de la gauche n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement restauratrice chose qu’elle a hérite de sa tante. Elle compte acheter avec son argent 200 kg de riz, 1 sac d’arachide non décortique, 15 litres d’huiles et 1 carton de cube Maggi chez les grossîtes au marché hebdomadaire de Fana. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte dans son mini restaurant sise à Warassala au bord du goudron. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de70 000Fcfa. Ce bénéfice sera injecte dans la vente de charbon de bois qu'elle fait également.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of married women who average 37 years of age with two children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, in the Warassala commune, which lies in the prefecture of Dioila in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they practise restauration activities and trade in condiments, cereals and charcoal.

The women of the Sabougnouma group are on their 24th group loan. They turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of satisfying their huge customer demand.

The customer, Djelika, who is standing in the middle of the photo, did not go to school. She is currently running a restauration business, which she inherited from her aunt, and with her money she intends to buy 200kg of rice, a sack of unshelled groundnuts, 15 liters of oils and a carton of "Maggi" stock cubes from wholesalers at Fana's weekly market. She sells her products to a mixed customer base in her mini-restaurant on the side of the road in Warassala. She expects to make a monthly profit of 70,000FCFA, which will be partly invested in selling charcoal, which she also does.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a restauration activity.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 46 years old and she lives in the village Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region.  Anahit has a son who is 21 years old at this moment and he is unemployed and since he has no higher education it is difficult for him to find a job.  For the past 18 years Anahit has worked at the school as a teacher of physics and simultaneously with her son she is engaged in farming and agriculture.  They breed in their farm three cows, three heifers, two calves, three piglets and 40 chickens.  

Anahit manages to sell milk, meat and eggs to her regular customers from her farm.  As Anahit says the income is not consistent from farming, but she hopes that with her son they will manage to develop and have successes in it.  Anahit asks for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder since the hay that they bought for winter turned out to be not enough and Anahit hopes, that thanks to this loan she may provide her cattle with more fodder.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder since the hay that they bought for winter turned out to be not enough

loans.name: 07.01.15 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền has a manufacturing business making iron furniture.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Huyền is 37 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Huyền is the group leader of the 07.01.15 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents

In 2010, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Huyền has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huyền has been involved in this business for 6 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.en:
Zeboniso was born in 1977. She is divorced and does not have children. She lives with her mother and is a very hardworking woman. She has been busy selling clothes for more than 6 years. She runs her business well and has  developed it little-by-little. She is going to increase her working capital in the spring season. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy women’s and men’s clothes. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s clothes to sell.

loans.name: 07.01.12 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hòa has a retail business selling  food and drinks to resell. She is requesting a loan to purchase items to maintain the refeshment bar (a small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, and fast food).  Hòa has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Hòa is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children.  Hòa lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Hòa is the group leader of the 07.01.12 Phú Sơn  solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 


In 2010, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes that her business will do well, her children will find good jobs, and her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain the refeshment bar (a small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, and fast food).

loans.name: Sulejman

texts.en:
Sulejman does transportation with the vehicle you see in the photograph; he transports items and materials from the city of Korca to the town of Erseka. In addition to that, he has a little activity of bee hives. The loan he is requesting he will use to buy fertilizers and forage. 

The city of Korca where he lives, is known for the food, and there is a food festival taking place in the summer; some of the traditional foods are pies called “lakror and petanik”, long meat balls called “kernacka” and pickles called “turshi” made of tomatoes, cabbage, cucumbers, eggplants and peppers.

Sulejman is 32 years old and married with two children, six and two years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and forage

loans.name: Vereriano

texts.en:
Vereriano comes from Ntara subcounty Kamwenge district.  He is married with two children who are all in school.  He is a farmer who deals in banana farming where he earns income to cater for his family.  He does agriculture, specifically dealing in banana growing. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX.2,500,000 to buy manure and mulches for his plantation.  Vereriano hopes that with the manure, his yields will improve and so will his income.  He wants to be the best banana farmer in the region if given the necessary support.  His major challenge is poor road networks to the market and dry season which affects his yields.  Vereriano is very honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is 29 years old woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  With her two sons and two daughters, her children are doing studies in school.  Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 3 years and he is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Saba is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business.  He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.  Saba is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of Clothes for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SÉRIEUX est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TIENCELA commune de WARASSALA préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon, de savon et de condiment. Les femmes du groupe SÉRIEUX sont à leurs vingt unième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente MADIE la première personne a partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de savons de fabrication artisanale ''gabakourouni'' depuis 4 ans. Elle compte acheter 5 sacs de savons avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à clientèle composée de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa. Ce bénéfice sera en partie utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sérieux group is made up of married women who average 44 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tiencela, in the Warassala commune, which lies in the prefecture of Dioila in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they trade in charcoal, soaps and condiments.

The women of the Sérieux group are on their 21st group loan. They turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of satisfying their huge customer demand.

The customer, Madie, who is standing in the far right of the photo, did not go to school. She has been selling "gabakourouni" soaps made by local artisans for the past four years now, and with her money she intends to buy five sacks of soaps from wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells her products retail and for cash at home to a female customer base. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will be partly used to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy soaps.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mademoiselle AWA est une jeune fille agée de 30ans qui vit avec ses parents. Voulant aider son père dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes, elle a commencé à acheter des produits cosmétiques pour les revendre à ses amies qui habitent dans le meme quartier qu'elle. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. AWA sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 150.000F pour renforcer son fond de roulement et satisfaire ses clients. A l'avenir elle souhaite avoir une grande boutique de produits cosmétiques et voyager vers la chine  avec l'aide de l'institution.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa, age 30, is a young woman who lives with her parents. Eager to help her father cover the family's daily expenses, she started buying cosmetics to resell to her friends who live in the same neighborhood.

She starts her business day at 10 a.m. and finishes it at 5 p.m. She has more than three years of experience in this field. Awa is seeking this loan of XOF 150'000 in order to bolster her woking capital and satisfy her customers.

In the future, she wishes to have a big cosmetics store and travel to China with the help of the MFI.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children with ages 2 years and 4 years. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, juices, washing soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a very busy place, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital.

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of sugar, milk, bread and other items. His business goal is to operate a large retail shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, milk, bread and other items

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa est une femme qui est mariée et qui a 5 enfants à sa charge. Elle est à son 4ème prêt et évolue dans la commercialisation des produits maraîchères q'elle achète dans la zone des niayes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 25ans dans cette activité et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et revendre les produits maraîchères dans le marché de sa commune. Awa commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 18h. A l'avenir elle voudrait avoir une périmère pour pratiquer la culture maraichère et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir épargner de l'argent.
texts.en: Awa is a married women who has five children in her care. She is on her fourth loan and sells market garden produce that she buys in the"Niayes" area. She has more than 25 years experience in this activity and helps out her husband with the management of their daily expenses and her children's school fees. She is requesting this loan to buy and sell market garden produce in the market in her commune. Awa begins her day at 10 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 6 o'clock in the evening. In the future she would like to have a plot of land where she could practise market garding and increase her income so she can save some money.

loans.use: to buy market garden produce such as cabbages, carrots, turnips, etc.

loans.name: 05.01.01 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Lợi has a retail business selling shoes. She requests a loan to purchase footwear to sell.  Lợi has been involved in this business for 8 years.

Lợi is 43 years old and  is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents
Lợi is the group leader of the 05.01.01 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 


In 2010, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lợi has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Lợi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 20 years old and lives in a rented house in the Ibid sector of Jordan with her 7 siblings and parents. 

Her mother is a teacher. Iman is a university student majoring in Business Administration. She is in her 3rd year and is planning to find a better job after her graduation, earn a good  income, and support her family financially. 

She is currently facing a financial crisis and is not able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima est un couturier de profession. Il évolue dans la commercialisation des prêts à porter, il possède un atelier de tailleur dans le marché de sa commune. Il a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité. Ibrahima demande ce crédit d'un montant de 350.000F pour acheter des tissus qu'il utilise dans la confection de prêt à porter. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour a terminer à 19h. Il est marié et père de famille qui prend en charges toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.Il souhaiterait avoir un autre atelier pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de sa famille.
texts.en: Ibrahima is a tailor by trade and has been building up a business selling ready-to-wear clothing. He has a sewing workshop in the market in his commune and has more than 20 years' experience in this business. Ibrahima is requesting this loan of 350,000 francs to buy fabric which he will use to make ready-to-wear clothing. He begins his day at 9 o'clock in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening. He is married and a father and he covers all his family's daily outgoings. He would like to have another workshop to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make up and sell.

loans.name: Fatou Diop

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou âgée de 35 ans, est entrée dans le commerce  il y a de cela 8 ans. Elle fait du commerce de boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Sa journée démarre à 9h du matin pour se terminer à 20 h du soir. Avec le crédit, qui est le tout premier pour elle, va lui servir à acheter de la marchandise manquant à sa boutique comme de l’huile, du sucre, du riz, du lait. Fatou a comme charge ses besoins personnels
Comme projet futur, elle souhaite avoir une bonne assise afin de pouvoir ouvrir un jour un magasin.
texts.en: Fatou, who is 35 years old, began trading around eight years ago and she runs a general grocery store. She is married and a mother, and she helps her husband out with the family's daily outgoings. Her day begins at 9 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 8 o'clock in the evening. With this loan, which is her very first loan, she is going to buy goods which she has run out of in her shop, such as oil, sugar, rice and milk. Fatou provides for her own personal needs. Her plan for the future is to have a good capital so she can one day open a shop.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for selling.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
This nice woman of 52 years lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She has a higher education, and she has a specialty of mathematics. Marieta is married, and she has a daughter who is already married and lives with her family, and a son, who also is married and lives with his family with his parents. Marieta’s son is a very famous sportsman; he is a boxer, European silver medalist and also five-time champion of Armenia. Her husband also is a sportsman, and he is a very popular boxing trainer. 

Marieta works at the local school as a teacher of informatics. She also gives paid courses of informatics and mathematics at the home. She has a lot of pupils who take these courses with great pleasure and interest.

Marieta asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, and this loan will allow her to buy a computer and some professional literature that she very much needs for her teaching process.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature that she needs for her teaching process

loans.name: Al-Ghabry Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ghabry. It is made up of four women who are neighbors from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are hardworking women. They are taking out a loan of 80,000 YER (Yemen rials). 

Fatima is the group leader. She is 41 years old and married. She is a very efficient woman, because she likes to work, and thus, help her family. She has six children who are almost studying. Her business sells incenses and perfumes, and this has been her sole source of income for more than one year.  She has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy incenses and perfumes to sell to her customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve the income from her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business activities.

loans.use: to buy incenses and perfumes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wafa Albaitha Group

texts.en:
This group is called Wafa Albaitha. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members of group are very trustworthy, responsible and hardworking. They have all known each other for a long time, and they know each other well. The group has taken a loan of 130,000 YER (Yemen rials). 

Joma`a is a 31-year-old married woman and has children. She is very ambitious and loves her family very much. She has been operating a business selling perfume and incense for three years. She started her business to assist her husband to continue providing for her childrens' expenses. She requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy incense and perfumes so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality products.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality products.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is from Kagazi Sucounty Kamwenge district. He is a married man with three children who are all in school.  Edson is a very honest and hard working man. 

He deals in coffee farming and trade. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him buy another coffee farm from one of his neighbors. This will help him to increase his production and serve his customers very well. His customers are fellow coffee traders from the trading centers. 

He also hopes to buy a motocycle to help him to transport his coffee to the market in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a coffee plantation.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady est âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’ainé a 5 ans et  le cadet 1 an. Khady, avant de se lancer dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques, vendait du pain à domicile. Voyant que le bénéfice était très minime, elle a changé d’activité  dans l’espoir de pouvoir gagner mieux. Elle s’est alors lancé dans la vente d’effets pour femmes : tissus, produits cosmétiques, sacs... ; activité qu’elle exerce maintenant depuis 5 ans. Elle a déjà eu à bénéficier d’un crédit de 100000F CFA, et demande une augmentation de 100.000F CFA pour améliorer petit à petit son exploitation. Elle va acheter  pour revendre, des sacs à main, des bracelets et des tissus divers.
Khady ne supporte aucunes charges, mais travaille afin de diversifier ses produits et pour une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Khady is 29 years old, married and mother to two children, the eldest of whom is five years old and the youngest one. Before launching her cosmetics business, Khady sold bread from home. Having realised that the profit from this was very small, she changed activity with the hope of earning more money. She thus began selling products for women: fabric, cosmetics, bags..and she has been carrying out this activity for five years now. She has already had a loan of 100,000FCFA and is now requesting an increase of 100,000FCFA so that she can gradually improve her business. She is going to buy for resale handbags, bracelets and various fabrics. Khady does not have any specific expenses to cover, but is working to diversify her product base and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zibora

texts.en:
Zibora is a 47-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 15 to 25 years. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she grows collard greens and she has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the changes in seasons.

Zibora will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more collard green seedlings to plant. Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children to a higher level. She will use the anticipated profits to clear school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more collard green seedlings to plant

loans.name: M.saeed

texts.en:
M. Saeed  is 40 years old and  lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. 

He runs a small furniture shop in a nearby town and wants to sell sofas, beds, chairs, and tables. He is a trained carpenter and  makes different designed furniture items at his shop. People  like his furniture very much. He sells furniture at very reasonable rates and attracts many new customers.

M.Saeed is experienced in furniture making. So he plans to increase his business. He wants to buy sofas, beds, and wooden chairs to resell and  tools (coping saw, smoothing plane, combination square, bevel gauge, marking knife, card scraper, marking gauge, spokeshave, shoulder plane, block plane, and chisels)  to make furniture.

He easily wins the trust of his customers and  has built up a good relationship with them.   M.Saeed needs  to restock furniture items to meet his financial requirements. Therefore, M.Saeed requests a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; he hopes that the lenders would support him for his noble work.

loans.use: to buy furniture items and furniture making tools including a coping saw, smoothing plane, combination square, bevel gauge, marking knife, and card scraper.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 38-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for the past 5 years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, biscuits, tea and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, biscuits, tea and flour

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
