Abdoulaye  est un jeune couturier âgé de 28 ans qui s’active depuis 1998. Il possède son propre atelier ou il travaille avec d’autres jeunes tailleurs. Il est très assidu au travail ce qui lui a valu d’emporter  récemment « le ciseau d’or » de sa ville d’appartenance. Il est célibataire et grâce aux revenus de son activité, il satisfait les besoins quotidiens de son foyer  et ceux liés à l’exploitation.
Avec le crédit, il veut acheter une autre machine à coudre pour satisfaire ses clients. Comptant sur l’appui des préteurs il pense agrandir un jour son atelier voire ouvrir un autre à coté afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye, age 28, is a young tailor. He's been active since 1998. He owns his own workshop, where he works with other young tailors. He's very assiduous, which earned him recently to receive the "golden scissor" of the city where he lives.

He is single and, thanks to the income generated by his business, he provides for his needs and those of his business. 

With this loan, he wants to buy another sewing machine to satisfy his customers. Counting on lenders' support, he thinks one day he'll expand his workshop or even open another one next door, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Vachik

texts.en:
Vachik and  his wife live in the village Geghamavan in Gegharkunik region. Their children are  grown, married, and  live with their families. 

Vachik and his wife have  farmed for 8 years. This will be Vachik’s second loan from Kiva; the first one helped to buy 3 calves for his farm.

Vachik’s wife  makes cheese and butter to sell to regular customers. Land cultivation is also a part of their everyday work.  They grow potatoes, tomatoes and greens and sell it locally or to re-sellers.

Vachik wants to buy a cow, a calf, and some animal feed and asks a loan of 1.100.000 AMD and greatly hopes for support from Kiva for the second time.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a calf, and  animal feed.

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros is 51 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He is married and he has a nice family. His wife does not work and his children are already grown-up. His daughter has a specialty as a linguist, but now she is unemployed. His son is a student at Vanadzor State Architectural University in the faculty of cybernetics.

Petros, despite having a higher education and specialty as an electrician, has already been engaged in a clothes trading business for 20 years. He rents a stall at the Vanadzor wholesale market and sells men's and women's clothes of various fashion, size and season. He is very skilled in this field and, thanks to his polite and patient attitude, he attracts a lot of customers who very soon become his loyal customers. The merchandise for his stall he brings in from the Yerevan wholesale market once in a month. Over several years, Petros managed to do some saving which now, together with the loan amount that he hopes to get, will help him to increase his stall production and generate a higher level of profit from its sale.

Petros asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several mannequins to demonstrate his stall products more effectively and he also wants to buy some new clothes to renew his clothes collection.

loans.use: to buy mannequins to demonstrate his stall products and some new clothes to renew his collection

loans.name: Basra

texts.en: Basra, age 37, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she had contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shams Group

texts.en: Shams Group consists of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have asked for a loan of 180,000 YER. Faeza, who is 43 years old, is a married woman who lives with her family in Sana`a. She is the leader of the group. She has been accumulating money for a few years and is now renovating her house. She needs to buy paints, but she has no money left. She has therefore applied for a loan of 50,000 YER. She hopes to be able to open a savings account for her family members after finishing the house renovation. She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy paint for renovating her house.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 35 years old and is a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Safia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw.

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Safia has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Safia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Nguénar

texts.fr:
Nguénar, âgée de 31 ans, fait de la vente de mercerie et des produits cosmétiques et cela depuis plus de cinq maintenant. Elle est mariée et est appuyée par son époux qui l’encourage du fait qu’il la trouve brave et ambitieuse. Nguénar vient solliciter pour la première fois un crédit, afin de pouvoir acheter des garnitures manquantes à son stock. Nguénar, possède une cantine dans le marché du quartier et pour ne pas voir sa clientèle se tourner ailleurs, elle fait tout pour satisfaire à leur demande.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle se prend en charge et améliore son activité. 
Elle désirerait diversifier son activité un jour et devenir une grande commerçante, femme d’affaire.
texts.en:
Nguénar, age 31, has been selling notions and cosmetics for more than five years now. She's married and supported by her husband, who encourages her  because he finds her brave and ambitious.

Nguénar is seeking her first loan in order to buy items lacking in her stock. She owns a small shop in the neighborhood's market. To avoid losing customers to other resellers, she does everything to satisfy their demands.

With the profits generated by her business, she provides for herself and makes her business more efficient. She would like to diversify it one day and become a big reseller and businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and notions

loans.name: Selestine

texts.en:
Selestine is a 29-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest.

Selestine operates a retail business where she sells paraffin and petrol, and she has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a poor road network.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of petrol for resale. Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of petrol for resale

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 44 years old and she lives in the village Achajur in Tavush region. She is married and she has three children. All the family members are friendly and with great pleasure are engaged in farming and agriculture. Every year for five months Ruzanna’s husband and son go to the Russian Federation for constructional work and in this way they also try to provide their family with good living conditions. During this period Ruzanna does the main part of the farming work alone but with great success and skillfully. In her farm she has two cows, two calves, three piglets and the main farm product that she manages to sell is the meat. She also has a magnificently colorful and nice yard and a plot for vegetable cultivation (tomatoes, cucumber, greens, beans and onions). 

Ruzanna wants increase the number of her piglets and she asks for a loan of 1,100,000 AMD in order to buy six new born piglets and a lot of animal fodder for her all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy six new born piglets and a lot of animal fodder for her all farm cattle.

loans.name: Fawziah Group

texts.en:
This group of five hard-working women is called Fawziah. The members live in Sana`a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 230,000 YER from AMB.

Hafidha is a 46-year-old married woman living with her family in a poor area in Sana`a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house.

She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 28 years old and is a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 45,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 43-year-old woman who is a mother with five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Sajida’s husband is a taxi driver by profession and one of her sons is a salesman at a local garment shop. Her other son runs his own shop where he sells bed sheets.  

Sajida is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son purchase different kinds of bed sheets in bulk. Her loan will help her son continue the reselling process and provide quality products to fulfill the demands of his daily customers. Sajida’s loan will also help her son increase his daily sales and earn more profitable income. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for providing this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy different types of bed sheets in bulk to resell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 35-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself as being honest. 

Julius operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a fertile land and his primary customers are small-scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in climatic conditions. 

Julius will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy animal feed and other farm inputs. His business goal is to do large-scale farming within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand business and raise more profits. 

This is Julius' first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is 49 years old. He lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. Hakob lives with his wife and daughter (school-aged) and retired father. Hakob graduated from the Kapan State Polytechnic Institute in the division of Mining. 

Hakob’s wife is a musician and now she works at the school of arts as a piano teacher. Hakob also works at the school, but not of his specialty, he is a military head and teaches the pupils the theory of being a military man. In a nearby village, Tsavi, Hakob has a small, cute house and a plot of land. He has decided to start vegetable cultivation on it, and he wants to fence the space.

Hakob is asking for a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to fence the garden. He also wants to buy metal rods to make the fence safe from the outside part.

loans.use: to build a fence for his garden

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26 years old and lives in Salt sector in Jordan with his 4 siblings and parents. 

Mohammad noticed the financial crisis his family is facing and decided to support them financially. He recently opened his dentist clinic and wants to buy tools needed for his work.  He needs to buy a teeth whitening machine. He has applied for this youth loan because he doesn't have enough money to buy it.

loans.use: to buy a teeth whitening machine for his clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Ms.Naheed is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of 3 children. Her husband shown in the picture is a farmer and his income is not enough to support his family. Before starting milk production business, Naheed's family often lived in hand to mouth. She decided to support her family for a better and secure future of children. She started the business of milk selling with the help of her husband. Now she has 3 cows and has good sales of milk on daily basis. Her customers are satisfied and give her value due to her honesty in business. She has a very good credit rating with Kashf and currently is in her 4th loan cycle. Now she requests a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She wants to increase milk production according to customer needs and increased numbers of customer. She wants to use the profit of the business for her family needs and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of 7 children. Riffat has been selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia has successfully built her business stitching clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

To meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she needs to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of lace and ribbons in various colors.  For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time and be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of lace and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her medical expenses and decorate the grave of her mother who died recently.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en: Bukurije is back; her husband had a prostate operation and needs your financial help. The loan that Bukurije is requesting is for medical expenses for her husband and to do some home renovations.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's prostate medical bills and do some home renovations

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been doing business selling fruits for many years with her husband. She is very enthusiastic in her business of selling fruits and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. 

She is a loving mother of five children and is responsible for their food, health, and education through her business. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas. This will help her to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas.

loans.name: Roubina

texts.en: Roubina is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) who assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packages of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at their store. She is expecting to boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packages of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Razia  Bano

texts.en: Ms Razia Bano is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 4 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packages of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy packages of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: María Dominga

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 62 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive una de sus hijas que está casada.
Doña María tiene dos comedores, desde hace muchos años atrás empezó con un pequeño comedor en su casa pero con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los créditos pudo comprar otro restaurante en la vía Portoviejo, este comedor que no tiene mucho tiempo pero por lo delicioso de sus platos cuenta con mucha clientela, su hija se encarga del restaurante de su casa y  ella con la ayuda de dos personas más trabajan en el otro, trabajan desde la madrugada ya que preparan desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas,  a ella le gusta variar el menú a preferencia de los clientes. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le sacan de muchos apuros económicos en su negocio.  Sus sueños son tener un restaurante de lujo.
texts.en:
The "Salud y Vida" lending group meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture, as well as for its proximity to two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  María lives in this city.  She is 62 years old, and is separated.  She has three adult children from this marriage, and one of her daughters, who is married, lives with her.

María has two restaurants.  Many years ago, she started out with a small restaurant in her house, but with time and the help of loans, she was able to purchase another restaurant on Portoviejo street.  Although this restaurant has not been open for that long, it has many customers because of the delicious food.  Her daughter is in charge of the restaurant in her home, and María runs the other one with the help of two employees.  They work starting at dawn since they make breakfast, lunch and afternoon snacks.  She likes to change up the menu to suit her customers' preferences.

This loan will be used to purchase rice, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare her meals.  She has been in the lending group since its inception, and she likes it because the loans help her out of many financial problems in her business.  Her dream is to have a fine dining restaurant.

loans.use: purchase rice, meat, fish and other foods.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 41 years old and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. She is a graduate of Yerevan State University in the faculty of mathematics. Marine is married and she has two daughters. Both of them are already students and they study in Yerevan. Marine’s husband is a director of the city school and at the same time he teaches physics. Marine has worked for 10 years at the school as a teacher of mathematics. She also has five pupils who attend private courses in mathematics where she prepares them for the entrance examinations. 
Marine asks a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams to purchase professional literature (books of mathematical tasks and exercises) and she also wants to buy a computer.

loans.use: to purchase professional literature (books of mathematical tasks and exercises) and she also wants to buy a computer

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 45-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 2 sons and 3 daughters. Her husband is a professional rickshaw driver.

HIs rickshaw has not worked properly for many days and he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money,  it is difficult to cover the repair costs. Therefore, Sadia requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband pay for repairs. This will help him to continue his business.

Sadia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Star Group Bufunjo

texts.en:
Mathius is a member of Star Group Bufunjo. He is a 48-year-old, married man with two children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns rentals that he has operated for eight years, where he gets additional income. 

His main business is a retail shop. He started this business because there was demand for household goods in the expanding town of Kyenjojo. He has dreams of educating his children and turning the business into a large-scale retail shop.

Mathius intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another for a loan.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Shah  Baigum

texts.en: Shah Baigum, age 51, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she had contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Karshaidan

texts.en: Karshaidan is a 46-year-old married woman in the business of selling milk with her husband for many years. She has 2 cows and 2 calves. She sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her decent life.  She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. She has 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. It’s her 7th year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of it.  Currently she applied a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase another cow. She hopes to increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: Gulzar is 57 years old. She is married and has one child. Her child has graduated from college. Gulzar is an old client of the Kiva organization and she is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for every loan. She is a refugee from Fuzuli city and now lives in the Fuzuli Region, in the village of Bala Behmenli. For many years Gulzar has been running a cafe. At present Gulzar needs 2300 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy products, which are useful for her cafe. It’s her fifth loan. Previously she took four loans from Kiva organization and every one was repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 63 años de edad, hace años su esposo falleció pero  de esa relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija con su esposo y dos hijos menores que son su alegría.
Doña María desde hace varios años trabajo en una institución del Estado pero ya se jubilo y con esto empezó un negocio ya que es una mujer que no le gusta estar sin realizar alguna actividad con la cual sentirse útil, ella se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon, y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres  días a la semana en las mañanas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes ya que son muy buenos y económicos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva más de 7 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus metas son tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The Salud y Vida communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This place is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches, like San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where María, age 63, lives.  Her husband died years ago, however she has five adult children from this relationship.  Her daughter, son-in-law, and their two minor daughters live with her.  They are her joy.

Several years ago María worked for a state institution.  However, she has now retired.  When she retired she started a business.  She is a woman who does not like to be without some activity that makes her feel useful.

She sells products from Avon and Belcop catalogs (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week in the mornings, and she sells door-to-door.  She sells on credit, and she collects every two weeks.  Cosmetics and perfumes are what she sells the most because they are very good and inexpensive.

She is going to use the loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.  She has been in the communal bank for over seven years.  She likes it because the loans are quick.  Her goal is to have a store.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard lives in Ghukasavan village of the Ararat region. She lives together with her husband and son who drive a taxi. Nvard has been involved in land cultivation for many years. She owns two greenhouses where she cultivates greens. Nvard also owns a plot of land where she cultivates potato. The gathered harvest is sold in local open markets and the family earns income for living. Nvard is now asking for this loan to purchase tomato and potato seed. This will enable her to increase her agricultural income and improve living conditions.
Nvard will be very grateful to lenders if they support her agribusiness and she waits for their support.

loans.use: to pay for tomato and potato seed

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is a 49-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Basheeran’s husband, who has been running a business manufacturing footballs for many years. Basheeran also assists him by stitching footballs to complete their customers' orders on time. She is contributing much to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and received her sixth loan of 40,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase thread, rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in their sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase thread, rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity.

loans.name: Ana Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene  33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 6 y 4 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El es mecánico automotriz.
Doña Ana es una gran ama de casa que también se  dedica a la venta de ropa y  productos por catálogos de Avon, y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días ya sea en las mañanas o en las tardes cuando tenga tiempo libre, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva realizando esta actividad 11 años con la cual se gana lo suyo y le ayuda a su marido a sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa. Lleva más de 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The lending group "Salud y Vida" meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture, as well as its proximity to two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Ana lives in this city.  She is 33 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage.  She has three children who are 12, 6 and 4 years old.  The eldest is in high school, and the two younger ones are in elementary school.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.  

Ana is a homemaker who also sells clothing and products from Avon and Yanbal catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  She works every day either in the mornings or in the afternoons, when ever she has free time.  She sells her products door-to-door, on credit, and collects on a weekly basis.  She has been doing this work for 11 years, which has allowed her to earn a living, and help her husband to get their children ahead.  

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams and clothing.  She has been with the lending group for over eight years, and she likes it because of the help that she receives with the loans.  Her dreams are to have her own home since they live in a rental.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams and clothing.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en: Afshan is a 42-year-old married woman. She has six children and there are a total of eight members in her home. It was very tough for Afshan to manage her household needs with her husband's small income. She therefore decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she has started her business selling cloths in her community as she purchases cloths of different varieties from the wholesale market and then sells in her area. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase a variety of cloths for the summer season by taking in account the taste and choice of her customers. She hopes increase her income through higher sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Maria Genara

texts.es: María Genara mayor de edad, soltera originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país; ella es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa en la cual comercializa a sus clientes productos de granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, café, pan, gaseosas, golosinas, frijoles, pan, huevos, productos congelados, también cosméticos, medicamentos y ropa nueva, entre otros. Cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales, ella desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para ofrecer sus productos, es una mujer trabajadora muy emprendedora con muchos deseos de superacion personal. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su mini pulpería para  la compra de materia prima como: granos básicos, cosméticos,  ropa nueva, entre otros. María Genara agradece a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan a países pobres como Nicaragua y a personas de escasos recursos, para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en: María Genara is elderly and single and from the town of Chinandega, in the western part of the country.  She has a small store in her home where she sells basic grains, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, soft drinks, snacks, beans, eggs, frozen products, and also cosmetics, medications, and new clothing.  She has steady and new customers.  She opens her doors very early and is a hardworking, very enterprising woman with a great desire to succeed personally.  She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory such as basic grains, cosmetics, new clothing, etc.  María Genara is grateful to the Kiva lenders and the help they provide to people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have sources of work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Rosario

texts.es: Guadalupe del Rosario mayor de edad, casada, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, ella es una micro empresaria exitosa, propietaria de un taller de costura y manualidades en donde realizan: bolsos, carteras, mochilas, cartucheras, billeteras,  entre otros; también tiene una pequeña  pulpería  ubicada en su domicilio donde vende granos básicos como: arroz, pan, leche, café, golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, jabones papel higiénico,  entre otros productos, posee una experiencia de treinta y seis años en este negocio. Guadalupe es una persona con deseos de salir adelante con su familia, desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para ofrecer los productos a sus clientes, también lo comercializa de manera ambulante. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en materia prima como: tela, zíperes, pintura, hilos, entre otros, también para la compra de granos básicos; Guadalupe del Rosario esta agradecida con los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua para generar fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Guadalupe del Rosario is elderly and single and from the town of Chinandega, in the western part of the country.  She is a successful small businesswoman who has a tailoring and sewing workshop where they make purses, wallets, backpacks, saddle bags, wallets, and other things.  She also has a small store in her home where she sells basic grains, such as rice, bread, milk, coffee, snacks, juices, soft drinks, soap, bathroom tissue, and other products and has had this business for 36 years.  Guadalupe is a person with many desires to get ahead with her family.  She opens her doors very early in the morning to offer her products to her customers.  She also sells on foot.  Her goal for this loan is to buy supplies such as fabric, zippers, pain, thread and other things.  She will also buy basic grains.

Guadalupe del Rosario is grateful to the Kiva lenders and the help they provide to people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have sources of work.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Playa Azul Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Heizel mujer de 31 años de edad, acompañada su negocio es la de un taller de zapatería la cual ella fabrica zapatos, esta actividad la tiene desde hace 4 años, el crédito lo invertirá en compra de materia prima tales como cuero, galletas, fibras, royal, hilo, pega blanca, pega amarilla, suela etc. Tatiana tiene 25 años de edad su negocio es la venta de frutas, Scarleth tiene 28 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members.  Heizel is one of them and is 31 years old, married and has had a workshop for four years where she makes shoes.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as leather, cookies, fibers, royal, thread, white glue, soles, etc.  Tatiana is 25 years old and sells fruit.  Scarleth is 28 years old and sell clothing.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.fr:
Rehema fait partie du groupe Upendo et habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de  35 ans.  Elle a  4 enfants âgés de 7 à 18 ans tous  étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce d’huile de palme depuis  1 an. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the Upendo group and lives in Gitega. She is a widow aged 35. She has four children between seven and 18 years old. They all go to school.

She has been selling palm oil for one year.

This is her sixth loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and purchase a large amount of palm oil for resale in order to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, hair grease, hair relaxer and other items for her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 28-year-old married man. He has one child who is aged one. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the 35,000 KES loan to buy more stock of mobile phones and accessories. His business goal is to open more outlets within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Al-Fardos Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Fardos, and consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Thoria is the leader of this group. She is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very active woman. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family.

Her husband is an immigrant and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs, so she decided to apply for a 50,000 YER loan from AMB to buy furniture and home appliances to improve the living conditions in her house.

Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to buy furniture and home appliances to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Kubuntu Group

texts.fr:
S.Caritas fait partie du groupe Twiyubake et habite à Gitega. Elle a 40 ans et est mariée à Gérard, un commerçant. Ensemble ils sont 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 19 ans, dont 2  étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de matériaux de construction  depuis  20  ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de matériaux de construction  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
S. Caritas  is a member of the Twiyubake group and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and is married to Gerard, a shopkeeper. They have three children aged between two and 19, two of whom go to school.

She has been selling construction materials for 20 years.

This is her eleventh loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of construction materials for resale to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of construction materials for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en: Arshaluys lives in Arbat village with her husband, parents-in-law and two little children (ages 5 and 4). The family has been involved in agriculture for the last five years. Their farm is not big but they are working hard to enlarge it. The family raises a pig, a piglet and 15 chickens while also cultivating greens. Her husband works in construction but his salary is not large enough to pay for the family's basic needs. So agriculture helps them stabilize their income during month. Arshaluys is requesting a loan from Kiva  to be able to buy an ox to add to her herd. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy an ox.

loans.name: Maritza Johana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 7 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Maritza es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y así con sus ganancias seguir invirtiendo para mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida, ella desde hace mas de 8 años empezó vendiendo comida rápida en una carreta en la ciudad, vende hamburguesas, hot dog y sanduches, después compro otra carreta en la cual vende alas asadas, chuzos y batidos de fruta, ella trabaja todos los días y casi todo el día ya que empieza desde las 8h00  hasta las 12h00 y luego desde las 15h00 hasta las 23h00 que se va a descansar para así al día siguiente volver a lo mismo, ella en temporada playera lleva una de sus carretas hasta San Clemente, lugar de playas muy hermosas que son muy visitadas en esta época en la cual vende más de lo habitual y es en esta época que mejores ganancias le quedan.  
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, pan, embutidos, carne y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una gran cadena de carretas de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto every 15 days the “Health and Life Credit Group” meets. This locality is known for its traditional culture and, in addition, for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, namely San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Maritza who lives here is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 14 and 7. The elder child studies at a private school while the younger is in public school. Maritza's husband is also a merchant.

Maritza is a woman who likes to get ahead and, thus, she continues to invest her earnings to improve her business and quality of life. More than 8 years ago, she began selling fast food, including hamburgers, hot dogs, and sandwiches, from a cart in the city. Then she bought another cart and started selling roasted wings, snacks, and fresh fruit drinks. 

Maritza works every day almost all day long. She begins at 8:00 am and stops at noon; then continues from 3:00 pm until 11:00 pm. Then she goes to rest and returns the next day to do the same. During the beach season, Maritza pushes one of her carts to San Clemente, where beautiful beaches attract many visitors and she sells more of her meals, since better earnings are to be had. 

This loan will be used to buy fruit, bread, sausages, meat, and other ingredients necessary for preparing meals. With more than 3 years as a member of the Credit Group, Maritza likes it because she can improve her business with these loans. Her dream is to have a large chain of fast food carts.

loans.use: purchase fruit, bread, sausage, meat, and other ingredients to make fast foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa, a sus 63 años de edad, se caracteriza por su tenacidad y su empuje, es una esposa y madre ejemplar, siempre busca nuevas alternativas para salir adelante con su familia.
Actualmente se dedica a vender mercancía por catálogos y tiene algunos productos exhibidos en una vitrina del negocio de uno de sus dos hijos; la idea de iniciar este negocio surgió de la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, aprendió el oficio de manera empírica y hasta el momento ha tenido muy buenos resultados; adicionalmente y, de manera alterna, se dedica a la cría y comercialización de pollos, tiene los corrales ubicados en la terraza de su vivienda, cuenta con 150 pollos para cría y engorde y 30 más que están almacenados en un congelador listos para la venta; de esta forma complementa los ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales y faciales, accesorios, ropa), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos para ofrecer y satisfacer los gustos de su clientela, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos familiares.
Rosa manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir luchando para cumplir sus metas y proyectos, pues desea montar un almacén en un local comercial en el que pueda ofrecer sus productos y generar mayor rentabilidad, para continuar velando por el bienestar familiar y para disfrutar una vejez tranquila al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 63, is tenacious and hard-working. She is a model wife and mother, always looking for new ways to get her family ahead.
She currently sells merchandise through catalogues and has some products displayed in a display case in the business of one of her children. She got the idea to start this business because she needed to help her husband with the household costs. She learned in a hands-on way and has had very good results so far.
She also raises and sells chickens. She has their corrals in her yard. She has 150 chickens to raise and fatten, and 30 more that she saves in a freezer for sale. With this, she supplements her income to cover the household costs.
She will invest this loan in the wholesale purchase of merchandise (perfume, body cream, facial cream, accessories, clothing). This will allow her to have a greater variety of articles to satisfy her customers' demand. This will improve her sales and her family's income.
Rosa says that her age does not stop her from working hard to reach her goals and complete her projects. She wants to open a store in a commercial area in order to offer her products and make more income. She wants to continue selling for the sake of her family and in order to enjoy a peaceful old age with her husband.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (perfume, body cream, facial cream, accessories, clothing).

loans.name: Bibiamina

texts.ru: Эту сельскую трудолюбивую женщину зовут Бибиамина. Она уроженка района Гиссар и проживает там с мужем и детьми. Бибиамине 52 года. Она домохозяйка. В настоящее время Бибиамина готовится начать земледельческую деятельность. У нее имеется орошаемый участок земли, пригодный для посева. Бибиамина обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить семена пшеницы и минеральных удобрений. Она планирует  на этой участке земли посадить пшеницу ранней весной и уже к лету собрать хороший урожай. Бибиамине в деятельности будет помогать муж, у которого хороший опыт с этой сфере. Сейчас им нужна только финансовая поддержка, чтобы начать деятельность и обеспечить себя работой.
texts.en: This hard-working woman's name is Bibiamina. She is a native of the Hissar district and lives there with her husband and children. She is a 52-year-old homemaker who is getting ready to start a farm. She has a plot of irrigated land suitable for planting crops and has requested a loan to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers. She intends to plant the wheat in early spring and harvest by summer. Her husband has farming experience and will help her. Now they only need the financial support to start farming and to provide for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers and to start a farm

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Ms. Gulnaz is a 45-year-old married woman who has earned a living by selling crockery for the last five years. She offers various types of goods such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. Her husband works for a private firm while her two sons help her sell goods to people in their community and in local markets. She makes sufficient income to contribute to her family's well being. For the improvement of her business, Gulnaz contacted the Kashf Foundation and asked for a loan of PKR 40,000. Her goal is to buy a larger variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She expects to improve her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more crockery to sell.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five daughters. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for the past 18 years; he is the sole responsible person to fulfill the needs of his entire family and manage the household.

Shakeela's husband wants to purchase different types of crockery, e.g., jugs, glasses, dinner sets, etc. to meet the demand of his customers, but due to financial constraints he is not in the position to buy this merchandise for reselling purposes. To fulfill his business needs, Shakeela has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member of BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to meet his business needs. This will also help him to increase his daily sales and earn more income to manage the business and his family's needs.

Shakeela is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of crockery for her husband's business.

loans.name: Gull Zareen

texts.en:
Ms. Gull Zareen is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and over the past many years has been running a cloth business. She buys cloth, different fabrics in various colors and designs, from the big market in the city at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community for a reasonable profit. 

She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to expand her inventory  and attract more customers. Gull Zareen expects a boost in her earnings with this loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
María es un señora, soltera, no tiene hijos,  y se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria con 13 años de laborar, mostrando  ser una mujer muy dedicada a la enseñanza de los niños. También ejerce otra actividad como es el destace de cerdo los fines de semana.
Actualmente este señora está presentando la necesidad de comprar un refrigerador para el almacenamiento de carne, por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para compra de dicho refrigerador. Esta señora es su segundo crédito y se siente muy satisfecha con ayuda que le ha brindado ceprodel.
texts.en: María is single and has no children. She has worked as a Primary school teacher for 13 years showing her dedication to teaching the children. She also butchers pigs on week-ends. At present she needs to buy a refrigerator to store the meat so she has approached the offices of Ceprodel to request a loan to buy this refrigerator. This is Maria's second loan and she is very satisfied with the support Ceprodel has offered.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Hanington

texts.en:
Hanington is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kisaasi in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Hanington has been working hard to manage his brick-laying business, which also makes bricks. 

To help expand his business, Hanington has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more materials to make bricks, and will help Hanington to generate greater profits and boost his business. Hanington hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his capital.

loans.use: to add more materials to make bricks

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es:
Miryam es una mujer emprendedora, dinámica y servicial, casada y madre de un hijo por quien ha luchado constantemente para sacarlo adelante. 
A sus 54 años de edad, es propietaria de un negocio de venta de helados y jugos naturales, ubicado en su misma casa, trabaja sola durante todos los días de la semana y cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida en el sector gracias a su trayectoria como habitante del barrio y por los 3 años que lleva funcionando su negocio, todo esto es con el fin de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Motivada por las ganas de seguir progresando, solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar unas adecuaciones en el local (pintar las paredes) y comprar surtido al por mayor (helados, salsas dulces, frutas), esto le permitirá atraer nuevos clientes pues su negocio tendrá una imagen más agradable y además podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos, logrando aumentar las ventas.
Miryam manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es lograr una rentabilidad favorable en su negocio, pues quiere generar oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida de todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Miryam is an enterprising, dynamic, and helpful woman. She is married with one child and has been constantly fighting to get her child ahead.
At the age of 54, she owns a business selling ice cream and natural juice in her home. She only works during the weekdays and has the advantage of being recognized in the area thanks to her residence there. For the three years that she has had this business, she has had the goal of generating an income in order to help her husband with the household costs.
She is motivated by her desire to progress. This is why she is requesting this loan in order to fix up her sales space (to paint the walls) and to buy wholesale stock (ice cream, sweet sauces, fruit). This will allow her to attract new clients; her business will have a better image and she will be able to offer a wider variety of products. This will increase her sales.
Miryam says that her greatest desire is to achieve good profitability in her business. She wants to generate employment opportunities and improve the quality of life of her entire nuclear family.

loans.use: to fix up her business (paint the walls) and to buy wholesale stock (ice cream, sweet sauces, fruit).

loans.name: Esperanza De Jesús

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 58 años de edad, la mayoría de ellos ha trabajado como independiente, dedicada a la reparación y venta de electrodomésticos de segunda mano, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica, por medio de la observación y poco a poco fue perfeccionando sus conocimientos. Hoy en día tiene un pequeño almacén en el centro de la ciudad, allí compra los repuestos y partes de los electrodomésticos que desechan las personas y luego los arregla, así se ha ganado la vida y ha sacado adelante a su único hijo, por quien ha luchado incansablemente, ya que es madre soltera y toda la carga económica recaía sobre ella.
El crédito que solicita será utilizado para comprar insumos y herramientas de trabajo, con lo que podrá darle continuidad a su labor y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Esperanza manifiesta que su propósito es seguir adelante con su labor y hacerla más rentable, pues quiere cumplir el sueño de viajar a una playa colombiana a conocer el mar, ya que se lo merece luego de tanto sacrificio, lucha y trabajo arduo.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 58. Most of her life she has worked independently. She repairs and sells second-hand home electronics. She learned this job hands-on, through observation. Bit by bit, she perfected her knowledge. Today she has a small store downtown. She buys her spare parts and cast-off home electronics downtown. She then fixes the electronics. This is how she has made a living and gotten her only child ahead. She has worked tirelessly for her child; she is a single mother and thus responsibility for all aspects of the household falls to her.
She will use this loan for the purchase of supplies and tools. This will allow her to continue working and satisfying customer demand.
Esperanza says that her goal is to continue moving forward with her work and to make her business more profitable. She wants to achieve her dream of travelling to a Colombian beach to see the ocean. She deserves it after such sacrifice and hard work.

loans.use: tu buy supplies and tools.

loans.name: Kathreen

texts.en:
Kathreen, age 44, is a mother of three children and has been doing business sewing leather gloves with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years.  By this time, they have attained a good number of customers and earn enough income to meet their household expenditures.  

However, due to lack of availability of funds, they are unable to meet the daily demand of their customers. For this reason, Kathreen requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread, leather and packs of needles to create a means of increasing revenues so they may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, leather and packs of needles.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer pujante, luchadora y activa; madre de dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad y cabeza de hogar desde que tuvo que enfrentarse a la dolorosa muerte de su esposo.
Desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, comenzó a trabajar en el campo de la confección, como empleada, aprendió el oficio de manera empírica, por medio de la observación y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y ha mejorado los conocimientos.
Con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos y salir adelante, ella solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará dos máquinas planas y una familiar, la idea es aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presentó de asociarse a un taller de confección ya establecido hace muchos años, trabajará en compañía de su tía, propietaria del negocio al cual se asociará, en el que confeccionan prendas de línea propia.
Nancy manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es convertirse en una famiempresaria exitosa, para tener la capacidad económica de brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y disfrutar con ellos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nancy is a thriving, hard-working and active woman. She has two children, ages 7 and 10, and she has been the head of her household since the painful death of her husband.
About two years ago, she started working in dressmaking as an employee. She learned the job hands-on, through observation. Bit by bit, she has perfected her technique and increased her knowledge.
She wants to improve her income and get ahead. With this in mind, she is requesting this loan. She will use it to buy two flat sewing machines and one household sewing machine. Her plan is to take advantage of the opportunity of being associated with a well-established sewing workshop. She will work with her aunt, who owns another business. Together, they will make their own line of garments.
Nancy says that her greatest desire is to become a successful business person in order to be able to provide her children with a greater education, and to provide herself and them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two flat sewing machines and one household sewing machine.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram lives with his small family in Vanadzor city. He is 43 years old, divorced and has two sons who live with him. He also lives with his mother, who is retired and cares for his sons. Aram’s older son works in a construction-materials shop as a worker-salesman. His younger son is a student. Aram is also employed working at the city gas office as a locksmith. His life has been difficult, especially the challenge of raising two sons in a way that would make them honest and smart men. Fortunately thanks to his mother’s help he overcame all of these  difficulties and now their life goes on well and happily. Since they need to repair their house, Aram and his older son managed to set aside savings over the last several years, but still need more money to do the work. That is why Aram is asking for a loan for 150.000 Armenian drams, which together with their savings will be enough to repair their house and improve their life.

loans.use: to repair his house and improve his family's life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more locks, nails, hinges, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
"Julius is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kisaasi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years Julius has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soda and beer. 

To help expand his business Julius has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more house hold commodities and will help Julius to generate greater profits and expansion of his business. Julius hopes that in the future he will be able to earn high profits. 




"

loans.use: buy more  stock of soda and beer

loans.name: Jaider Enrique

texts.es:
Jaider es un hombre trabajador y pujante, con 30 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como conductor de bus de servicios especiales hace muchos años, pero, con el ánimo de complementar sus ingresos, decidió montar un negocio de venta de helados y jugos naturales; actualmente su negocio se encuentra ubicado al frente de su casa, en el que ha logrado ser reconocido por su trayectoria de 2 años en el mercado.
Con el ánimo de mejorar su condición económica y fortalecer su negocio, desea montarlo en su vivienda, en un espacio que ya adecuó para tal fin, ya que así disminuirá los gastos, pues ya no tendrá que pagar arriendo por el local y, con el crédito que solicita comprará un enfriador pequeño y surtido (helado, salsas dulces, frutas), todo esto dará paso a un mejoramiento tanto de las ventas y los ingresos, pues tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer y obtendrá un mayor nivel de utilidades, con lo que podrá seguir solventando los gastos del hogar y, en un futuro cercano, poder tener la capacidad financiera para adquirir un local propio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Jaider is a hard-working and vibrant man. He is 30 and has worked as a driver of special service busses for many years. However, with the goal of complementing his income, he decided to open a business selling ice cream and natural juice. His business is currently located in front of his home. He has been able to make a name for himself after two years in the market.
With the goal of improving his economic situation and strengthening his business, he wants to host the business in his home. He has already outfitted a space for this goal. This will decrease his costs; he won't have to rent the space. With this loan, he will buy a small freezer as well as stock (ice cream, sweet sauce, fruit). This will improve his sales and income greatly. He will have a greater variety of products to offer and will make a greater level of sales. With this, he will continue to cover his household costs. In the near future, he will have the financial capacity to acquire his own storefront and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy a small refrigerator and stock (ice cream, sweet sauces, fruit).

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Ms. Nazia is a 30-year-old married woman. The man shown in the picture is her husband. She has been doing a business of selling fruit for the past 5 years with the help of her husband. She is very enthusiastic in her business of selling fruit and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of four children. She is responsible for their food, health and education and trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement for her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase sacks of apples, oranges and other seasonal fruit from the wholesale market. This would help her in generating more revenue.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of apples, oranges and other seasonal fruits

loans.name: Sumer

texts.en: Sumer is 28 years old, a married woman and the mother of three children.  Two of her children are also shown in the photo sitting in rickshaw. The man shown in the photo is Sumer’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Sumer has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Sumer is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Alberto Elías

texts.es:
Alberto es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 46 años de edad, casado y padre de 6 hijos a quienes ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación, el oficio de agricultor lo aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y, desde hace 20 años ya posee cultivos de café, plátano y cebollas cuyas cosechas recolectadas, son enviadas al mercado del pueblo para ser vendidas.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para realizar adecuaciones al beneficianero del café y comprar abonos, riegos y pesticidas, con el fin de mejorar sus cultivos y optimizar el tiempo de producción.
Alberto sueña con tener una finca mucho más productiva, en la que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alberto is a simple farmer and worker who is 46 years old. He is married and the father of 6 children who he has raised with effort and dedication. He learned farming from his father and for the past 20 years he has grown coffee, banana and onion crops. Once harvested they are sent off to the market in the city to be sold. 

The loan Alberto is requesting is to help carry out work to assist his coffee crops and to buy fertilizer, irrigation equipment and pesticide. The goal is to improve his crops and minimize production time. Alberto dreams of having a much more productive farm where he can generate more employment opportunities and improve the quality of living of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plants and buy fertilizer, irrigation equipment and pesticides.

loans.name: Elonga B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Christine est une commerçante, trésorière et membre du groupe d’affaires « Elonga B », entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère 10 enfants, dont 6 à l'école et 4 autres sont encore gosses. Elle est une vendeuse des divers produits d’alimentation. Il étale sa marchandise dans une maison d’alimentation de la ville. Il commença ses affaires avec  le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est  un Chauffeur taximan. Plus tard, il bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter un lot de marchandises entre autres : 100 cartons de Jus, biscuits, macaroni, ect. Ainsi, il souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique, post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Our client Christine is a vendor belonging to the « Elong B » group, of which she is the treasurer. She is a 50-year old entrepreneur, married and the mother of 10 children, six of whom are in school and four are still little. She sells various food products. She displays her products in food center in the city. [She] has launched her business with the funds received from her husband, a taxi driver. Later on, [she] received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been in this business for 10 years. This new loan will allow her to stock up merchandise, such as 100 boxes of juice, biscuits, pasta, etc. She would like to bolster her capital, build a house, and provide for schooling, clothing and food expenses for her children. Finally, she sincerely thanks Hekima for allowing male and female entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system to become autonomous, especially at this difficult time following armed conflicts in the east of the country.

loans.use: 100 boxes of juice, biscuits, pasta etc.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a 35-year-old married father of two children, a three year-old and a one year-old.  The younger one was born almost blind.
Artur wants to take his little son, who has been photographed with him, to the capital city for a thorough eye examination with experts in the field.
Artur and his family live in the suburbs and the dairy products from the cow are just enough to feed the family. He has come from the very north part of the country, known for their hospitality and generosity.  Also, it is where he lived for very long time.

loans.use: to take his little son who was born almost blind for a thorough  eye examination

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 29-year-old, single woman. She describes herself as "strict." She operates a retail business, where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy a larger stock of shoes for resale. Her business goal is to expand, within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 46-year-old, married woman, and a mother of six children. She has been involved in the business of cattle-rearing for the past many years, with her husband. (He is shown with her, in the photo). She started this business by selling and purchasing of cattle, around eight years ago. Now, she is earning a reasonable amount from this business, and she contributes to fulfilling the basic necessities of the household. She has been working with Kashf for four years, maintaining a good relationship with a very good credit history.

Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use this amount to buy calves. She has a very strong credit history, and she believes that hard work is the key factor of her success. She always advises others to use their loans in productive manners, to do good for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Nurseyne

texts.ru: Нурсейне 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. По характеру спокойная и трудолюбивая. Заботится о своих детях и об их будущем. Супруг-пенсионер, помогает Нурсейне по хозяйству.  Двое старших детей работают, остальные школьного возраста. У Нурсейне - высшее педагогическое образование, работает учителем в сельской школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Нурсейне занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурсейне, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 20 овец, 6 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурсейне обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурсейне планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Nurseyne is 48 years old, married and raising 5 children together with her husband. She is calm and hardworking.  She cares about her children and their future.  Her husband is a pensioner and helps Nurseyne with the household.  Two of their oldest children work, and the rest are of school age. Nurseyne has a higher, pedagogical education and works as a teacher at a village school. To provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 12 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 12,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Nurseyne's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 bull and 20 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Nurseyne requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls in order to increase livestock headcount. Nurseyne plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells food and tea.

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food, milk, and water. This will help Faridah to generate greater profits and expand her business. Faridah hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more food, milk, and water to serve at her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Ms. Sonia is a 31-year-old, married woman, and a mother of two children. One of her children is shown in the photo with her. She has been involved in the business of flower-growing for the past many years, with her husband. She helps her husband in the agricultural activities, growing seasonal flowers according to the weather. Her husband sell the flowers in the market, at good profits.

She works very hard to fulfill the necessities of her household, including food, health care, clothing, and education. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizer and equipment, for the new season. This would help her to grow more flowers, which ultimately will help her to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and equipment

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of them currently in school. For the past four years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells household commodities.

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more household commodities to sell, including sugar, rice, posho, flour, eggs and bread. This will help David to generate greater profits and expand his business. David hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more household commodities to sell, including sugar, rice, and eggs.

loans.name: Laima

texts.en: Laima is a 46-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as confident. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations and pests which attack cereals. She will use this 10,000 KES loan to add stocks of cereals and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTML.

loans.use: to add stocks of cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Gonzalo De Jesús

texts.es:
Gonzalo, a sus 57 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, pujante y emprendedor, padre de una hija de 10 años por quien lucha incansablemente para sacarla adelante, pues se separó de su esposa y quedó encargado de su pequeña hija.
Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a ser comerciante independiente, tuvo una licorera, luego vivió muchos años en el extranjero y, desde hace pocos meses regresó a Colombia, con el fin de criar y ver crecer a su hija en su tierra natal; hace dos meses comenzó otro negocio, una cafetería en la que ofrece alimentos preparados por su madre como empanadas, papas rellenas, pollo frito y otros productos, lo cual le ha dado muy buenos resultados.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de materia prima y surtido al por mayor (verduras, mecato, gaseosa), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales, logrando mejorar las ventas.
Gonzalo manifiesta que su único propósito es tener una rentabilidad y estabilidad económica favorable, que le permita dar a su hija una buena educación y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
