Gonzalo, at his 57 years of age, is a hardworking, persistent and entrepreneur man. He is the father of a 10-year-old girl, for whom he has always fought tireless so she can get ahead in life. He is completely responsible for his daughter since he is separated from his wife.  

During his life he has dedicated to be an independent businessman. He had a liquor store, then he spent some years abroad, and in the last few months he returned to Colombia with the purpose of raising his daughter in their homeland. In the last two months he started another business, a coffee shop where he offers prepared meals made by his mother, like empanadas, stuffed potatoes, fried chicken and other products. All of this has given him great results.

The loan he's applying for will be used to purchase raw material and supply his business with products like vegetables, snacks, and soda pop. This will allow him to continue with his work and satisfy the needs of his clients, thus improving his sales. 

Gonzalo says that his only intention is to be profitable and have a good financial stability, which will allow him to give his daughter a good education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supply his business with different products (vegetables, snacks, soda pop).

loans.name: Benkoma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkoma est majoritairement  composé de femmes  monogames. Elles habitent toutes à  Kanadjiguila un des quartiers de Bamako, et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le commerce d’habits, chaussures, savons et des condiments à Kanadjiguila  à une clientèle mixte. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire. 
Madame Djènèba (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande  réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax et bazins,…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagne wax et 20 mètres  de bazins à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Djènèba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour fin d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso
texts.en:
The Benkoma group consists mainly of monogamous women. They all live in Kanadjiguila, a district of Bamako, where they are neighbors. As a group, they sell clothing, shoes, soaps and condiments to a diverse clientele in Kanadjiguila. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 2nd group loan cycle.

Mrs. Djènèba (standing at the far left) has built a great reputation as a seller of clothing (wax pagnes and bazins). She plans to use her loan to buy 10 wax pagnes and 20 meters of bazins in Bamako. She retails her stock in Kanadjiguila and door-to-door to a mixed clientele. 

Mrs. Djènèba expects to earn an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her activity. Her goal is to bolster her activity through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dalawusi

texts.en:
Dalawusi is 30-year-old married man with two children. He is a motocycle cyclist. He is also a farmer. He began this business to earn income to sustain his family. 

He will use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle.  

He hopes to put up his own home and establish himself. He faces the challenge of competition and poor roads. He is hard-working, honest, and resilient. 

In the photograph is the client and the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es hombre de 36 años de edad, el está casado y vive junto a su hijo de cinco años en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, cultivando, repollo, zanahoria y otras hortalizas, en un terreno que tiene a unos kilómetros de su vivienda. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos aceptables, ya que lo comercializa en el mercado local de su comunidad. Esta actividad es bastante rentable porque ha mejorado la economía de su familia.
En la actividad que realiza puede disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades para el beneficio de su familia. Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y zanahoria que lo usará para su cultivo.
Don Gilberto es un hombre que tiene varios sueños y uno de ellos es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y darle una educación de calidad a su hijo, para que en un futuro el pueda tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 36, is married and lives with his five-year-old son in the Department of Sololá. He says he has been working in agriculture for several years cultivating cabbage, carrots and other vegetables on a land he has some kilometers from his home. He believes this to be acceptable income as he sells his products in a local market. This activity is very profitable because it has improved his family’s financial situation. This activity allows him to have time to do other activities for the benefit of his family.

He is now requesting a loan of 3,500.00 Guatemalan Quetzal to purchase potato and corn seeds to use for cultivating.

Gilberto is a man who has many dreams and one of them is to improve his family’s living conditions and provide his son with a quality education so that in the future he can have better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase potato and corn seeds to use for cultivating.

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik is 52 years old, and he lives in the village Achajur, in Tavush region. Martik has no higher education, and since his young age he has been engaged in farming and agriculture. Martik is married, and he has a big family. One of his two sons is married, and his family lives with Martik.

Martik says that during a year they are mainly busy with farming, but sometimes, because they lack money and have a lot of unsolved financial problems, he and his younger son travel to Russian Federation. There, they do some construction work, in order to make their family income a little bit bigger. Their farm is not big; they have two cows, two calves, two piglets and twenty chickens. From their plot of land they gather hay for their farm cattle. They also cultivate vegetables, which they use for their own meals.

Martik greatly wants to make his farm bigger, and he asks a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams. He will use this amount to buy two more piglets and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy two more piglets and animal fodder

loans.name: Komandibela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Komandibela est majoritairement  composé de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila  un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du bois de chauffe, boucles d'oreilles, bazins et articles divers de  boutiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme debout en 2ème position à gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camion en bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Komandibela group consists mainly of monogamous women. They average 30 years of age and four children each, and they all live in Kanadjiguila, a district of Bamako, where they are neighbors. As a group, they sell firewood, earrings, bazins and miscellaneous shop merchandise. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 2nd group loan cycle.

Mrs. Mariam (standing 2nd  from the left) has built a great reputation as a reseller of firewood. She plans to use her loan to buy one truckload of firewood in the villages surrounding Bamako. She retails her stock at the market to a mixed clientele. 

Mrs. Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her activity. Her goal is to purchase some land for housing purposes with the help of Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is 36 years old, a married woman who has been running a business of milk-selling with her husband for four years. They have two buffaloes in milk and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.
 
They have five children, so they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make bigger profits, they requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater for more customers. They hope to have an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: To buy one buffalo

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est majoritairement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila qui est un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de légumes (piment, aubergine, tomates, choux, goyaves,…), condiments, tasses, chaussures et  habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèba (femme assise en  2ème position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des légumes (tomates, choux, goyaves,…) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 corbeilles de tomates, 5 sacs  de choux, 4 corbeilles de goyaves  au marché. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Djènèba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is mostly made up of women in monogamous marriages. They average 30 years old with 4 children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila, which is one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and met through neighbors. The members of the group buy and sell vegetables (peppers, eggplant, tomatoes, cabbage, guava, etc.), as well as condiments, cups, shoes and clothing. 

In order to increase their business, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their 2nd solidarity loan cycle. 

Djènèba (the woman seated 2nd from the left in the photo) is well known for selling all kinds of vegetables (tomatoes, cabbage, guava, etc.). She plans on using her loan to buy 8 baskets of tomatoes, 5 bags of cabbage, and 4 baskets of guava at the market. She will re-sell them retail to male and female customers. 

Djènèba hopes to use this loan to earn an average monthly income of 80,000 CFA Francs, which she will reinvest in her business. Her goal in working with Soro Yiriwaso is to be able to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her bar, where she sells soft drinks and beer.

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more beer, drinking water, and soda. The loan will help Hasifa to stock the bar and generate greater profits. Hasifa hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business even more.

loans.use: to buy more beer, drinking water, and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed and more cows

loans.name: Lahilala Group

texts.fr:
Composé majoritairement de  femmes monogames les membres du groupe Lahilala ont en moyenne 29 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila  un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le commerce d’habits (pagnes, tissus…) de toutes sortes, du bois de chauffe, condiments, légumes, et cosmetiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe décident de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assetou (1 ère assise .de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation  dans la vente des habits (pagnes et tissus de toutes sortes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 rouleaux de tissus au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle mixte. Madame Assetou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Made up mostly of women in monogamous marriages, the members of the Lahilala group average 29 years old with 4 children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and met through neighbors. 

The group members sell clothing of all kinds (pagnes [traditional wrap], fabric), as well as firewood, condiments, vegetables and cosmetics. 

In order to increase their business, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their 1st solidarity loan cycle. 

Assetou (seated 1st on the right in the photo) is well known for selling clothing (pagnes and all kinds of fabric). She plans on using her loan to buy 5 rolls of fabric at the Grand Market. She retails her products in Kanadjiguila to male and female customers. 

Assetou hopes to use this loan to earn an average monthly income of 30,000 CFA Francs, which will be reinvested in her business. Her goal in working with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 44-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 5 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes for sale. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Nelly describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient tailoring materials. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be able to supply clothes to supermarkets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan  was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a thirty-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as "innovative". 

She operates a retail business where she sells curtains and has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Rebecca will use the KES 30,000 of this loan to buy a stock of curtains. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy a stock of curtains

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kisaasi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Sam has been working hard to manage his stationery shop, which sells stationery items like pens, books, reams of paper, glue, files, and envelopes. 

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of  Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more of the items he sells, and will help Sam to generate greater profits and expand the business. Sam hopes that in the future he will be able to have a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more pens, books, reams of paper, glue, files, and envelopes

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 25-year-old married man. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a business where he sells metallic doors, boxes and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. 

Amos describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock metal bars, metal sheets and other materials for making items he sells. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: buy more stock metal bars, metal sheets and other materials for making items he sells

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Fred has been working hard to manage his poultry business; he rears chickens. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicken feed, more birds, and construct a hen house, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and improve the business. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, more birds, and construct a hen house

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Gazala is a married woman. She has successfully built her business selling clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Gazala requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 58 years old and lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Anahit is divorced with two children, a son and a daughter. Her son is married and lives with his family in Yerevan city.  Anahit’s daughter recently moved to Yerevan with the hope of finding a job. Now she lives with her brother’s family. Anahit has a higher education and works as a teacher of mathematics. Since Anahit now lives alone it is very convenient for her to give private mathematics lessons so she helps many pupils prepare for entrance examinations.    
Anahit asks for a loan of 1.100.000 Armenian drams to buy a computer to stay aware of innovations in teaching technologies and also to buy some professional literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer to stay aware of innovations in teaching technologies and also  to buy some professional literature

loans.name: Johannah

texts.en:
Johannah is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Johannah is 20 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying for a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration. The classes I enjoy the most are principles of science and creative intelligence, Human resources, Business law and ethics, Higher states of consciousness and Diet and nutrition.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“While I would be prepared to start as a receptionist to gain experience, I would like to become an auditor at an international firm such as KPMG.”

Tell us about your background?

“I was born in Pretoria in 1993. I have three sisters, Peggy, Hildah and Prudence. My father is a pharmaceutical manager at Sastel and my mother is not working. I currently live with my oldest sister and don’t have any children yet.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“I like to play music and DJ at a few clubs in the neighbourhood. I also like reading novels.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“I will have no financial problems and will be able to study knowing that my fees have been paid. This will encourage me to work even harder to achieve my degree. It will also help towards my transport costs.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been successfully running a general store selling confectionery items with her husband. She has 13 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing her stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Shazia is a mother of three children and motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare and education. She wants to grow her business so she requested Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 60,000 to buy packs of chocolates, biscuits and candies from the market. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of chocolates, biscuits and candies from the market.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 27-year-old married woman with four children. She describes herself as polite. She operates a food stall where she cooks potato chips to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more potatoes for making potato chips. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan  was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: buy more potatoes for making potato chips

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kisaasi in Kampala in the east region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Rose Mary has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which rears broilers. 

To help expand her business, Rose Mary has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more broilers and feeders and will help Rose Mary to generate greater profits and increase her family income. Rose Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to have many similar businesses elsewhere.

loans.use: to add more broilers and feeders.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes for resale. This will enable her to have more stock to sell, hence increasing sales and profits. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a permanent house. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes for sale. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are rural residents. 

Elizabeth will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric, thread and an embroidery machine. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy and successful. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan  was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest back into the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread and an embroidery machine

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen is 54 years old and he lives in the village Aygehovit in Tavush. He is married and he has a son and a daughter who are already married. This peasant family hopes for the second loan from Kiva lenders. The first one helped them greatly to re-fence their fruit-vegetable garden and to buy tree seedlings. Shahen now has a tractor which helps him to do different paid work around his village. For some time, he used to work as a mechanic, then he worked as a contractual military serviceman. However, he was wounded and now receives a military pension. Lately, Shahen seriously became engaged in beekeeping also and together with his wife they manage to sell honey of good quality.
 
This time Shahen needs a loan in an amount of 1,200,000 Armenian drams in order to repair his tractor, which is out of order now, as it helps Shahen to earn the main income of his family.

loans.use: to repair his tractor, which is out of order now, as it helps Shahen to earn the main income of his family.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old and lives with his parents in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Daniel works at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical University on the faculty of physical education and sport. At the same time, Daniel is a trainer of the football team in the Lori region. Thanks to his professionalism and skills, his team has had great success both in Armenia and abroad. He teaches his sportsmen to be attentive and play honestly and always remember the instructions he gives them. 
Daniel asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer to help him stay aware of all sports news around the world and also to buy some sports accessories.

loans.use: to buy a computer to stay aware of all sports news around the world and also to buy some sports accessories

loans.name: Tugumane Group

texts.fr:
Rémy  fait partie du groupe Tugumane et habite à Gitega. Il est séparé de sa femme. Il a 5 enfants âgés de 8 à 12 ans, tous  étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis  32  ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière  de banane à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait faire le commerce de boutique comme une deuxième activité et acheter des terres  comme héritage pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rémy is part of the group called Tugumane and lives in Gitega. He is separated from his wife. He has five children aged between eight and 12 years of age and all are enrolled in school. 

He has been selling banana beer for 32 years. 

This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he receives, he is going to grow his working capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer to resell in order to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to open a little store as a second business and buy some land to leave to his children.

loans.use: to grow his working capital so as to buy a large quantity of banana beer for resale

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 26 years old and lives in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. Mher lives with his brother’s family. He has no higher education and after being back from the army, he went to the Russian Federation where he did different construction work. However, very soon, Mher got tired of that work and he decided to start farming and agricultural activities. Now, together with his brother, they have a small, nice farm. On their farm, they have 2 cows, 5 bulls, 5 sheep, 2 piglets and 30 chickens. On their plot of land they cultivate some vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, greens, pepper and onions) and fruits (apple, plum and fig), which they mainly use for their family. As Mher says, the main income for their family is from the sale of meat, eggs and dairy products (milk, cheese and macun (Armenian national dairy-product)). All these they sell to their regular customers and to re-sellers.

Now Mher is asking for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy animal fodder and two cows.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and two cows

loans.name: Sanasar

texts.en:
Sanasar lives with his wife and son. His wife works at the local village hall and his son is employed in the private sector. Sanasar himself has been involved in agriculture. He is a farmer with many years of experience. Near the house where the family lives, Sanasar owns arable land where he keeps livestock and cultivates different fruits and vegetables. 

Sanasar is a hardworking farmer and does his best to sustain his farm and successfully run it. Now, by asking for this loan Sanasar asks for your support to be able to purchase a cow and forage. The loan is important for his farm and he hopes for lenders' support. 
 
Sanasar has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before but, because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that his farm business is successful, he is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Sanasar has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sausages for her business.

loans.name: Saud Al-Wafa Group

texts.en:
This group of four hard-working women is called Saud Al-Wafa. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Suad is a 24-year-old married woman living with her family in a poor area. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned with the well-being of her family. They are now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house.

She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic and soda drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, charcoal, fish, onions, meat, oil, etc. to increase her sales even more.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave wants to buy a dairy cow with this loan. Livestock is the activity that she has been practicing for sometime. She has already a dairy cow and three goats and sells the dairy products to the locals. Dave also weaves wool from sheep and then she knits sweaters, socks and vests with it. In the region where she lives, it is very cold and dressing up warm is mandatory. The way Dave is dressed is very traditional in the northern part of the country. 

The little commune where Dave lives has been known for its copper mines built since 1900. In 1934, Italian investors continued their mining activity up until Albania was created as a country in 1944. During the communist era, the same activity continued, and unfortunately since the collapse of the regime, there has been no such activity. Due to the poverty level among the villagers, some children quit going to school and they dig for copper metal to sell.

loans.use: to add a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elton

texts.en: Elton is 29 years old and has been a taxi driver for five years. He is married with two children. Elton’s wife is a housewife taking care of the children, one 3 years old and the other a newborn. They are live in the Baku region. Elton has applied for a loan through Komak company in amount of 800 AZN to repair his taxi salon. He is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help. In the future, Elton wants to buy new wheels and other improvements for his car.

loans.use: to repair his taxi salon

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 36-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells vehicle lubricants. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place, and her primary customers are mechanics. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of lubricants. Her business goal is to open a garage within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a home. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more vehicle lubricants

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 36-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are his regular customers. 

Hamisi will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to open a retail shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Japhred

texts.en: Japhred is a married man who has eight children. He describes himself to be spiritual. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are urban residents. He will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy more stock of timber for resale. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber for resale

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a 34-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two to 12 years old. He describes himself to be time conscious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in Masis town with her parents, brother and nine-year-old son. Her family has been involved in agriculture for eight years. They own a greenhouse where greens are grown. As the income from agriculture is hardly enough to cover their basic costs, the family needs an alternative source of income. Gayane works in the private sector as well and works hard to provide appropriate living conditions for her child. Now, by applying for this loan, Gayane is asking for financial support to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse. Gayane will be very grateful to lenders who support her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a cover for her greenhouse and pay for renovations

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 43-year-old married man with six children. They all live in Rwakibira, Rwerere – Rukungiri District. He deals in trade of coffee and transport business. He has had challenges in his business ranging from coffee price fluctuations to the long dry spells which dry the coffee, thus affecting its production.

He has approached UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. He hopes to use this loan to improve his coffee gardens by mulching his plantation with the plan of improving his coffee productivity, which will improve his livelihood and that of his family. In set is George in his coffee plantation.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is an old borrower, aged 36 years old. He is a married man, with six children. He is a farmer and he supplements his income with charcoal-selling. 

Apollo has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to improve on his farming methods. He has a challenge of little output from his farming, so he wants to use the money to buy fertilizer. 

He has educated his children from the profits of the previous loan, so he decided to come to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for a loan to improve his farming methods. In the photo, Apollo is with his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Tofasi

texts.en:
Tofasi is a long serving client of the institution and is aged 62 years old. 
She is married with 6 children and has one child attending school.
She deals in cattle fattening where she gets income to take care for her family.
She started the cattle fattening business in 1992 and has since sustained it.
She wants to use the loan given to her to set up another business so as to increase her earnings. This will help her to bring service closer to her village mates. She is hard working!

loans.use: To begin a retail business to sell house hold use items

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a new client. He has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000. He is a single, young man, aged 32 years. He managed to finish University a few years back. After failing to get formal employment, he opted to go into his own business. He rented a hall in Rukungiri Town where he runs a disco club. He also has a mobile disco which he hires out for additional income.

Philip's major challenge has been lack of enough capital to expand his business. He wants this money to renovate the dancing hall to make it more decent so as to attract more customers. He hopes to get more money and build his own club in order to save rent money.

The income from this business has really supported his family. In the photograph is the client and the UGAFODE Credit Officer(left to right).

loans.use: to renovate a building.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married with children, who are all going to school. An old client with the institution, he has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings.

Partick hails from Butimba, Western Division, in Rukungiri Municipality. He runs a diary farm in Rukungiri town, where he has been operating for the last five years.

His major challenges have been power blackouts and a lack of capital to increase his business. He hopes, with the facility of this loan, he will be able to complete his building and use the balance to purchase a generator.

When his house gets finished, he hopes to relocate to this place and save on rent. In the photograph is the client (on the right) and the Ugafode Credit officer.

loans.use: To complete construction on his building.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, sardines and other items for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old man who is married and has three children. He hails from Nyabihinga village in Rwentondo parish, the eastern division of the Rukungiri district, and he applied for a loan of UGX.800,000.
 
Joseph has a small business of selling shoes. He has been in this business for so many years and it has helped him to obtain income to take care of his family. He will use the money to buy stock of shoes to sell, and he anticipates big sales from parents who are buying for children as they go back to school.

He is a very hardworking man but has been challenged by insufficient capital for investing in business so as to expand it. With this loan from UGAFODE, he is hopeful that he will be able to expand his business. In the photo is Joseph, his wife and child at the business.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan est composé de 2 femmes monogames et 2 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font la restauration, la vente des parures, des articles divers, des fruits et légumes. Dans la nécessité d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er   cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sanko  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la restauration surtout dans la préparation des plats à base des céréales comme le mil et le riz.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz, 1 sac maïs, 1 sac de sorgho  au marché. Madame Sanko procède à la cuisson des plats avant de les revendre en détail dans son restaurant à Hamdallaye  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Sanko espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is made up of 2 women in monogamous marriages, and 2 in polygamous marriages. They average 41 years old with 5 children each. They all live in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and met through neighbors. 

The group members sell prepared food, adornments, sundries, fruits and vegetables. In need of increased business, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their 1st solidarity loan cycle. 

Sanko (the woman seated on the far left in the photo) is well known for selling prepared food, especially dishes made from grains like millet and rice. She plans on using her loan to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 bag of corn, and 1 bag of sorghum at the market. Sanko prepares the dishes, and then sells them in her restaurant in Hamdallaye to a diverse clientele. 

Sanko hopes that this loan will help her earn an average monthly income of 60,000 CFA Francs, which will be reinvested in her business. Her goal in working with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Gedraph

texts.en:
Gedraph is a 26-year-old, single man. He describes himself as being disciplined. 

Gedraph operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenges to be lack of funds and insecurity. 

Gedraph will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a fleet of motorcycles within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will buy a motor vehicle for business. 

This is Gedraph's seventh loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Previous loans were successfully repaid. He will use the anticipated profits to open a spare parts shop.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase water for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and rice to sell

loans.name: Rukhsan

texts.en:
Rukhsan is a 20-year-old married woman working in the milk selling business with her husband who is also shown in the picture. She has one cow that she uses to produce milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit. 

Rukhsan has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Rukhsan is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase  one more cow.

loans.name: Kodon Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les six membres du groupe Kodon ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe  le petit commerce de pommes de terres, légumes, habits et jarres. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de .pommes de terre. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs  de pommes de terres à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokia compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living mostly in polygamous households, the six members of the Kodon group average 34 years old with 4 children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and met through neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market. 

The group members sell potatoes, vegetables, clothing and earthenware vessels. With an eye to increasing their business, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their 1st solidarity loan cycle. 

Rokia (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) is a well-known potato vendor. She plans on using her loan to buy 15 bags of potatoes in Bamako. She re-sells them in Kanadjiguila to mostly female customers. 

Rokia plans on using this loan to help her earn an average monthly income of 40,000 CFA Francs, which she will reinvest in her business and use to meet household needs.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from the winter collection to resell in her store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 22 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Betty has been working hard to manage her local brew business where she sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making local brew. The loan will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her education. Betty hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 




"

loans.use: to buy more materials for making local brew

loans.name: Bushira

texts.en:
Bushira is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Bushira has been working hard to manage her carpentry workshop, which sells chairs, tables, stools. 

To help expand her business, Bushira has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber and wood, and will help Bushira to generate greater profits and help the family. Bushira hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a whole sale shop.

loans.use: buy more timber and wood.

loans.name: Azez

texts.en:
Azez is a 52-year-old married man from a small village near Nablus city. He is a father of five sons and four daughters. For the past fifteen years, Azez has been working as a construction worker. It is a good job but with a non-stable income. 

Azez took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new construction tools for his business. By taking this loan, Azez will be able to improve his work and increase his productivity. 

Azez appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy new construction tools for his business.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 39 years old and lives in the village of Tsaghkunk in Gegharkunik region. Karen is married and has a daughter who is already a student at an Architectural University. Karen’s wife is unemployed and she takes care of their family and house. Karen’s mother also lives with them and she is already retired. For 15 years, Karen worked as a mechanic, but now he is engaged in farming. All members of the family are engaged in the care of the farm, particularly his mother who helps her son very much. She milks the cows and makes perfect cheese and butter. Karen breeds five cows, four calves and ten sheep. He sells mutton and beef to local butchers and dairy products to villagers.

Karen is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy two calves and a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to resell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Because Eman is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Eman was born in 1963. She is a widow living in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her four sons and daughter. One of her sons is a University student majoring in Accounting. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation to help his family financially because of the financial crisis they are facing. But Eman doesn't have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her son's semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Al Waed 50467 Group

texts.en:
Hanadi is the featured borrower of Al Waed 50467 group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Hanadi is a 29-year-old married mother of two children who has been working in selling clothes from her house for five years to assist her husband in their living and take good care of her beloved children.

Today Hanadi's acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special spring and summer collection with special offer prices.

Hanadi is working hard to increase her business capital and open her own clothes selling shop in the future.

Hanadi is the first lady sitting at the right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Nahida is the second from the right, Ghaniya is the lady at the center, Jahida is the second from the left and Dalal is the first from the left.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special spring and summer collection with special offer prices.

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is 42-years old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a buthcher by profession; he sells chicken over shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell it over his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop. 
Therefore, Noureen  requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy broilers to sell over shop. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children.
Noureen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy broilers to sell over chicken shop

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo es un hombre soltero de 53 años de edad, actualmente vive en unión de hecho con su pareja y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales ya solo tres viven con él, ya que los otros ya tienen familia ambos viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que se dedica a dos actividades una de ellas, es la elaboración y venta de telas artesanales que lo realiza desde su vivienda y la otra actividad es la compraventa de verduras, la cual lo comercializa en la ciudad. Ambas tareas le han proporcionado ingresos y ganancias que contribuyen a la economía de su familia.
Por lo que ahora ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de verduras y tejido artesanal ya que de esta manera podrá mejorar sus servicios y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Camilo sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Camilo is a single, 53 year-old man who lives with his life partner and has seven children.  Three of them live with him and the others have formed their own families.They live in the department of Solola. 

He states that he works at two activities: one is the creation and sale of hand-woven fabrics which he does from his house; the other is the purchase and sale of vegetables which he sells in the city.  Both activities have provided income and earnings that have contributed to his family's finances, so now he has decided to request a loan of Q 3,000 ($400) to buy vegetables and woven fabrics. In this way he will be able to improve service to his customers and also increase his earnings.  

Camilo dreams of improving his family's living conditions so that they might have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and woven fabric.

loans.name: Savino

texts.en:
Savino is married with six children, who are all in school.

He deals in small scale coffee and banana farming where he earns income to take care of his family. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to help him buy manure and fertilizers for adding to his plantations. From this, Savino hopes to improve on the production of both coffee and bananas which will help him serve his customers well and also increase his profits. Savino is a very hardworking man.

He also hopes to build a permanent home for his family with the profits accrued from the loan. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 20-years-old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar, rice, salt and other items. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, rice, salt, bread and other items.  This will help Agnes to generate greater profits and provide some of the basic needs for her family. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land for her business.

loans.use: buy more sugar, rice, salt, bread and other items

loans.name: María Abigail

texts.es:
Abigail es madre soltera de dos hijos adolescentes, por quienes ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlos adelante. Tiene 44 años de edad, 20 de ellos, dedicada a trabajar como comerciante independiente, tiene una salsamentaría y licorera en la que trabaja sola todos los días de 3 pm a 12 am, logrando así generar recursos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer su negocio y así poder hacerle frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector, con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (licor, cervezas, gaseosas, mecato, dulces), logrando satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, mejorando así las ventas.
Abigail manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo a su negocio, pues se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos y requiere tener mayor rentabilidad para dar una buena educación a sus hijos y permitirles disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Abigail is a single mother to two adolescents, for whom she has not stopped fighting in order for them to get ahead. Abigail is 44 years old and has spent 20 of these years working as an independent businesswoman. She has a liquor store and pub. She works alone every day from 3pm until midnight and is able to earn enough to cover household costs.

Abigail is currently applying for a loan in order to strengthen her business and, as a result, face the local competition. Abigail will use this loan to buy stock (liquor, beers, fizzy drinks, snacks and sweets) in bulk. She can then satisfy her customers' needs and tastes and, therefore, increase he sales.

Abigail tells us that her greatest desire is to keep her business going. It has become her only source of income and needs to be more profitable in order to give her children a good education and to allow them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock (liquor, beers, fizzy drinks, snacks and sweets) in bulk.

loans.name: Nafez

texts.en:
Nafez is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids; four sons and one daughter. Nafez works in transporting goods for the local traders using his car. This is the only source of income for the family. Nafez would like to improve his business and the's family living conditions.
 
Nafez took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more grocery products and transfer them to the local market to resell them. By taking this loan, Nafez will be able to improve his business and income.

Nafez appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products and transfer them to the local market to resell them.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es  un hombre casado de 43 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja y sus tres hijos de 17,19 y 21 años,  de los cuales dos ya se graduaron de una profesión y el otro aun sigue estudiando, actualmente residen en el Departamento de Sololá.
Miguel es un hombre que busca la manera de cómo salir adelante junto a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de trajes típicos, que son utilizados en su comunidad. Esta  actividad le ha generado  buenos  ingresos y ganancias. Como también se dedica a manejar una lancha, ya que en donde vive existe una afluencia de turistas que disfrutan del paisaje y el hermoso lago de Atitlán. Estas dos actividades le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia.
Ahora él ha tomado la decisión de construir una cocina y para ello está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción como: block, hierro y cemento para poder construir. El préstamo lo pagara con los dos trabajos que cuenta.
Su sueño es sacar adelante a su hijo en sus estudios y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 43 years old and married. He lives together with his wife and 3 children who are 17, 19, and 21; two of which already graduated from a profession and the other still continues to study. Today they live in the department of Sololá.
Miguel is a man that looks for a way to move forward with his family. He makes traditional suits for a living as they are used by the community. This trade has generated good income and profits. He also drives a boat for a living because where he lives there is an influx of tourists that enjoy the scenery and the beautiful Lake Atitlán. These two trades have helped him to improve the economy of his family.
Now he has decided to construct a kitchen and for that he is requesting a credit of $400 to purchase construction materials like: blocks, iron and cement. He will pay the loan with the two jobs mentioned.
His dream is to move forward in life with his son in his studies and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and transfer it to the local traders

loans.name: José Horaldo

texts.es:
José es un hombre soltero de 24 años de edad, vive en unión de hecho con su pareja y  tienen un hijo recién nacido, actualmente viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es una persona que lucha por salir adelante, con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. El se dedica a manejar un vehículo para trasladar productos de un lugar a otro. Comenta que eligió esta actividad porque le gusta y además es mecánico. A través de la labor que realiza puede contribuir a la economía de su familia.
Ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para la compra de repuestos ya que su vehículo ya necesita mantenimiento, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo nuevo con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y así  mejorar la  calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and unmarried. He lives in a civil union with his partner and they have a newborn baby boy. They currently live in the Sololá area. He is a person who strives to move forward with the goal of improving his family's living conditions. He drives a vehicle to move products from one location to another. He chose this work because he likes it and is also a mechanic. Through this work he can contribute to his family's finances. 

José is applying for a loan of Q 5,500.00 to buy spare parts because his vehicle needs maintenance. This way he can increase his income and provide a better service to his customers. His dream is to buy a new vehicle in order to further increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Frances Carmina

texts.en:
Frances offers snacks such as fishballs, kikiam (fried pork rolls), and siomai (dumplings). She has been running this kind of business for almost two years and earns a minimum of PHP 500-700 a week.

Right now, Frances needs additional capital to buy more products to sell, so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fishballs, kikiam, squid balls, and chicken balls. She hopes through her requested loan amount she will be able to obtain better profits so she can secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fishballs, kikiam (fried pork rolls), squid balls, and chicken balls to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry meat for her business.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora is 39 years old and she lives in Kadjaran city in the Syunik region. She is married and she has two sons; the elder one is a student of Kapan State Polytechnic Institute in the paid division and the smallest son is still school-aged. Eleonora’s husband works as a welder at the Kadjaran combine, but he also has a very specific gift of healing by massaging people with spinal problems. Eleonara also works; she works at the café as a cook. As she says they hardly manage to care for all the needs of their family and their son’s tuition fee has become the most urgent problem among the others and they now greatly hope to be supported by Kiva lenders.
Eleonora asks a loan of 200.000 Armenian drams in order to pay her son’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in Dashtavan village of the Ararat region. She is a farmer with many years of experience running a farm. She lives with her husband, father-in-law and three children (ages 19, 18 and 16 years old). She also owns greenhouse where she cultivates greens and sells in the local open markets. Gayane has now applied for this loan to purchase potato seed, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. The loan will be a great assistance for Gayane's farm and she will be able to increase her agricultural income.

loans.use: to pay for potato seed, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase an additional stock of Barley products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP to buy an additional stock of Barley products. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Felicisima hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional stock of Barley products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (seasonal fruits and vegetables) and settle the balance of a current loan.

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
Wiguna Merta group has succeeded to repay the loan. Most of the group members maintain sows and sell piglets. Because they are selling the piglets at the same time, the price of piglets becomes cheap. Ni Nengah, as the new head of the group, feels the same thing. Luckily, she has additional business as a farmer so she does not lack for her everyday needs. Ni Nengah and all members of Wiguna Merta group agreed to continue lending and changing the methods of raising pigs to increase the selling price.

The Wiguna Merta group continues its loan. In addition to developing the business by buying piglets, the money will also used to buy pigs food and to fix the cages. From the previous loan, they can save for venture capital. The new loan is being used to develop the business. All members of the group feel very grateful for these loans because they can develop the businesses and generate revenue to improve the welfare of their families.
The head of the group decided to resign after she got enough profit to use as capital and will run the her business by herself. She’s been replaced with Ni Nengah.

Ni Nengah will buy two super quality piglets and feed. She plans to keep pigs for fattening. Ni Nengah thank MUK, Kiva and the lenders because they support the development of the business and improvement of the welfare of her family.

One member can't attend the meeting because of sickness.

loans.use: to buy two super quality piglets and feed.

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
Maro is 56 years old and she lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Maro now lives with her retired mother and school-aged daughter. Maro has a specialty of music and for several years she worked at the local Culture house. Despite having such an interesting and nice specialty, Maro continued her work experience in entirely different fields. For several years she worked at the car repair factory as a controller and at this moment she works simultaneously in two places in the Kapan combine and at the military police as a hygienist. 

At the same time, Maro, together with her husband, is engaged in agricultural activities in the village Arajadzor, where they cultivate vegetables and fruits mainly for their family use. Her husband has a tractor and he does different hired works for the villagers. Maro says that his husband is rather skilled in this work and it brings very good income to their family.

Now Maro asks for a loan of 350,000 Armenian Drams since some parts of their tractor are out of order and it needs to be repaired as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to repair her tractor.

loans.name: Mayrose

texts.en:
Mayrose is 25 years old and from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 1, 3 and 8. Her husband is a barber. Mayrose has been operating a Sari-sari store business where she sells to the locals grocery items such as shampoo, bath soap, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and chips.

She is asking for a loan of 24,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks, chips, cooking oil, shampoo, coffee and bath soap. This business helps Mayrose in meeting the needs of her children in terms of food and school fees.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and more items to sell at an affordable price. She also dreams of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, chips, cooking oil, shampoo, coffee and bath soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts and butter for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Jerecson

texts.en:
Jerecson is 23 years old and has been engaged in fishing in the town of Talibon, Bohol for four years now. Jerecson is a married man with two children ages three and five. It is his dream to continue his business and even improve it for a bigger income.

Jerecson also plans to renovate his house and is requesting for a loan to buy wood, nails and pay for labor. He knows that his family deserves a comfortable place to stay and he is confident that his income from fishing will allow him to pay for their needs. 

In the future, he would like to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 34-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as attentive to detail. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in strategic place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of space for expansion. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients to make food to sell. Her business goal is to own a big restaurant within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
58-year-old Saturnina is a resident of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has five grown children. Her husband is a farmer but sometimes what they have is not enough. Saturnina is hopeful that with her sari-sari (general store) business, she can help with the daily expenses. In her store she sell basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. 

She is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy more stocks of canned food, noodles, seasoning, shampoo, coffee and toothpaste. Saturnina hopes that with an additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business and make it more sustainable.

In the future, she plans to expand her store and aim for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy canned food, noodles, seasoning, shampoo, coffee and toothpaste.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 31-year-old resident of Kasasa LC1 zone. He is married to Angella and they have three children they are looking after. Hassane has a retail shop dealing in general foodstuffs and other household items. He started this business seven years ago as a source of income after he had failed to find a job. He started this business as a way of supporting his family since he is the bread-winner of the entire family.

Hassane’s business is strategically located but his major challenge is inadequate capital which doesn’t enable him buy enough stock for his business which also hinders its growth and expansion hence he is requesting to be funded. 

His neighbours recommended him for being a hardworking, determined and supportive person in society.

loans.use: To buy retail stock for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy education equipment.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is 50 years old and he lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Aramayis is married and he has two sons; his elder one is already married and has a son. They live all together with great love and care for each other. 

Aramayis and his younger son work at the Mine Enrichment Combine and his elder son works at the Rescue service as a rescuer. His daughter-in-law is a housewife and she takes care of their house and all of them. This family, without any conditions of gorgeous life, with their not big family income lives happily and thankfully. As Aramayis says he is a very happy father since both of his sons are good men, clever and honest people. Now his smaller son has a beautiful bride and he wants to get engaged.

Aramayis asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian Drams in order to organize his son’s engagement party, to buy nice gifts for his son and his bride.

loans.use: to organize his son’s engagement party, to buy nice gifts for his son and his bride.

loans.name: Marco Fidel

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre trabajador, activo y con visión emprendedora, tiene 56 años de edad, 30 de ellos dedicados a trabajar como fabricante y comercializador de calzado para dama, tiene un taller de talabartería ubicado cerca de su vivienda y los ingresos que genera con su labor, son destinados a solventar los gastos familiares.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar hormas para sandalias de niña y materiales al por mayor (cuero, sintéticos, pegante, adornos) esto le permitirá introducir nuevos productos a su portafolio para expandir su mercado y generar mejores ventas, logrando tener una estabilidad económica favorable para su familia.
Marco siempre se ha caracterizado por el bienestar de la sociedad que lo rodea, por ellos sueña con enseñar su oficio a los jóvenes del sector para que ellos se forjen su futuro y puedan establecer pequeñas unidades productivas, esto significaría mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como de las demás personas que influyan en esta labor.
texts.en:
Marco is a hardworking and active man with an entrepreneurial vision.  He is 56 years old, and thirty of those years he has worked as a cobbler, making and selling women’s footwear.  He has a leather goods workshop located near his home.  The income he earns from his work is earmarked to take care of the family expenses.

With the objective of strengthening his business, he is asking for the support of a loan to buy forms/molds for girls’ sandals and materials in bulk (leather, synthetics, adhesive, and decorative elements).  This will allow him to introduce new products to his line in order to expand his market and generate better sales.  He can achieve a positive financial stability for his family.

Marco has always been known for the well-being of the community that surrounds him.  It is on their behalf that he dreams of teaching his trade to the young people in his area, so that they can shape their future and can set up small production lines.  This would mean an improvement in the quality of life for his family as well as the other people whom he influences with his work.

loans.use: to buy forms for girls' sandals and materials in bulk (leather, synthetics, adhesive, decorative elements)

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 40-years-old. He lives in Kadjaran city which is in the Syunik region. He is married and he has two school-aged sons. His wife works at the local school as a teacher of Armenian History. Ara graduated from Yerevan State Polytechnic University and from 1996 until now he works in Kadjaran using his specialty - he is a drilling master. The house where Ara and his family lives lately has been a little bit repaired.

Now Ara asks for a loan of 840,000 Armenian drams since he wants to buy furniture for their living room, kitchen and children’s bedroom to make their house more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Geghi village with her family. Her husband works at the village hall and her children attend school. Emma herself is involved in agriculture. She keeps cows, calves, chickens and colonies of bees. The gathered milk and meat is sold in Kapan and Yerevan towns' open markets and the family gathers income. 

Emma is a hard-working and responsible woman who does her best to help her husband and sustain her family's living conditions. 

Emma is now applying for this loan to be able to increase her farm. Particularly she plans to purchase a cow, six calves and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will greatly assist Emma to enlarge her agricultural turnover and she will be very grateful for that.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, six calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is married with one child. Soledad is 49 years old and lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Soledad buy and sells tobacco to earn a living, and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 40,000 for additional capital buy more tobacco to sell.

Soledad has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Soledad hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more tobacco to sell/retail

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Baara vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de lait, de grains, de la restauration, d’habillement et des cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire.
